text:
We decided to O+O Pizza a try since we are fans of Olive & Oak. We went during the week to avoid what we thought would be crowds. We ordered the handmade toasted ravioli which we extremely tasty and I would stack up against any handmade ravioli on the Hill. Next we split the Caesar salad with hot croutons and I would stay that this was great as well. Lastly we decided on a pizza since this is (should be) their specialty since it's in their name, we were extremely DISPOINTED in this. We found this supposedly New Haven style pizza to be terrible, the pizza crust was soggy especially in the middle. I am not sure if they have not fine-tuned their recipe or need a better pizza oven or are afraid of a little charred crust, but they need to work on cooking the pie all the way through and need to perfect this if they want to keep "Pizza" in the name.

The drinks as at Olive & Oak were excellent. I did feel that the wine by the glass was overpriced for the tiny pour they give you.
If I go back, I would stay away from the pizza and stick with some of the pasta dishes instead.

My review is solely based on the above and did not factor in anything I mention below, which would have lowered it even further.

Okay we have dined at several restaurants in past three months since we are trying to support as many businesses as possible, but this place was a first with regard to COVID precautions. They require customers to put their mask on each time a waitress or any employee approaches you table. I understand the need to be careful, but this is overkill and very annoying for the table, stopping in mid bite to put your mask on or just constantly trying to pay attention to what the employees are doing in case they come near your table is not a relaxing night out. As customers, we all understand the risk associated with dining out and if we are in your restaurant we are comfortable with that risk. If you as a restaurant or your employees are fearful then; 1) DO Not OPEN, 2) Do not come to work if you are an employee, or 3) Protect you staff further with either face shields or even have them put on fully biohazard suits (this is overkill, but so is putting mask on and off 20 times during a night out).
name: O+O Pizza

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
We stopped in for drinks only at O+O Pizza last night to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday, and had ML and Kyle take outstanding care of us! The cocktail menu is amazing, and ML and Kyle are talented and welcoming. They even made a tasty non-alcoholic concoction for our 17 year old. I never noticed O+O has non-alcoholic mixed drinks on the menu. Brilliant! And all four of our drinks were as beautiful as they were tasty. Thanks for making the end of our celebration special!

While I'm reviewing, we've dined in and ordered curbside from O+O several times in the last year. The food at O+O Pizza is absolutely DELICIOUS! The eggplant parmesan is to die for - thinly sliced pieces of eggplant stacked instead of one thick slice elevates the dish. (I'm sure there's a lot more to what makes it so darn good than just the way they slice it.) Every time we go in or order curbside from O+O, I almost always get the eggplant parm, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything you order. Some other of my top picks are the lobster rigatoni and the shaved brussel sprout salad.
name: O+O Pizza

They are right next-door to a little carry out soup dumpling place to that I think they own as well.  My sister and I brought our sons for their high school graduation dinner with our families and it was a huge success!  You order family-style and everybody takes some of everything. They don't serve alcohol but you can bring your own bottles of wine and there is just a small uncorking fee.  I 100% would recommend and I can't wait to go again!

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
Brought my 89-year-old mom to try this hidden restaurant, located INSIDE a large grocery store (Pan-Asian Market) and not advertised. It's on the right, near and beyond the register area.

Many tables for 4, very close together, which we thought was odd  since the store requires masks--no exceptions-- except while eating. 

They have a limited but great selection of traditional Vietnamese and only a few Chinese dishes, which belies the name, but we came for Vietnamese, so we were happy.

Order at the counter (they do a big takeout business, too), sit and be served. Pay at time of ordering. Get your own utensils, napkins, sauces before sitting.

Quick service (at 11 AM...got a lot busier by 11:30, and several were waiting to pick up as we left).

My mom wanted the crispy fried egg noodles with shrimp (diners have choices among 4 proteins or mixed) that she grew to love (at the defunct Kim Son in U City), and the description (#15) seemed to be that, but it wasn't. 

She did like it, however, and the portion was so large that we took home enough for her to add more fish and get 3-4 more meals, totaling 5 for her tiny appetite, for under $12!

As a beef pho fan and connoisseur since having had many hundreds of bowls in the CA Bay Area, in St. Louis  Seattle, Los Angeles, and elsewhere since 2002, I ordered the sliced beef #1), large, with extra basil (disappointed that they charged $1 for that extra...costs about 10 cents...). 

Ate my fill and brought home enough for 1 more meal (added some shiitake mushrooms during reheating, with even more fresh basil and cilantro), also for under $12. 

It was delicious both times, with plenty of flavor, beef, noodles and broth.

We'll be back. Mom wants to try the duck.
name: China Bistro

text:
Just a warning for those who have an aversion to cigarette smoke: avoid this place like the plague. Nothing memorable in terms of food. I found the burgers to be just okay. The only thing that stood out to me here was there fried pickles which are cut very thinly and then battered. As for the pizzas, they are very thin and bland.

Overall, the menu is very limited (mainly pizzas and burgers, but what can you expect? It's a bar). Bobby's doesn't distinguish itself from other bars although it is located in a nice area. There are the typical game slot machines near the entrance of the building and a few tv's scattered throughout. If you're looking for a place to socialize and drink beer, this place will do. Cheers!
name: Bobby's Place

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
We made reservations for Clover and the Bee, but they're currently only seating people in the sister restaurant called O+O pizza. 

The ambience: the floral motifs on walls, quiet environment, makes it a good place to have a long chat with friends. They're extremely strict with their COVID policy, you have to wear a mask every time the server approaches your table ( upto 10 times, to take orders for drinks/ apps, check on us, serve dishes, settle the bill etc). I respect that. I did not mind wearing and removing my mask in the middle of my meal that often, too much, but if it can kill your buzz, this is not the place for you. After a couple of drinks, it can get a little irritating for some folks.

The drinks: The torino sour: Decent, I'd give it a 7/10. Can't go wrong with gin and lemon.
Spiced pear sangria: oh my goodness! This warm cup filled me up. The only hot alcoholic drink I've had before, has been a hot toddy or cider. This was a pleasant surprise. It's hot and sour with a hint of pear. 
There was a mocktail with turmeric and ginger,the name is slipping from my mind, but it was the most unique flavorful drink I've ever had!

Fried gnocchi: The mix of the crunch and soft center is pleasing, it's a light appetizer which pairs well with our drinks.

Rigatoni: Yummy! This warm creamy pasta was split for the two of us, and the portion was more than enough. The sauce is seasoned well, the Rigatoni melts in your mouth, and the small pieces of lobster make the whole dish smell and taste absolutely divine!

Margherita pizza: This was so underwhelming :(. It was too salty, the texture of the thin crust was hard, there was barely any cheese. We couldnt bear to have more than half a slice. The only reason why I'm deducting a star for the review. 

My friends had the halibut with Cesar salad, which they really enjoyed as well. 

We topped everything off with the famous Clover and Bee Tiramisu. This is definitely one of the best Tiramisu you can find in St. Louis. Makes you forget how terrible the pizza was, and makes my decision to give the place 3 stars, 4 instead.
name: O+O Pizza

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
I and most wouldn't say that St. Louis is particularly known for its Asian food, but Private Kitchen is probably one of the most authentic options for good Chinese food in St. Louis. The restaurant is a whole six tables large, and operates on a reservation only basis. For us Americans, the restaurant can be contacted via Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/privatekitchenstl/?fref=ts) or phone number. And if you have a WeChat, apparently they do reservations through there as well. While making the reservation, you also pre-order from the menu and they purchase the ingredients beforehand (most dishes can also be ordered during dinner, but some, like Peking duck, require ~3 day advance notice). Communication is a lot easier if you or someone you're with speaks Chinese and can handle reservations and ordering.

I've been a couple times, both with a smaller group and larger group of people. I'd say it's better to go family style with a larger group of people, since there are so many good dishes and you'll want to try them all. 

You'll definitely want to try the Peking duck, along with the XLB soup dumplings. I usually end up ordering some sort of vegetable dish (can't go wrong with most), and another meat dish.

The prices aren't cheap, but in an area where it seems that exceptional Asian food is hard to come by, Private Kitchen is definitely worth the visit.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
Amazing, one of a kind experience. The food is to die for, especially the beef in chefs sauce and the pork soup dumplings. Ginger crab was super fresh but was a little messy to eat at the table. We also enjoyed the fried rice with pieces of baby shrimp and spam. The dessert was a little bowl filled with fruit flavored yogurt and vanilla ice cream. At the end of the meal, all plates were totally wiped clean. 

As the other reviews say, you need to text the phone number listed on their Facebook page and decide your menu in advance. Frankly I think it made for a smooth dinner with efficient service since the lady serving us knew exactly what we wanted and in what order. She was polite and quick to fill our water glasses. Would love to come back and try additional dishes.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
Hands down one of the best Gyro restaurants I have ever eaten at! The owners are incredible and are investing in our community with their multiple locations. I have been eating at their original location, located in Soulard (go figure), since 2014 and have never had a bad meal! 

My go to is the Chicken Gyro or Chicken Gyro salad. Their Chicken meat is absolutely amazing and is tenders, juicy, and sliced perfectly. This was my first time getting it at their SoCo location and it tastes just as great as the Soulard one. We also got their Roasted Red Pepper Hummus and it is amazing as well. 

If you are looking for a great place to eat or grab something quick and good to go, head to Soulard Gyro now! You won't be disappointed!
name: Soulard Gyro

text:
Got O&O for V-day carryout because we wanted a less expensive and easier to transport meal than Olive & Oak.

We started with the meatballs and the gnocchi apps. Holy smokes, the gnocchi was the best thing we ate.  Served with pork belly in a rosemary cider cream sauce, I could have most likely eaten this as my entree.  Gnocchi was pillowy and whole dish was stellar and complex.  The polenta and ragu that was served with the meatballs was also tasty but I felt that the meatball texture was off, a big spongy, too tightly packed.

The Caesar salad was tasty though the croutons were more like large pieces of crispy bread.  Tasted great but were challenging to eat as a part of the salad.

While it's O&O Pizza, we didn't actually get pizza...  For entrees we tried the lobster rigatoni and the agnolotti.  The rigatoni was a surprise favorite.  My husband was suspect of lobster in his pasta, but upon tasting it, we both agreed it was a fantastic dish.  The calabrian chilies added a bit of spice that cut the richness from the cream sauce. There was also a surprisingly hefty portion of lobster, yay!  The agnolotti was a miss.  The pasta was great but the garlic butter sauce and the sun-dried tomatoes added zero flavor.  I would like to see this pasta preparation revamped.  Slap some of that rosemary cider cream on them! 

All in all, good price for the quality of the food, easy ordering app and curbside pick-up. Would definitely try again, especially for the gnocchi!
name: O+O Pizza

categories: Restaurants, Chinese, Szechuan

text:
GEM.
This restaurant could exist anywhere in the US and still be a GEM, Asian population or not.  

First, it's reservation only. We failed to note that and ended up at Wonton King on our first try. Nbd. But you have to come here! The restaurant is small and intimate, the reservation process is really personalized like it's super fancy (but it's really the most janky system ever), tablecloths and presentation suggest a more "upscale" experience, but it's actually SO. HOMEY. I love it. The wife in the front chit chatting and the husband cooking in the back. It could be a street stall in China if it weren't for the more superficial and decorative aspects of it all.

So. You gotta look up their number on facebook, and text them. If you can speak Chinese, type in Chinese. The wife isn't super comfortable with English, and I overheard her saying she ignores phone calls during service hours so the husband/chef can take them later, and they are much friendlier over text in Chinese too and it will make the reso process so much easier/faster.

Their menu is also on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/privatekitchenstl no website), so you just scroll through that and type in your order via text. We didn't get a confirmation or anything. No one even asked for our name. But we just showed up and they knew. It's all good.

As for what to eat... This was the best Xiao Long Bao I've had like EVER. I have eaten them in China and in the US all over, and these are delicious. Perfect texture and flavor filling, and perfectly delicate skin. Can't get them in Chicago. Can't get them in NYC or China or any Ding Tai Fung without a long ass wait. Next time we come, we are ordering just dumplings. Come here if only for that.

Whole steamed fish is a very traditional, simple preparation w/ scallion and ginger and soy that I enjoy making at home, but they do it very well here without you having to go through the pains of finding a fish that's fresh and keeping it so. 

The only misses we had were Kung pao chicken (weird chocolaty taste and texture) and the pork ribs (too sweet).  The kung pao, some may appreciate for the new take though. Ribs I wouldn't recommend. 

Very excited to see what else they have to offer in our four years here. I'm sure we'll be back many times.
name: Private Kitchen

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
Made reservations a week out because we couldn't get into Olive + Oak on such short notice and figured we'd give this a shot.

We started with the arancini and Caesar salad, which were great.  The arancini in particular was the best I've ever had.

For dinner we had the lobster rigatoni and the OG pepperoni pizza.  Both were absolutely amazing.  My wife asked how spicy the rigatoni was before ordering, and they volunteered to make it less spicy.  It was a great service touch, and wasn't too spicy for her lightweight self at all.

The pizza had a good deal of spice which was more in my wheelhouse.  The crust was very thin and light, and the toppings were insanely tasty.  The mozzarella blend they used made me never want to go back to regular pizza cheese again.

As great as the food was, the drinks were also top notch.  We tried the Sing to Me Paulo, Poison Apple and Can't Wake Up, and all were wonderful cocktails.

This has definitely made it into our restaurant rotation!
name: O+O Pizza

text:
Here's what I ordered for my first visit to Soulard Gyro: Lamb and beef gyro, chicken bacon ranch gyro, Greek fries covered in feta, and baklava for dessert.

There is a hand written sign at the front counter offering 2 different types of tzatziki: one sweet and one spicy. I was bummed that the cashier didn't ask which option I preferred on my lamb and beef gyro. The sauce just wasn't that flavorful.

The fries needed some seasoning. I think they were only topped with feta, but there was a lot of feta, which was appreciated. They have several ketchup bottles near the soda fountain that you can bring to your table.

As a weirdo that doesn't really prefer to eat gyros, I ordered the chicken bacon ranch gyro. It still had the same shaved meat on it, but instead of tzatziki, it came with ranch. Super delicious and exactly what I wanted.

I wish the baklava was a bit softer and had more honey, but it was still delicious and the perfect way to finish the meal.

Parking is in a shared lot in a strip mall next to Schnucks. The section of parking near the restaurant was full around lunch time. But there is adjacent parking.

The tables have markers on them letting you know if the table has been sanitized. This relies on the customers to flip the marker to the "dirty" side. We did see some dirty tables that were marked "clean" but that is customer error and not necessarily restaurant error. It did make me feel like they took cleanliness seriously.
name: Soulard Gyro

text: I've been to O+O Pizza twice to have dinner with my family. As the only vegan in the family, I have a very very hard time finding options, ordering food, and receiving the right order. There simply aren't any options. The first time I went, I asked if they had vegan cheese and was told they "haven't figured out how to melt vegan cheese". There are over a handful of restaurants that do pizza with vegan cheese. The second time I went to O+O it was a disaster. I ordered the Chopped Salad without some ingredients, no cheese, and a different dressing. I made sure our waitress was aware I was vegan. She was extremely understanding and confirmed that the dressing would be changed after checking with the kitchen. However, I got my salad with shredded cheese and the original dressing. After asking for it to be changed, I got lettuce with lentils and the same dressing. I want to emphasize that the customer service was good, but the communication with the kitchen or something was just awful. Overall, the experience is simply frustrating and makes me want to convince my family to go anywhere but to O+O Pizza.
name: O+O Pizza

text:
Make sure to bring an extra pair of underwear.  The food here is good enough to make you cream your shorts. 

Hands down best best gyro I've ever had.  Tzatziki is nice and light and doesn't overpower the meat.  The meat is sliced paper thin and spiced perfectly and is wrapped in a perfectly made pita.  Honestly, it's not the flavor that sets this place but the absolute perfect execution of texture.  

If you are in town, this is a must try.
name: Soulard Gyro

text:
10 starts for O + O Pizza!

1. Be sure to make reservations online before arriving!  They are offering indoor and patio dining right now.

2. The staff were all amazing!  Our server was kind, polite, funny, and very well informed about the menu.

3.  Extensive cocktail menu including craft cocktails, craft beer (bottled, canned, draft), and wines.  

4.  FOOD WAS AMAZING!  Olive + Oak did it again!  We started with the fried gnocchi, best starter I've ever ordered.  We then decided to share a chopped and Cesar salad.  The kitchen staff split the salads for us, so that our  plate had 1/2 of each.  Such a great touch!  Then we shared the classic pepperoni pizza....warning, it does have a bit of a kick, but was well worth it!  Came out out hot, crisp, and delicious!

Highly recommend trying this new spot out!
name: O+O Pizza

text: Hungry on a Tuesday night, we stopped by for a bite to eat. Perfect bar-like setting. Great service from our waitress. I ordered a "fruity martini"- no drink menu. We also ordered the crab Rangoon appetizer and a steak sandwich. The drink was perfect, not too sweet, not to strong. More carb Rangoon on my plate (7) than most places serve. I was very upset when my husband ate the last one when I wasn't looking. He really enjoyed the fries and the steak of course. Lots of TVs with everything imaginable playing. Huge patio. They even had corn hole games in the parking lot as we were leaving. My only complaint was the smoky smell. When we attempted to escape that issue on the patio, it was worse. That's what patios are for though. We sat in a booth on the far side of the room without any issues. Our waitress informed us they just put out a new menu. Wish they had a dessert menu.
name: Bobby's Place

text: We had dinner with friends at O+O Pizza.  The service was wonderful!  However, they should be ashamed to even put pizza in their name.  If you liked Chef Boyaredee Pizza growing up, then you'll relive great memories.  The pizza did not have enough sauce and hardly any mozzarella cheese.  There was plenty of almost powdered Parmesan, so much that you could feel the texture of it on your tongue.  All the salads are $15 and way too much for even two people.  Why not offer a dinner sized salad?  One person in our party said the toasted ravioli was delicious, and the small plate of gnocchi was very good.  The best part of our meal was the wine and the bread.  This restaurant needs to take some lessons from The Salvage Yard on Hampton--one of the best pizzas in St. Louis!
name: O+O Pizza

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
My first visit definitely won't be my last.  As other reviewers have stated, this "restaurant" is a small counter inside the Pan-Asia supermarket at Manchester and 141 (next to Academy).  The only reason I knew it was there was because I was searching for Ramen and Ramen Tei is closed on Tuesdays, so I was searching Yelp and Google for a replacement for my noodle fix.  I have never been in the supermarket and I really wanted to explore while waiting for my food.  We arrived at about 6 and the sign posted said they closed at 7 (different from Yelp that says 6:30).  We were a little cautious with our first order and ordered the #9 plain fried rice with beef and #17 Stir fried Egg noodles for the kids, and I ordered the #20 Beef Stew thick noodle soup.  The ordering process was pretty simple and I was asked to order by number, although be prepared that they do run out of things.  I tried to order the #16 beef chow fun but they were out, and diners after me were told that they ran out of fried rice, white rice, and some other items as we got closer to closing time.  The operation is not super slick, but you are getting good food from good people so be kind and be patient.  My food took a full 44 minutes from order to walking out, but I think part of the reason for the long wait is that they get very confused about who ordered what because they don't write order numbers or what the food is on the containers.  I think I saw my food walk out a couple of times with people who ordered after me, lol!  I think next time I may dine in becasue I think priority is given to dine-in orders and the dishes get less "lost" because they are in real dishes instead of stacked together in anonymous styrofoam and are brought to the table as soon as they are made. 

When we got home, we dug in and the food was very delicious and certainly worth a little wait.  The beef in the fried rice was lean and good quality and the rice was delicious (heavy on the bean sprouts which my daughter didn't love but were easily picked out).  The Stir fried egg noodles were a very thin noodle with big chunks of fluffy scrambled egg, plus some onion, carrot, and maybe bean sprouts.  They were very plain but great for kids and easy to dress up with condiments.  Also, when I say "plain", it still had better flavor than most noodles I have gotten at other places that just taste like soy sauce.   My beef stew was outstanding!  It had a very rich, dark broth that had a tiny bit of spiciness and I think was stewed with onion and mushroom, with a nice sheen that made me feel like it had been made with real beef with real fat that seeped into the broth.  I got a huge quart container full of that delicious broth and a huge clamshell full of fat noodles, with a small amount of bok choi, carrot, and some spring onion.  Not a lot of veg but a massive amount of food.  Put together, the broth and the noodles were perfection and I loved every bite!  Such an amazing soup and I am definitely getting it next time I am sick because I think it would cure me immediately!

I can't wait to go back and try more things!  Everything I saw looked so delicious.  Maybe I'll call ahead next time or try to eat in.
name: China Bistro

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
My boyfriend and I went to private kitchen for our anniversary and absolutely loved it!!! Such a small and intimate restaurant with a great menu of authentic Chinese dishes. I would give it 5 stars but the food we had would be about a 4 and dying to go back and try more. 

We ordered the soup dumplings, the squirrel fish, the ginger crab, and ice cream pot. The soup dumplings!!!!! Is such a must and actually one of the best I've had in the country. So flavorful and even ordered a second batch. They are so addicting and they pair it with the rice wine vinegar as well. Just writing this now, I am craving them!! They have a pork option and a crab one and both were so good. I think I liked the crab more but both equally as flavorful and so yummy. 

The ginger crab is HUGE!!! And so freaking good. Seasoned and flavored so well and both left us stuffffed. Idk where they got these crabs but they were probably the size of my head and plenty of meat inside. It is definitely pricey but so worth. 

Unfortunately, the squirrel fish was a miss for us, which leaves me to write a 4 star review. we asked for the sauce on the side to not get the fish soggy, but the fish itself was quiet bland and the sauce was pretty subtle as well. It wasn't our favorite and probably will not order again. It is pretty pricey too so we wished we had gotten something else but it is presented in a unique way. 

But overall, great date night spot. you MUST make a reservation so make sure you do before arriving! They only have about 4-6 tables in the restaurant to keep it intimate and fast service so it is understandable. Service was great and we really enjoyed ourselves. A must try!!
name: Private Kitchen

text: I have been eyeing the reviews and picture for this restaurant for at least a year now, and I requested to go here with my husband for our very late Valentine's dinner. Like the other reviews state, a reservation is required, and you will need to text in your full order prior to 4pm the day before your reservation based on the menus posted on the restaurant's Facebook page. (2 days' notice is required if you want the duck.) We knew nothing about plate sizes, so we ordered several items to make sure there was enough to eat. We had the entire restaurant to ourselves for the entire meal because there were no other reservations. Ordering in advance ensures the food is fresh and ready at the reservation time. They started bringing out the food at our reservationt time; I should mention that the waitress was very kind and kept our water filled without being overly attentive. She made sure we had a lot of time to just enjoy one another's company and the meal. We started off with the pork soup dumplings; we never had them before... I had to Google how to eat them correctly, honestly, but they were incredible! Our entrees came out next with a side of rice. My whole fried fish with sweet & sour sauce was incredible fresh, delicate, and was fried expertly; it was not the least bit greasy. My husband got the asparagus beef, and it was cooked perfectly with a sweet, flavorful sauce. We shared the Chinese broccoli stir fry, which was refeshingly bitter, which was a nice contrast to the slightly sweet sauce it was coated with. We also shared some mushroom soup that was served in a huge amount and piping hot. I was not as fond of the soup due to the very mild flavor, but my husband really enjoyed it. We will certainly be returning in the future to try more menu items.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
This review is mostly for the food, which is among the most authentic in all of St. Louis. Here is a dish by dish breakdown (no pics cuz we devoured everything asap!): 

- Soup dumpling - 4.5/5. Paper-thin wrapping, fragrant filling with the perfect amount of soup in each dumpling. They are bite-sized but those bites will be among the most delicious you'll ever take. 

- Lion head meatball - 3/5. Generous amount of meat per serving, but tasted a little bland. Comes floating in a bowl of watery, flavorless broth.

- Squirrel fish - 3.5/5. Visually stunning, drizzled in sweet and sour sauce. It's a whole fish that's been flayed and cubed with all the meat still attached and then deep fried. Wasn't my cup o' tea (or cup o' fish) but it's certainly a crowd pleaser. 

- House beef in chef's sauce - 4/5. Gorgeous plating with a tiny figurine of a bull. Sauce was deliciously savory with a hint of sweetness, but a little heavy-handed for my taste. After a few bites it started to get a little salty, but definitely worth trying. 

- Peking duck - 4/5. Meat is well cooked, tender, with perfectly crisped skin. Served with steam buns, sliced scallions, and plum sauce to make your own little duck buns. This is really the highest rating I can bestow to Peking duck in the US, having eaten the real deal in Beijing which has forever ruined me. 

- Three ingredient vegetables - 3.5/5. And FYI the 3 veggies are eggplant, bell pepper, and potato. Stir fried in a slightly spicy brown sauce, it's quite a tasty dish, but again just a tad salty. 


At the risk of sounding repetitive, it is imperative that you text the phone number on their fb page ahead of time to not only reserve a table but also place your order. 

It will be a struggle if no one in your group can speak/text fluent Mandarin. Thankfully hubby was up for the task, as my broken Chinglish just wasn't gonna cut it. 

Service is limited to bringing you food and check; the experience is mainly for the food. They don't serve liquor here but I believe my group was able to bring our own for a small fee. 

Will update when I try their other dishes!
name: Private Kitchen

text: Warning: Do not bring  your own dessert to O + O pizza because you will be charged a $2 cutting fee per person even though the wait staff did nothing and we left zero dessert trash. What a joke!  We had delicious cocktails, apps, salad and pizza on the patio to celebrate my friends birthday. She opened up a few gifts from us and then I pulled out individual bundt cakes. As we were enjoying the desserts, an employee(not our waitress) told us we would be charged a $2 per person cake cutting fee. The staff did nothing to help us with our dessert, we were never offered dessert, nor did we leave any remnants of our dessert on the table. The staff could of handled this very differently but what he did was screw his waitress out of $6 in tips. Please be upfront in the future, put the fee on your menu, approach your customers sooner with this charge. I am not sure if I will come back or not because I'm pretty bitter right now. Sorry O + O pizza you were a big disappointment in your customer service tonight.
name: O+O Pizza

categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Diners, Food, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Tried a new brunch place in the Saint Louis suburb of Clayton on a Sunday morning. There are two locations that are approximately 1.5 mile apart. 

Parking is off street or nearby parking garage. I elected for off street and the area was clean. I will note for whatever reason GPS gets confused finding the address. It's in an office building with restaurant on first floor. 

The restaurant is good size with a bar counter. Windows are along an entire side, so it bright and has a modern feel. Everything felt spic and span clean! 

My party arrived at approximately 9 AM to put the name down for 930 arrival. We were offered a private room. When everyone arrived shortly before 930 we were quickly greeted by the hostess and led to our room. Our waitress arrived within a few minutes and set up water crafts, coffee and napkins. 

In short time our hungry party put in orders. I believe everyone got something different. My order Country Fried steak with gravy, two eggs over easy with potatoes and toast. I really enjoyed. 

Approximately 20 minutes later food was on the table and timing was correct for everyone at the same time. My dish was very good. The coffee was excellent! Everyone else also really enjoyed. Service my our single female waitress was outstanding with follow up on food, refills on water and coffee. Price for the amount and quality about right. 

I think a 4.5 best suits them. There was no service errors. Our timing of being seated and food arrival was above average. The food taste was above average although not what I would call 5 star. Locating the diner was annoying, but not their fault. I will return next visit.
name: Kingside Diner

categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Diners, Food, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Kingside Diner is not your typical diner. It is an upscale diner, that serves delicious comfort food for both breakfast and lunch on the edge of downtown Clayton. It has a full service bar and they make one killer Spicy Bloody Mary that is always a go to for me. 

On my first visit I intended to order their, Slinger after seeing chef Eric preparing on TV. Come on, The Slinger is a St Louis classic breakfast, why wouldn't I give it a try? Then as I sat at the bar, I saw the pictures posted of their Damn Delicious and thought I'd give it a try. The server also shared with me that the DD was chef Eric's favorite. 

As I got ready to order, my attention went in another direction. I saw another picture posted here on Yelp of the Veggie Hash. I love Brussels Sprouts, so I was sold. I enjoyed a full plate of fresh, crisp sprouts covered with two eggs over easy. Delicious! I couldn't be totally healthy, I had to add a side of bacon and Hash Browns. 

My next visit I choose, Damn Delicious. The DD is very filling, it is a lot of food. They take two scrambled eggs with bacon and put it between a sliced croissant. They then smother that with sausage gravy, shredded cheddar and chives. If that isn't enough, it is served with a side of Hash Browns. I was so stuffed, I skipped lunch that day. 

I'll share a little secret with you, I prefer the Clayton location over the CWE. The service here is more personal and friendly. Veronica is a delight, excellent server. I also think the food is prepared and presented better.

Note - the address is on Bonhomme Ave, but you actually enter the restaurant on Brentwood. 

I'll be back? - Yes! Gotta try that Slinger

When: June 6 & 13, 2019
Why: Breakfast
name: Kingside Diner

text:
Our experience with Private Kitchen started a day before the actual meal since this place is reservation only. I browsed photos of their menu posted on their Facebook page and selected a couple of items I thought would be yummy. Then I texted 314-445-4605 to make a reservation.

There was some back and forth in terms of finalizing a time and then I sent them a message containing the menu items I wanted.

On the day of the meal, my girlfriend and I arrived  right on time for our reservation. A very nice lady wearing a mask led us to our table and got us some water. She then went out back and let the chef know that we had arrived. At that point we heard food getting fried and timers starting to go off in the kitchen. 

Service started with some amazing soup dumplings, pork and crab! Pretty comparable to soup dumplings I've had in NYC. Make sure you get the dumplings. Order extra if you think you have the appetite for it. I'm literally planning on getting more of these dumplings the next time I'm in town.

Once we finished the dumplings, our waitress brought out our next set of dishes, Beef (fried) in Chef's Special Sauce and some Stir Fried Chinese Broccoli accompanied by some rice. These two dishes were really awesome. The beef was very crispy and retained a nice beefy flavor despite being fried. It was coated in a salty sweet brown sauce that went well with the rice. The broccoli wasn't overly fried and was very light, I definitely recommend this dish to bring some balance to the meal.

As my girlfriend and I were wrapping up our second course, the waitress brought out the Peking Duck that we ordered. I was looking forward to this since it required you to order it a day or two in advance. I was pleasantly surprised to see the duck accompanied by some duck wraps rather than buns. The duck was served two ways. The breast was thinly sliced for the wraps and this preparation was served with thinly sliced spring onions and cucumbers along with a plum or hoisin sauce. The rest of the duck was chopped up and could be eaten with rice (we had ordered their Yangzhou special fried rice to accompany this second style of duck. The fried rice was really yummy!). Overall the duck was decent for what you get in America but it wasn't a strong point of the meal. The meat could've been more flavored and the duck skin was lacking a strong crisp you'd expect from Peking duck. The preparation was beautiful though and if you need to feed a large group this might be a good dish to order.

Lastly, we finished up with ice cream served with a potted plant. It was basically strawberry yogurt and vanilla ice cream topped with a chocolate crumb and a flower so that it actually looks like a potted plant. This wasn't anything special but it was cute and I thought my girlfriend would like the novelty of it.

Overall the food is really great and they didn't let that many customers in at once so it really felt like they were just dedicating the entire restaurant to us. It's a really special experience knowing that the chef is working hard solely for you. The service was good and it felt like a Chinese friend I never had, had invited me over so that their family could cook for me.
name: Private Kitchen

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
Don't let the name fool you--O+O Pizza offers so much more! I'm not downplaying the pizza at all; it's delicious. But take a look at other menu items. 

The Starters menu has some similar items to Olive + Oak. The Octopus Corzetti is amazing. Tender pieces of octopus served over thick pasta slices is decadent. The red wine and tomato lend a great deal of flavor.

At my last visit I tried the Seared Scallops. These are an amazing summer dish. The scallops were seared to perfection and served over a corn puree with tomatoes and micro greens. So yummy!

The beverage menu is also outstanding. From house created cocktails to an approachable wine list, there is something for everyone--including NA spritzs. 

Bottom line O+O Pizza is a great family friendly restaurant with top quality food and service.
name: O+O Pizza

text: Every single dish is meticulously done in the right way and it is THE most authentic Chinese cooking I've had in the states. I grew up in a city that is very close to Shanghai and the dishes out of this kitchen made me feel like I was home. The crispy and sweet and savory fish (a cold dish) was the perfect way to start off the dinner. Then came the lamb chops, 5 star for the presentation. I would've liked maybe a couple more pieces but oh well. The boyfriend loved the lamb, it was so tender and seasoned very well. The Chinese broccolini was done perfectly with just right amount of crushed garlic and oyster sauce. The star of the dinner was the Peking Duck. Wow wow wow wow wow. I know it seems pricey but it is worth it!! Skin was perfectly crispy and the meat tender and well seasoned. My picky boyfriend loved every single thing. The service was great, kept us in the loop as to when the chef was putting the duck in the oven. We will definitely be back.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
3 star 

We are a bit disappointed after our visit of Private Kitchen, given the raving reviews I have read. Considering the poor service and the quality of the food, it is really overpriced.

Service is really lacking. We stood at the door for 15 mins before getting seated, even with the reservation already been made. Since there were only 2 person working,  the server disappeared most times, except for the times they delivered the food and give us the bill.

The food is decent for most part but the quality and portion of the dishes not match up with the price they charged. More importantly, the rice is a bit cold -- seems like it has been left out for a while. The food didnt come in the right order either. 

Will I go back again? Perhaps but not in a hurry.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
There are a total of 6 tables in this entire restaurant. They range from a 2 person table to a large party of 10-12. This is a reservation only restaurant. It is also helpful if you speak Mandarin b/c my Cantonese/broken Mandarin did no justice here. 

I wouldn't call this place upscale - but it is better than your average take out place with some linens. They use wine glasses for water (odd). There is only 1 cook (the husband) and 1 server (the wife). You must place your reservation and order prior to coming in. Please note that some things take up to 2 days or more for preparation (aka the Beijing Duck). I do not use WeChat, but this is how you communicate or via FaceBook. The menu is listed here:

https://www.facebook.com/privatekitchenstl/?fref=ts


Pros:
1) I like things sweet, so I loved the plum sweet ribs
2) Spicy Lobster
3) Spicy Whole Steam Fish
4) The soup dumplings!! Yes. Yes. Yes.
5) Pea Pod Stems

Cons:
1) Can be a little noisy depending on the crowd
2) It is a little frustrating if you do not have any1 that speaks Mandarin with you, but it is doable.
 
This place was good, but I don't know if it was mind-blowing. It was very authentic, probably slightly overpriced for the type of food- but it's an interesting experience.
name: Private Kitchen

text:
We moved to the area a little over a year ago and always drove by this place. It is constantly full of cars and curious about it. 

We tried it one day and has a good old town feel and people are always friendly and girls at the bar always take care of you. Very Spacious. We have our group over and it accommodates us all. 

Food is a solid 5 star here. We have gone and seems like they always have a happy hour(more like hours) and specials. 

I recommend their wings (breaded or unbreaded). I always get the spicy garlic ones. I recommend highly. 
Cheddar Balls 
Crab Ragoon Eggrolls are yummy
Irish Fries (tator tots with cheese and sour cream)

I have heard their pizza and burgers are good, but never had them.

The reasons I give this a 4 stars is that yes (As everyone says) it is a smoking bar. And it is very smoky. I can handle it for an hour or so, but anymore it is a bit much. I got spoiled with smoke free bars.

They do offer take out (and honor their happy hour specials) so if I don't have a sitter for my son, we get take out.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
I've been telling myself that I'm going to start meal prepping and bringing my lunch to work for months, so when I heard about Jillian's Fit Flavors, I decided to admit to myself that I was not going to do that and check Fit Flavors out instead. My boyfriend and I visited the Brentwood location on Sunday, 2/15. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and unpretentious (which is important to me for a health-oriented business because that's not always the case). We bought 7 things to try, planning to take them for lunch a few days this week. Well, it's Wednesday and we have already eaten them because we've been making them for lunches and dinners. All of the options we've tried have been delicious - and so healthy. 

One other thing I'll mention is that I'm not the hugest meat fan in general, and the thought of days old reheated meat kind of grosses me out. However, all of the meats have been very well-seasoned and moist, even reheated. I thought the meat may be a problem for me, but it's not at all.

While the ~$10 per lunch price point is more than I might spend prepping my own meals, we all know I'll never actually prep my own meals and it's much cheaper and healthier than eating out for lunch every day. Also, they have a free rewards program where you get $5 off every $100 (or some variation of that)... basically 5% off. Regular Sunday stops at Fit Foods may be my "meal prep" plan from now on - highly recommend!
name: Fit-Flavors

text: The only reason I'm not doing a one star is because the sandwich was decent... We just moved to the area and found Bellacino's on Yelp. When we got there last night, the workers didn't acknowledge we were there, which whatever......but then when we walked up to order, the girl was super weird. My husband asked her "if you were coming here for the first time, would you try the Italian or the steak sandwich?" She just blanked stared at us and kept shrugging her shoulders. It was weird. The other 2 employees there were also silent. They didn't look up at you and it was just a very awkward atmosphere. Ok so there's that. THEN we sat down at a table and waited 45 minutes for our food. FORTY FIVE minutes... for ONE sandwich and some fries. Granted several people had ordered after us.. there was only 1 person who had ordered ahead of us. The fries were disgusting - and I never use that word about fries (most fries are good, even if they aren't the best). They were burned and there were only a few in a basket, see pic. Needless to say, we will not be coming back. Not even because of the wait or the burnt fries...(the sandwich was pretty good)... but because customer service was terrible.
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
OK, so why would I go so ga ga, for a small store front take out Chinese restaurant?  Why, would I give away my secret, and make the restaurant so popular that in Yogi Berra's words, "No one goes there anymore, it is too crowded?"

Simple, China Garden is a small  family owned business, located next to a family owned hardware store (Rick's Ace Hardware) and is simply the best Chinese food in the city regardless of the price point.

Their Crab Rangoon's are great and if you spend $20.00 bucks which is hard to do 4 of them are free, and their Hot and Sour Soup is among the best I have ever tasted.

When a three people work so hard, and turn out such a wonderful product, then they deserve patronage.

I love the General's Chicken and my Wife the Cashew Chicken.

They have 9 options of fried rice.

Their Egg Foo Young is wonderful.

Try it, you will love it!
name: China Garden

text:
In the words of the great Yogi Berra, "Nobody goes there anymore, it is too crowded."
I am afraid if the word gets out about China Garden, the phone lines will be jammed and it will be hard to get in the door of this tiny, shopping strip Chinese take out.

A family run business, China Garden is unique for our family.  Take your P.F. Chang's, LuLu or any other high end Chinese, give me the China Garden any day.

The family is just the absolute best with wonderful  Crab Rangoon, Beef, Pork, or veggie eggrolls and has the absolute best Hot and Sour soup my wife and I have ever eaten.  Your meal is made fresh, and tastes absolutely great.

I have had at least 10 different mains for either lunch or dinner, and one is better than the other.  You call in and can order your meal as spicy as you wish.

The portions are incredibly generous, and the take out menu has coupons for various items, depending on how much you spend.

The downside for this restaurant is it's location, if you did not know it was next to Rick's Ace Hardware at the Lamp and Lantern Shopping Center just west of Old Woods Mill Road and Clayton, you would never find it.  That is a shame, because China Garden and the family that runs the restaurant deserve your business. 

Our family cannot find a better place to order take out.  The restaurant is tiny with only about 4-5 tables.
name: China Garden

text:
I find it hard to give any restaurants 5 stars, especially when it is a ubiquitous Chinese Store Front take out.  But, doggone it, everything they serve is fresh, wonderfully seasoned, promptly made in front of you and tastes just great.

China Garden is adjacent to Rick's Ace Hardware, my home away from home for the past decade.  I like doing business with local firms so China Garden fits the bill.

My wife and I are finicky when it comes to sit down Chinese food with one or two favorites.  We ate at China Garden on evening almost by accident, both tired and leaving the hardware store, our car was parked in front of China Garden.

There are 4 or 5 small tables, the place is decorated in early American cardboard boxes and Chinese Calendars, and the menu is the place mat.

If there is a negative and it is a small one, is these folks are wonderful, but their grasp of English is limited.  I strongly suggest not ordering by phone, if you don't have the pre-printed menu.  If you do have the menu order by number, not by name of the dish.  I can understand how they could easily make a mistake on an order.

I honestly did not expect much more than average, but both my wife and I were amazed at the quality of the food.

Hot and Sour Soup is a personal favorite, theirs is thick, spice and full of wonderful veggies, tofu, meat and mushrooms.  Just great and if you order it to go, a quart is less than $4.00.

My wife eats garlic chicken and I love General Tsao's, which is probably as authentic Chinese as Chop Suey.  I was shocked.  The portions are huge, the massive plate was surrounded by wonderful cooked brocolli that was crisp and bright green, and the entree wonderful.

Like many of the storefronts they have a lower priced lunch menu.  Let me tell you, the price may be lower, but the food is just as fresh and well seasoned as dinner.  The portions are very, very generous.

I hope the family that runs the China Garden does not read this review, they will discover that their prices are too low and they are too generous with their portions.

Unlike the reviewer earlier, I have found the family to be very cordial and friendly, and will be a diner of theirs pretty much on a weekly basis.
name: China Garden

text:
Ok...I thought I had found the best sandwich ever...I thought a veggie sub was just a veggie sub....oh no...not the case...

This is a hot veggie sub...and it's AMAZING.  I am not kidding, I have never had anything so delicious between two pieces of bread.  The sandwich was hot, the veggies were crisp and roasted, the cheese was melted to perfection, the bread was amazing....I loved everything about it.  All you need is a half sandwich, which will run just under $5 and will fill you up plenty.  Seriously, this place is just amazing.  You must try it.  

They also sell pizza and salads and an array of other foods, but I have yet to steer away from the veggie sub.  It's nothing short of amazing and totally worth trying.  Thank God they put one of these by my house....I will be gaining weight accordingly...
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text: Now that Poke shops have been popping up around the city, we decided to give this one a try. Their portions are HUGE (most people probably only need the two scoop - I would have gotten one if it was an option). Their rice is perfectly done and delicious. I had their chicken and tofu, my boyfriend had the salmon and tuna, and neither of us could complain. They load it up with the perfect amount of sauces and flavor. You get to choose however many add ons you like, I just wish they had more options (I.e. more vegetables). Their soda options aren't great so I suggest sticking with water or boba (haven't tried their boba yet). I had enough to eat for leftovers, which was actually just as good as it was in the restaurant. There's definitely some other poke places I've tried that I've liked better in the area, but this one was still good, and convenient right on the loop. The chicken was also gluten free which a lot of the other places don't offer. Prices are a little more than some of the other Poke shops, but again, huge portions so can't complain. This spot is definitely worth a try!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
OH MY GOD YOU GUYS THEY HAVE SANDWICHES ALMOST AS LONG AS MY ARM

So....maybe there are better places downtown (Planet Sub is p. good~) or in the Loop, but otherwise Bellacino's is my favorite sub place in St. Louis. Their pizza is pretty good (I haven't had the salad in literal years, but I remember it being like salad under this inch-thick layer of cheese under some grilled chicken), but their grinders -- 16in long toasted sandwiches with thick bread and fresh veggies -- are the main attraction.

And they're really, really good! Fresh veggies and fillings and such, meats and cheese that don't taste like GUMMINT PROCESSED MEAT AND OR CHEESE PRODUCT that you get in 25lb boxes or whatever, and light menu offerings that don't taste blah (and while the light section is a little small, they'll use fat-free cheese/mayo on other subs if you ask~)...

Friendly staff and clean restrooms also a plus. But yeah! Go here, get your astonishingly large sandwichin' on. (Pssst, the Bayou, Italian, and Chicken Light are really tasty.)
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
Debi Sugarman

Cannot say enough about this food and Company and staff!! The BEST to all!!

I started eating these meals in February, 2016 after I moved here from Texas. 
Since I really don't like to cook..these meals were the answer to my food God!!!!!! :o)) Even my family knew I was in Fit-Flavors heaven!!!!!

From April, 2016..I started to use these meals pretty much on a full time basis. I still make some of my own breakfasts...yet would rather have some of their yummy meals!!! The best part about all these meals (other than the great taste!)...they have all the nutritional information on each container. How much easier can that get??? 
I've always been into fitness and nutrition. However...Fit-Flavors just made things so much better. I lost weight and felt great! I still wanted to know more about how to fit these foods in with an even better nutritional plan.

About a month ago, I attended a free Cooler Chat session with the Dietitian, Allison Leskow. The topic was MyFitnessPal. Since I've used MyFitnessPal in the past..I wanted to get more information about how to better use it. 
Allison was great! She was very informative and as so nice! I was then curious about having these foods and using this device. She said that she can help set up a nutrition program incorporating the Fit-Flavors food. That was my main focus...so I set up some sessions with her. Allison set up my program using calories, as opposed to my previous programs with the breakdowns of macros. Yet with these foods...that information is already there...and it is so much easier to just do calories.

My results were almost immediate and it's only gotten better!! It has been sooooo easy to stay focused and on track with MyFitnessPal!!! I'll also set up a few meals ahead and then I don't even have to think about what to eat other than look at the device to see what is planned for each meal and snack. And the body knows when it's time to eat!!!! Trust me!!!!!!

I can honestly say that at the age of 66...this is the best I have ever looked or felt! My clothes fit amazing and I'm at the lowest size and weight I have been in a very long time and it is due to the right amount of calories for my body. And...I will not be on that yo-yo track anymore. This is a great way of life!
And....eating these pre-made Fit-Flavors foods has been one the best things to make this journey so successful. And the snacks can be some of those "forbidden" foods...yet...when tracked...they fit right in with the plan. Even if I go out to dinner...it's still easy to track food with the device...so ya never have to be away from your plan.

I cannot go on any further without saying...Allison is the reason for helping me get to this fantastic place in my life!!! She is the Best!!!!
Yes....I am the one to do the work. However..she is the one who gave me the correct tools and direction!
I just love her and appreciate how much she cares about her clients! And no matter how many clients she has...you and your success are very important to her.
I would encourage anyone who wants to make changes and have true success..to contact Allison!! It has been the best decision I have made in a very long time!!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text: I tried this place with a couple coworkers on a Friday afternoon after I had been craving Chinese food for over a month. As we walked in we were greeted by who I believed to be the owner. I noticed she was very attentive and even had a couple regulars in there whom she remembered by name. We all ordered a lunch special and sat down at one of the tables. We were quickly served our crab rangoon while we waited for the rest of our food to arrive and they tasted great with a crispy outside, soft inside and the wonderfully hot & familiar taste making my mouth water and my mind wonder why I had waited so long for this. Our food was served in styrofoam to-go boxes which made it easier to just eat what we wanted and be able to take the rest home for later. The General Tso's chicken I ordered came with fried rice and was so very good. It wasn't very spicy as I am usually used to but, I didn't exacly mind this as I was getting my fixed and the rest of it was fresh and hot. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a new chinese food place.
name: China Garden

text:
Today I stopped in to check this place out, after my mom told me about it.  The owner greeted us as we walked in. She was extremely friendly and informative. Since it was my first time in, she gave me a menu and a run down on all the food. 
The selection is huge! I can't wait to try more. I picked Spiced Rubbed Chicken Breast (with veggies) and the Asian Slaw. They were delicious. I even accidentally heated my chicken twice but it was still amazing :)
Unfortunately, I'm only here visiting (which is another reason this place is amazing and helpful, while traveling) but I'll be stopping in to pick up more meals.
The employee that rang me up was also very nice and helpful with my questions. 
I highly recommend going in and trying a few meals.
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text:
Bellacino's is great we have been going to this location for about 9 months now , our order is always perfect, the food is great , have not had anything from here I didn't like , the pizza is like no other in St. Louis. 
I personally love the sweet chili wings , The Meat eater  pizza is also my favorite. The kids love the boneless chicken nuggets. The triple decker Grinder is also one of my favorites. If you haven't been here you definitely should try it , We haven't ordered from a different pizza place since we discovered Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders.
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
I work close by so I decided to take the short walk to this 'new to me' place. I like sushi a lot but since starting to watch my carbs I haven't had it in a while. This place was a great option! 
The staff was great too! I told them I'd never been there and they explained what I needed to do. 
I opted for the salad, then three scoops, spicy tuna, salmon and shrimp. I added a bunch of different toppings and then had them help me with deciding on the sauce, spicy mayo and eel sauce. I will be coming back. It smelled so great and it was very filling for one person. They take cash or credit, and have a loyalty program with your phone number. 
I love the fact they have seaweed salad too! So fresh and great!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: Love love love their food. It's like eating a giant sushi bowl. With all the toppings and the sides. You can not go wrong here, customize your bowl how u choose. Mmm mmm!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: YUMMM! This place has only been open 3 weeks when we came for dinner. It is like a Chipotle only for Poke Bowls. You pick what your base will be (salad/soba noodles/crispy wontons/rice), then pick your protein (different seafood/chicken/tofu) then you can go crazy with additions of toppings and drizzle. They also have a selection of appetizers. We got the pot stickers, which were fried to order. Nice - no sogginess! My bowl was half and half soba noodles and wontons, with spicy tuna/salmon/shrimp. I added seaweed salad, pineapple, sesame seeds, and spicy mayo (on the side). My medium size was huge, so much that I couldn't finish. It was GREAT!!! Flavorful and fresh-tasting. For $13, I thought it was a deal! Also, they have bubble tea. Can't wait to return!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: I am usually in Fit Flavors 2-3 times a week.  Wonderful healthy meals with an ever changing menu. The staff is very knowledgeable, kind and helpful. If you look to eat healthy but don't have the time to meal prep, this is your place! Highly recommend!

text:
Was very excited for my first time here! The food is delicious and features fresh ingredients. 

We got two large poke bowls including rice, seaweed salad, tuna, sauces, tempura shrimp & soft shell crab. Nicely balanced dishes - freshness from the veggies, slight sweetness from the sushi rice, richness from the seafood & customize your spice level with all kinds of sauces & add ins. 

Higher price point than you might think, but a lot goes into these bowls! Probably would get a smaller option next time to be more cost-effective, but definitely recommend for all poke lovers.
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
Me and my SO are very fortunate to have tasted some amazing five-star poke in our hometown in Texas (shout out to seaside poke!). We're visiting STL and took a gamble on this poke place we saw was open later than most restaurants in the area.

First thing's first: portion size. The portions are enormous relative to what we're used to back at home, which is both a blessing and a curse. A large is truly -- large -- and should be reserved for those who are very hungry (which we were not, oops). It's difficult to notice the display with the sizes from the front of the shop (where orders are placed due to pandemic restrictions), so make sure you ask how big the sizes are before ordering.

Next thing is the quality. We tried the salmon and the spicy tuna. The salmon was on par with the best we've ever tried, and the spicy tuna was pretty good and flavorful, but a little more "loose" than I'd like (likely due to a relatively high sauce/tuna ratio in the spicy tuna recipe). The toppings were all fresh and high quality, and the sauces were also very good and not overpowering.

Now to the criticisms: we were slightly disappointed by the rice, which was almost certainly not "sushi rice" as we were accustom to from other high quality shops, but instead plain white rice. In case you're curious, the difference between plain short grain white rice and "sushi rice" is the addition of a few key ingredients (like vinegar) to the former -- and it makes a massive difference. If this shop started to use sushi rice, I would be willing to bump it up half a star or more as everything else is quite high quality, and the only significant thing holding it back is the rice. The rice was also bland and a bit mushy, possibly from being slightly over cooked. The majority of a poke bowl is the rice, so I feel it was important for me to really dial in on what the rice was like.

A final, more minor complaint was the takeout containers (froyo-style cylindrical paper containers) seemed a bit weird to put poke into, but maybe I'm being a bit too nitpicky here. High-moisture, steamy items like rice just don't seem as appetizing in this style of paper container. I would recommend some sort of recyclable clear plastic bowls, or really anything that is more bowl shaped.

TL;DR: Work on your rice (make sushi rice instead of just using plain white rice) and your takeout containers, and you've got a real winner here. Congrats!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
Dinner carryout. You order at the counter. There are a few tables for eating in, but it's not too inviting.

I put in my order, paid, and left to do some Schnuck's shopping while the order was being prepared.

Got moo goo gai pan and chicken with garlic sauce. Each dish came with a container of rice.

The garlic chicken was soooooo garlicky with much, much much tender and tasty white meat chicken (good-sized pieces) with fresh mushrooms, carrots, celery, water chestnuts, pea pods and onions. I had 1/3 of it with about 1/4 of the rice, and I was stuffed. Yum, yum!

The moo goo gai pan was the same tender white meat chicken, carrots, fresh mushrooms, pea pods, celery, onions, green pepper, sliced baby corn and broccoli. There's some heat in this one.  And it does linger. It was really good.

I got six meals out of this for $18. And the carryout containers are reusable.
name: China Garden

My favorite meals are Peanut Chicken over Asian Slaw, Farmers Breakfast, Chicken Verde Enchiladas, and Balsamic Chicken and Zoodles. text:
Miss C. and I had a carryout dinner December 24:

Shrimp and Pork Eggrolls

Crab Rangoon

Boiled Pot Stickers

Moo Goo Gai Pan -- Chicken, mushrooms, green pepper, white onions. On the bland side.

Chicken with Garlic Sauce -- Thin carrot slices, baby corn, large broccoli heads, green pepper, white onion and large strips of juicy, tender chicken. Absolutely glorious flavor. I added a bit of soy sauce. But I couldn't find ANY GARLIC.

General Tso's Chicken -- Miss C.'s dish, but she left some here. Broccoli and huge chunks of chicken, highly breaded, not hot AT ALL.

Mongolian Beef -- Miss C.'s dish, but she left some here. Tender beef strips, green onions, broccoli, carrot strips, baby corn, green pepper and white onion

And LOTS and LOTS of sauces to customize everything.

Miss C. took control of the rice, 'cause I don't do rice.

She ordered online, picked up the order and brought it to the house. (Their eat-in option is not a looker.)

The eggrolls, crab Rangoon and pot stickers were ALL hot, crispy and well-filled. Tasty morsels! We both embellished with sauces.

For the entrees . . . none of them were the best. They were A-OK but of the four, I'd say the Mongolian Beef was the best. Coming in at #2 was the Chicken with Garlic Sauce.

And it tells me a lot that Miss C. left both of her entrees here.

The appetizers are what got this review to 4 stars.
name: China Garden

text: All the Chinese restaurants seemed to have hit or miss reviews so we decided to try this since it's close by and had good reviews! We ordered delivery and it came very quickly - 30 minutes sooner than promised. Everything was hot and tasted great! It'd been a while since we had Chinese take out  . . . we enjoyed the crab rangoon (though pretty sweet), hot & sour soup, sesame chicken, sweet & sour chicken, and Hunan chicken. Everything was delish. Good portion sizes and reasonable prices. Will definitely order from here again soon!

text:
I placed an online order 20 minutes before arriving to the restaurant. Upon arrival, i waited 10 mins before I called 4 times as instructed for a Togo order. The line rang and was not answered. I then went inside and was told that my order would take an additional 10 minutes.

We sat and waited until he car another 30 minutes before having to go back inside to ask for a status. I even tried to call again and the line just rang. 

When I went inside the statement was that there were a lot of online orders at once. I am happy that business is booming, however, don't have customers waiting on Togo orders for over 40 mins then say you had other orders to handle. We are already there.....waiting. 

I had high expectations and was severely let down that my business wasn't appreciated.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text:
Poke seems to be a rare find in St Louis so we were excited to be able to find this place in the popular Loop area. We came here for lunch during the week and found it not crowded. Too bad. This place was great!

Had the medium sized bowl which includes 3 proteins along with a bunch of extras. It was tasty, well prepared and filling. I also felt the price was reasonable ($14.50). 

Customer service seemed good and efficient. The restaurant was clean. There is a parking lot next to the restaurant but it does cost to park ($1 per hour when we were there but the machine seemed broken so...). 

Definitely a good find in the area and we will be back!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: We have had delivery from China Garden many times over the last several years and we're happy to see that it is open again for pick up or delivery. The ordering process by phone was very easy. Delivery was speedy and the food as usual, excellent. We ordered the hot and sour soup, fried dumplings, cashew chicken, and a spicy beef dish. All were excellent and there was sufficient food for the two of us for two dinners and two lunches. They package the food in high-quality plastic containers which worked well in the microwave for reheating. This has become our favorite Chinese restaurant.

text:
Big proportions for a great price! You won't find these prices and proportions around east or west coast where you see pokÃ© places. I usually get a small. I love the ability to customize my bowl so much. Even having 2 bases instead of one! If you can't decide between rice or soba noodles, get both like me! The fish is really fresh. And the pokÃ© sauce is so yummy. My favorite drizzles are spicy Mayo, wasabi Mayo, and eel sauce. I love the crispy onion topping for an extra crunch. So so good! Thanks for coming to St. Louis! I didn't know I needed a pokÃ© place until this opened up. 

I love their crab Rangoon too! And I almost ALWAYS get a bubble tea! 

Please keep adding locations so I can stop by wherever I am in the St. Louis area!

text: Tasty food, excellent ingredients and I don't have to cook.  I sound like a TV commercial.  You have to try it!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text:
Where would I be without Fit-Flavors?! I started doing orders with Fit-Flavors in February of this year. I wanted to get back into meal prepping and wanted to be mindful of low calorie/low carb meals in order to lose weight, and stumbled upon Fit-Flavors. I like that the food is already prepared and only needs to be reheated in the microwave for minimal time. The prices aren't bad, about the same that you'd pay at a restaurant if not a little less, and on average in the $10-$13 range per person/per meal. They offer free delivery for STL metro customers for orders over $70 or $75. That's easy to get to when you're buying meals for a whole week. You can also go to the store and pick up meals as you go and just put them in the freezer or heat them up that day. The food only lasts 5 days in the freezer.

Some of the meals are hit or miss on flavor so there is a bit of trial and error that goes into finding what food you like, but most of the options are really tasty. My personal favorites are the spaghetti squash with marinara and meatballs, the buffalo chicken tenders/nuggets, the Greek salad, blackened salmon, the oatmeal with mixed berries, and the steak with Yukon potatoes. My least favorite meal so far was the turkey meatloaf. The texture and taste just weren't it, at all. 

I also can proudly say that while doing Fit-Flavors for dinner only for 10 days out of a month (5 nights every other week), I did lose weight during those weeks, so I've been successful doing Fit-Flavors. If you're wanting to meal prep or just want to pick up dinner that is already portion controlled and has the nutrition facts of the entire meal indicated, I highly recommend Fit-Flavors!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text:
The poke bowls here and the quality is actually surprisingly good. Currently, they only have take-out options due to COVID-19 and they are a bit slow if you order in-store but the food is delicious.

My go to order is make your own large bowl, which can last me 2-3 meals (make sure to refrigerate it in between). I would highly recommend getting the salmon as they do mix it with the other toppings and the quality of the fish seems pretty good. It's also nice that they have seaweed salad because sometimes it costs extra at other poke places. Definitely get the Spicy Mayo and Eel Sauce, those are pretty safe dressing if you just want a standard poke bowl.

Overall, not a bad experience at all. Do make sure to order ahead of time if you don't want to wait.
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
I live in LA and everybody loves Roscoe's. I do too. They are a legendary establishment. But on this last trip to St. Louis, I was introduced to Freddie G's. 
I don't mean any harm...but Freddie G's has elevated the chicken and waffle game to the next level. Their chicken alone, seasoned to perfection was worth the flight, hotel, and Uber. I didn't add a single thing to this flavorful presentation of some of the best chicken I have EVER tasted. 
Beautifully complimented by a fluffy waffle and jalapeÃ±o maple syrup, Freddie G's is a must. The standard by which all chicken and waffles must now be judged.
Simply the best.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle
