text:
The food is honestly so good here! I am always down for trying new things so getting outside my comfort zone with getting a poke bowl was exactly what I needed!
Small bowls can fill you up plenty but the regular is a crowd favorite. I love teriyaki mayo and eel sauce because I don't like things too spicy but spicy mayo and eel sauce is also a popular combo for the drizzle on top! My go to combo is white rice with salmon and chicken (or shrimp, whichever I'm feeling but I like to try all different combos!), cucumbers and onions, medium, green and fried onions, crab meat, a little bit of seaweed salad, a little bit of ginger, and mango! Topped with teriyaki mayo and eel sauce. Sesame seeds on top! Yum!
Crab meat for a topping is free which is the greatest thing ever. I love all of their toppings. Never had a boba tea before but watermelon is definitely my favorite.
An honest review! I love eating here. If you're looking for a new spot, hit this place up!
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: This place has been a lifesaver! Forget all those giant companies that ship your food from god-knows-where, Fit-Flavors is right here in St. Louis! I'm supporting a local business AND eating healthy. They make it super easy for me to stay on track and log my meals, and with the changing seasonal menu, I never get sick of eating the same thing over and over. Everything I've eaten from these guys is simply divine and it only takes 2 minutes to heat up in the microwave. You could easily put the food into a glass dish too if the oven is more your style! The containers are recyclable and they will even take back empty clean containers. I cannot say enough good things about Fit-Flavors!!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text: Delicious food! Their crab Rangoon are absolutely amazing and you get a very generous portion of food when you order the poke bowls. The atmosphere and location are pretty nice as well with one of the loop parking lots being located right outside. My only complaint and reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that it's really pricey. They give you enough food for two meals, but it's not exactly something that keeps well.
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
Finally! Mochi donuts in STL Thank you Pokedoke for bringing these amazing chewy donuts to us

Mochi donuts were originated from from Japan and is one of the star product at Mister Donut in Taiwan. It was super popular since about at least 10 years ago in Taiwan. I never seen these being sold here in the US until recent years. It's becoming a new hit in cities with more Asian populations. I am so super excited that we can finally get them here in St. Louis! 

If you never tried, they are a hybrid of cake donuts and mochi, with a dense and chewy texture. Usually a sugar/flavored glazed will be applied on one side of it. This week, they have Strawberry and Black Sesame and I love them both!!! Not quite as chewy as I would hope but it definitely meets my standard and every bite is so joyful

They have had Matcha, Taro, Cookies and Cream and powdered sugar flavors before. I think only the Delmar and Kirkwood locations have it right now. And they said you can contacted them with few days notice to customize the flavor you like for your event! I will definitely try to get all the flavors in the future
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text: I always love a good Poke place.  Came here for lunch.  Service was very fast and the employees were really nice.  They are very generous with the portions.  You pick your base (brown or white rice/salad/soba/wontons) then your protein (I chose ahi tuna, salmon, and shrimp), and then you get toppings and sauce.  I went crazy with toppings- seafood salad, avocado (costs extra), mango, cucumber, imitation crab.  I got regular, but two scoops would have been adequate.  Then you can chooses sauces and more toppings. In any case this is exactly what I expect of a poke place, and I'm glad I checked it out.
name: PokeDoke
categories: Food, Poke, Bubble Tea, Korean, Restaurants

text:
Delicious food! Used the online system to order and went to pickup. I tried to call and make sure food was ready but phone goes straight to voicemail just like the other reviewer said. I really wish they'd set up a phone number, it's the main reason this is a 4 star review. I heard about this business on the For The Culture website because I feel like I've ordered takeout from the same spots over and over and wanted to try and find Black Owned spots near me. 

The Chicken and Waffles lived up to expectations - crispy well seasoned chicken and fluffy waffles. The grits were good although maybe a little too much butter as it was pooling in the styrofoam container.  

Friendly service when I went to pick it up - there were diners inside eating and staff was all masked up.

Online ordering platform says to leave your car make and model and then let them know when you arrive which you can't do because no one answers the phone.  Went inside to pick up my food , greeted by friendly staff and happy to see there business was bustling.

I am so happy they opened a location on Delmar!  I never go to the one in CWE because parking is a nightmare and So stressful for just picking up food!  The parking lot on delmar is huge and so much easier to navigate. 
They are open for delivery and curbside pick up right now (Covid) easy online ordering!
I got a regular bowl with salmon and other toppings and it did not disappoint. So delicious! 
The wings were also pretty good maybe a little too much sweetness and not enough crispness for me with not much spice but if you like sweet glazed wings these are great for you don't get me wrong! They are huge wings and the green onion adds a nice touch. 
Overall this is definitely a place to try out even if you aren't the biggest sushi fan. They have plenty of options so you can easily try new mixtures each time until you find the right one for you!

text:
It was a Friday evening during Lent, so I ordered Kung pao shrimp to be delivered.  I received kung pao chicken. I immediately had my husband call to tell of the mistake, no big deal, right, it happens sometimes.  Much to our surprise he is told, no we ordered chicken and the (china garden guy) wants to talk to me.  I take the phone, explain it's Lent and that we don't eat meat and I ordered shrimp.  Well this guy wants to argue, so phone goes back to my husband, whereby he is still insisting we made the mistake. unbelievable!!! 

 he is also insisting we take the chicken back to china garden ourselves in order for us to have the shrimp we originally ordered.
My husband says no. We paid or delivery, bring us the shrimp.  After all of this, we had to pay the $1.30 and give the bad chicken back, because of their mistake.

The owner took zero culpability, no apologies, by the time the shrimp came we were afraid to eat it.  We will not go there again.  What a joke.
name: China Garden

Then I never once got asked for a refill Watched a table come in before me order and get their food  and was told by the waiter since the big table ordered before us they have to get their food first . That's horrible customer service when we was already at the table for 20 minutes before they even came in .I don't care about a discount I care about good service .I sat at the table for an hour and fifteen minutes before I said can I just get it to go so all in out without a packed out restaurant it took me 2 hours to get my food . I'll never eat here again. They didn't care about making us happy . It was more so it is what it is " I didn't see y'all" So since you didn't see us It's not your fault ? text:
China Garden in Lamp and Lantern Village is my favorite Chinese restaurant for carry out. It is a small business located close to home. This restaurant has adequate, casual seating and also offers the opportunity to eat in.   It appears to be family owned and operated and service is always fast and accurate. My food is cooked fresh and is still hot when I get it home to eat. I like the convenience but, even more, I like the flavor and the choices.  Almost always, I order The combination plate of beef and broccoli. It comes with rice, crab Rangoon or eggroll, and of course the necessary fortune cookie. The broccoli is cooked the way I like it and has a good flavor without being two crunchy. I like my broccoli a little soft and easy to chew!  Since I always order the same plate, I have no experience to share regarding  the other menu choices. 
     Tonight I was pleasantly surprised. When I walked in, the young lady who I am guessing is the daughter of the owners Immediately and spontaneously knew what I was going to order. She recognized me! I can't tell you how appreciated that can make a customer feel. I have never ever been disappointed in my meal from China Garden. The folks working there are hard workers and I want them to know how much I respect them.
name: China Garden

This been in my list for a minute, and my coworker been telling me to go for a minute. Took some time out a beautiful Sunday to stop here for brunch. My friend had a table at the front so I immediately saw him when I walked in. Wasn't crowded and people at each table were enjoying themselves. They had music but it wasn't overwhelming so conversations were possible. I ordered 4pc wings and grits (cuz I had a bad grits experience at breakfast so I figure this would redeem it). 

They also had free mimosa on Sunday (hint hint). Also, they close their kitchen at 3:30pm as well. 

Food wise, I was satisfied. They had a limited menu. Chicken was hot and crispy. Grits were hot and buttery. I enjoyed a basic meal and will gladly come back. Gotta try the G sauce I heard about.

text:
Still open during COVID 
The food here is worth the wait!!!
Yes the wait is long, however they let us know up front that everything is made to order so I was prepared. I never had the feeling that they were "being slow" due to poor service or a lack of interest. 
Now that the sloth in the room has been addressed let's get to a solid review:
The menu isn't overly complicated which I liked. I knew I was coming for some chicken and some waffles, so of course I expected to get some bomb C&W. They didn't disappoint. The syrup didn't over power the meal. The chicken wings were well battered and oh my gosh the spicy sauce set it all the way off. Plus, since it was made to order the food was piping hot. 
My server was helpful, attentive, and contributed to our dining experience. 

Covid precautions were taken and the tables were spaced out properly. Let's keep this local business alive. Stop in for some quality STL Chicken and Waffles.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text:
I'm from New England and I've tried a lot of Chinese places in Chesterfield area and I find this is one of the most authentic and closest to what you would find in New England or the Boston area.

They use fresh onions mushrooms and all their vegetables are fresh and nothing is out of can!  Their pork fried rice is out of this world and it's the closest I can get to Boston Chinese food and rice. 

East of the Mississippi The Chinese rice is brown in color, when you cross the Mississippi west to Missouri then the rice becomes yellow. What's with that? 

I recommend this store to anyone who wants authentic fresh delicious Chinese food!
name: China Garden

I happen to love poke a little too much, and this place definitely helps satisfy my constant cravings!

The ingredients are fresh and the portions are pretty generous. For me, the regular size definitely fills me up, but a lot of times I order a large, just cause I love poke a lot, but then I end up being too full hahah. They also have a wide variety of options to choose from. Service is super quick, since it's like Chipotle-style ordering. 

During busy meal times, parking can be a little harder to find in the area, but usually a spot will come up. 

I docked one star because there have been many instances where the employees don't seem to want to be there. 

Besides that, I really enjoy the food so I will keep coming back!

text: I love Toasted Cafe'! Everything I've had thus far is off the chart delicious! The staff is awesome. They greet you as you walk in the door, smiles galore, always a made that morning fresh selection of coffees, cakes, BREADS and cookies! I give this establishment 5 stars for all these reasons. The food and coffee is outstanding! I can't recommend just one thing...! Try it all, because it's just that great! There's a Childrens corner to entertain while the adults enjoy their coffee and breads. The entire set up is cozy as soon as you enter the cafe. Stop by, step into their world and you will be so happy you did. I am, and I'm headed back today for the fresh bread that we just can't get  enough of!
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text:
The stereotypical Chinese food spot.  I like it. You don't always need smiles and friendly customer service. Sometimes I like the blunt, straight forward "what do you want?" (Yells order, gets it bagged) "There you go." And you're out of there in 10 min or less.  The place looks divey, decorated with ornaments of cheap chinese posters and calendars.  The kids are at mom's work today...they get to take over a whole table. How fun!?

The food: I ordered one of my FAVORITE items that most don't really know about. The St. Paul Sandwich.

Picture hot egg fu young (but your choice of meat, be it shrimp, pork, ham, beef, veggie) with lettuce, pickle, mayo, and all between cold refrigerated sliced white bread. Doesn't sound appealing?  You don't even know...you don't even know...it's so good. Especially with a couple packets of hot sauce that they provide.

Had some shrimp egg rolls on the side. Fresh, crunchy, and steaming hot  They were lacking in shrimp and of flavor, perhaps because I inhaled them and burnt the crap out of my mouth while doing so.  So hungry during that time. I usually just drench that type of food with  in sweet and sour sauce. I was satisfied after my meal here and left with a semi-full belly. This place is was an ok place today!
name: China King

text: My go to takeout spot (Panda on S Kirkwood rd) was closed so I thought I would give this place another chance. I've ordered from here a handful of times getting a variety of dishes. I have yet to get anything here worth eating.  Each dish had little flavor.  The crab rangoon were small and bland. I asked for a small side of sweet and sour sauce for dipping and was almost charged for it. I don't like being nickel and dimmed for this. I ordered and paid for 3 egg roles and walked out with only 2.  I'd call to complain but it's just not worth the effort. No attention to detail or overall quality of their food. I will not be back.

text:
I'm usually happy with my selections here. Curry chicken---good, beef and broccoli--- good. 
I tried something different for me tonight. 
Garlic Shrimp. Now i know Americans love their sugar, but must we taste it in everything? I tasted NO garlic. i actually thought garlic would be one of their spicy dishes, but this sauce tasted like it came out of a Smucker's jar---- if they had Chinese brown sauce flavor. Good thing i also got the boneless ribs. I could taste sugar in these, too. Not as bad, and they had a nice flavor to them. Some kind of herb. Saffron?
I hope I'm not the only one noticing too much sweet in our entrees so restaurants will leave the sugar for desserts!
name: China King

text: The  barista   seemed bothered to take my order, didn't ask me my name, which was Olay, because they were not  busy. I was standing waiting for my drink and she put a drink up on a higher Stand, didn't make eye contact with me so I  didn't think it was my drink, and then went back to making another drink that I naturally thought was mine , she made that drink and then with a big smile called for "Justin "and said  your drink ready! text:
I regularly stop in this location, sometimes for long periods of time. This is a small Starbucks with (what appears to be) a large volume of customers. I understand why.

I'm impressed with how efficiently and expediently the staff moves the traffic... AND still manages to remember everyone's name. Small neighborhood feel for this big chain store.

text: Great Starbucks , the most consistent in this area. Fast service and they have parking and a entrance on the front and back sides. Mocha Rocks!

text:
One of the best websites for ordering Chinese food... Great interface and really easy to order.   Their delivery people are awesome too,  really friendly and FAST! 


It is so convenient and is why I keep ordering from them. 

The food on the other hand is pretty inconsistent.  Sometimes a tasty treat with the right amount of sauce...  Other times just not that good with way too much sauce.  

Their house fried rice is always really good.  I also like the sesame chicken.

text: So glad this is my local Starbucks! The staff are always friendly, and the drinks are consistently good. The interior is a bit small for how much business it attracts on any given day, but it's a cozy spot, and it's also nice to sit & chat at the tables outside when the weather is nice.

text: This is a welcome addition to our little town. They are open limited hours and close at 2, and are not open on Sunday. They have the usual coffee drinks plus hot chocolate. Their prices are equivalent to Starbucks. They also have a small selection of pastries. They are child friendly. I found the employee very friendly and did a good job making the drink I ordered.

categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: This is "My Starbucks".  Consistently good cappuccinos.  I ask the barista to make them "dry", and they are excellent.  I also get my coffee here and have it ground for my espresso machine.  The staff manages to keep up with the customers. Easy and fast to get a drink and be on my way. The store is very small, has tables outside.  A well kept secret.  There's parking both in front and in the back.  Clean restrooms.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text: Have been going here for a decade but staff keeps changing and not for the better. No longer a friendly place  have moved on to other coffee shops
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text:
Ordered delivery for a get-together. $41 for five people isn't that bad, in my opinion. I wasn't paying attention to the time, but the food seemed to arrive pretty promptly.
 
Even though I ordered a simple dish (chicken fried rice) it was flavorful. My boyfriend was pleased with his sesame beef, and the order was packed with meat. They supplied us with plenty of sauce packets, gave us fortune cookies, and even threw in a free container of egg drop soup, which everyone agreed was tasty.
 
Hot, delicious, reasonably priced food for delivery - no complaints here!
name: China King

text: Ordered online delivery. Food came in 40 minutes. We ordered the Singapore Mei Fun Noodles, General Tso Chicken, Sauteed Broccoli, Crab Rangoon and the Golden Crispy Shrimp. Everything was good and tasty except the shrimp. Nothing crispy about them. Batter was too thick and soggy. Overall the food was what we expected for chinese delivery. We will order again for sure. They also give you almond cookies along with your fortune cookies.

text: This little mom 'n pop shop has surprisingly good food--definitely a cut above the others like it--and at excellent prices. The food is always freshly prepared after you order it--even the soup. The lunch special is one of the great bargains in St. Louis. And the owners' two young daughters, who sometimes do their homework there, are adorable. It's worth driving out of your way to grab some carryout here!
name: China King

text:
Best strip mall Chinese you will find. You order at the counter and pay, then they bring the food out. So it isn't a full service place. 

But the food is the best.  Their broccoli chicken, orange chicken and General Tso chicken are unbeatable. Better than any sit down, full service restaurant I have been to.

Their soups are very good too.

Highly recommended. Good, fast and cheap.
name: China King

text: I recently moved to the area and one night needed something quick and easy for dinner that delivered. It was late and China King seemed to be about the only thing open (with the exception of pizza) I ordered online a couple of items (min $15 for delivery) and the checkout process was simple. A few minutes after placing an order I received a phone call confirming that I placed an order and the lady took my credit card over the phone. I live only 3 mins from the restaurant but chose delivery because I was being lazy ;) and from the time I hung up to when it was delivered was about 15-20 mins, so super quick in my opinion. The food was really tasty and plentiful for the price. I easily had enough leftover for another two-three meals. Hot and yummy. Since then I've ordered a few more times and have done both delivery and pick up and each time the process has been the same - easy ordering, quick delivery, yummy, hot and plentiful food. I've never eaten inside their restaurant but it's a pretty basic, nothing fancy strip mall joint and I've hardly ever had to wait a long time for my order - 10 mins or less if I don't preorder. They have a really extensive menu compared to others and though I tend to order the same several items, I haven't been disappointed yet. I like the food and it's my "go-to" for a quick dinner.
name: China King

text: I was in the area, craving coffee, and wanted something other than Starbucks or gas station coffee.  A search engine led me here, and I'm really glad I stopped by.  It isn't very noticeable from the street, so I had to loop back to find it, but it was totally worth it.  It seems like your neighborhood coffee shop, it's just that its off the beaten path, to say the least.  The coffee was good, the workers were friendly, and it just seemed like the type of place you could sit, sip and read.  Very low key, and I got the sense that they probably have a bunch of regulars.  Definitely stop by if you're in the area.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: Stopped in for a drink and a sandwich on my way to work. Service was ok, they didn't know my order but eventually I received it. The java chip frap was good enough, but the bacon egg croissant I ordered was so bad, it ruined my appetite for the rest of the day. I know food isn't the company's strong suit, but this was disgusting.  Go to Panera.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text:
I've been to this location several times and I plan to continue going here as long as it is convenient location wise.  It has proven to be a very reliable, clean Chinese take-out location.  Like most, it has very reasonably priced combinations for lunch and dinner.  They also, always have a ton of coupons attached to their mail out and free pick up menus that you can use with any order.  I typically use the one that offers 4 free crab rangoon with an order over $12-$15.  I'm usually ordering two orders and that puts me just over the minimum amount and the crab rangoon is one of the best parts of this place, because they give you a good amount of filling and it is fried to a good amount of crisp.  

With your combination orders you get your choice of meat, fried rice, and an egg roll which you can usually substitute your choice of rice or crab rangoon if you'd like.  The meat/rice combination is more than enough and makes for a decent 2nd meal.  

If you choose to eat in the establishment, there is plenty of seating and they offer free refills on your fountain drink if you get one, which is always nice.  The place is plenty clean for Chinese take-out and the person who takes your order speaks very good English, which can sometimes be tough at other places.  Not that i think this matters too much, but it's worth knowing. 

All in all, my girlfriend and I like this place for the quality and value.  It's a great place to get good Chinese when you want it quickly, easily, and cheap.

Order with no reservation!
name: China King

text:
Save your time and energy and drive to Sunset Hills, Crestwood, Rock Hill, or even inside Target. This is always the WORST Starbucks! Not to mention how small is it, with no drive through. Besides that, the service has always been the worst! 
I go there MAYBE 2x a year, because I go next door for my glasses. Otherwise I avoid it at all costs! 
For instance, spent $6.06 on my Venti Iced vanilla latte with almond milk today (which I get everyday)... he made it COMPLETELY wrong. It was dark, made with iced coffee instead of a latte, and I told him it was wrong and tasted bad. Him AND the manager looked at me crazy. She said we can add more almond milk... so he added more almond milk to it and wouldn't just remake the drink they made wrong in the first place! I just left, because I did t want to cause a scene. I walked there today, because we live close and I still try and avoid this location! Do. Not. Waste. Your. Money. There!

text: We have been loyal customers for about 5 years and never complained until April 1, 2019. The cranky woman who runs the place had forgotten to put the sweet and sour sauce with our sweet and sour dish take out.  We called and asked that it be delivered. She refused and told us to pick it up. We agreed but asked nicely if she would make the dish fresh for us so Ithat in 30 minutes when my husband returned home with his meal it would not be old and cold. She flatly refused and even told us to microwave it! I reminded her that she knew we were good loyal customers and asked her to make it right.  She refused. When my husband arrived she took his pork and thru it back into the fryer! My husband complained that would make it dry and was not what would correct her error. She did end up refunding his money but threatened to call his employer !!!!!! So my husband did not have dinner that night and China king will never get our business again all over a mistake that the mean woman made and she would not correct. She has been rude to us for 5 years and we never complained until now.  She is a number one jerk.

text: This China King location is our favorite. The BF decided to stop here and try it one day on a whim since we pass it all the time. The restaurant is clean and the employees are friendly. It's actually a great place to either dine in or carry out. They always provide you with coupons in your oder. We love the location and hours. We can get our fix seven days a week. The food is very good and consistent. We're working our way through the menu. We love the ham fried rice and have now moved to the roasted pork fried rice as our new fave. The Shanghai spring rolls are a must every visit. My brother loves the orange chicken combination plate which comes with pork fried rice and an egg roll. The orange chicken is actually very good. We've also eaten and enjoyed the mongolian pork, fried dumplings and vegetable St. Paul. We've tried the chicken fried rice which we aren't too fond of and the combination appetizer plate which allows you try a variety of appetizers for your snacking pleasure. This way you know which apps to buy and which apps to avoid. The fried shrimp which comes with cocktail sauce and crab sticks were also good. The portions are plenty, served fresh and piping hot and the prices are reasonable.
name: China King

text:
There are certain restaurants in St. Louis that are ubiquitous with the foodie scene in the city. It's so easy to forget the bold flavors of Seoul Taco were born in the back of a food truck. Now they have multiple locations in both St. Louis and Chicago. And you know why? Because their food is SO good!

The original brick and mortar Seoul Taco location in the Delmar Loop was always such a pain for me to get to, so I actually never had food from that location. When they announced that this Asian-fusion eatery was opening a location in the brand new apartment complex in the Grove, my mouth watered.  While you can still find their food around town at food truck rallies, the idea of it being so easily accessible on Manchester was the stuff dreams are made of!

Ordering from Seoul Taco is so simple. Their online system is a breeze. We actually ordered inside with an incredibly pleasant employee though. The food was hot and ready in just a few minutes. (Ordering and getting fresh food is really something that I've missed during the pandemic.) Because it was a Friday in Lent, we went with completely meatless options. My boyfriend chose the tofu quesadilla and I went for the burrito (we had a coupon for a free taco too!) 

The quesadilla was full of gooey cheese and oozed flavor. The rice in my burrito packed a spicy punch, but wasn't unenjoyable. Loved the fried rice inside the burrito, but would have liked there to be a little more sauce. Overall the Asian-fusion meets Mexican flavors were a unique combo for our Friday feast.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I'm not a vegetarian anymore, but I don't eat a ton of meat so I decided to give CC's a go. It was a long wait for the food. A sweet lady took my order & prepared drink while I browsed their shopping area:
Gifts by local artist. 
Looks like a small room is under construction for private events. 
Cafe had several peeps enjoying conversation or laptops as wifi is free. 
I will be going back to try more beverages as well as baked goods.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: What a great place!  I got a double cheeseburger and fries.  Service was excellent on a busy Saturday night.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: Always so yummy. They have a great online ordering/pick up situation here. Parking can sometimes not be ideal but I make it work for the Korean inspired burritos. The spicy pork is fantastic. The burrito does have some kick with the sauces but the sour cream and greens keep it reasonable. Portions are large, I typically go for the burrito or Gigi and waffles and can't finish the whole thing. Though the menu is simple, Seoul taco is packed with huge flavor.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I ordered delivery and it was OFF THE HOOK delicious, hot, fresh, amazing, on point. We got a steak quesadilla, a burrito and a couple spicy pork tacos. Sauce was served on the side and I enjoyed trying each one separately and together. 
The food and flavors are unique but also accessible to people who don't know where Seoul is or don't think they like Kim chi. If you like tacos and quesadillas, give it a try! It's spicy, sweet, salty, tangy, all the flavors you love. 
The next time I ordered, we walked over to pick it up. They were backed up, but one of the employees was speaking to folks individually to apologize and update them on their orders. By the time we got home with our order, it was good, prepared well and with care, but not quite the same quality as the first time. That could have been due to our 15 min walk home, but I will revisit in the future!! Love having them close by.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Food is delicious! Must try liquid gold cheese on everything. Service is prompt and friendly.  Food and drinks for adults. Food and drinks for kids.  Perfect family place that grown ups can also enjoy.  Great addition to Webster.  The Parkmoor nailed it.  Be back soon!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Nom, nom, nom... the Singapore Mai Fun party platter is $26.01 and is enough to feed a family of 6.  My wife and I get it when we're poor and have food for days.  It comes in one of those alumunium tins you would roast a turkey in and weights about 5 pounds.  

...oh and it tastes pretty good too.
name: China King

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': False}

text: I used door dash this morning to order Seoul Taco today because it's taco Tuesday and I love Seoul Taco. Our food was delicious as usual and even ordered an extra container of kimchi and a pound each of chicken and steak so we can make our own tacos again soon. I don't think the meat comes marinated in their sauce but they have so many layers and so much depth with their food i can definitely whip up some marinade. I'm looking forward to using cooking the meat they offered for our own dinner.   I couldn't wait so i took a bite of my burrito before i got to take the picture
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Have had their cheesesteak, burgers, onion rings, fries, chili, Mac and cheese, drinks, snow cones and about to get their meatball sub. This place is f**king amazing. Everything is so good.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: What a wonderful addition to High Ridge!!!  The Coffee and Hot Chocolate are both excellent.  I love the convenience of having a cute quiet place to meet with friends, and have short business lunch meetings.  The Tomato soup and grilled cheese panini are so good.  The sisters that own Toasted are always so friendly, and such a pleasure to talk to.  If you are in the area stop by and check it out for yourself.  You won't be disappointed!
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text:
A great addition to downtown Webster! Classic diner fare with an updated twist. The smash burgers were great, fries were very crispy. One star off for onion rings being too heavily battered with very little onion to it at all. The chili dog was spot on.

Excitedly tried the sno balls but turns out they were just ordinary sno cones, nothing special to them at all, bummer.

The cherry pie was delish with a buttery, flaky crust. So skip the sno ball and go for the pie for dessert - all pies made in house every day!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Walk and you feel welcomed~ 
Food taste good Af! 
Steak seasoned just right!!  A must try!!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
A great addition to Webster Groves! Nice to have a place for the entire family and not feel like you are dragging the kids to a bar! Bahaha 

We ordered curbside and at the end of the call she asked if we wanted utensils or Ketchup. It's the little things that set places apart (and they were all in the bag)! Food was ready when we arrived and brought out quickly. Service was super friendly. 

The food was great. Hot. Fresh. Delicious. 

Hummm, was the food a tad bit pricey?? Yes, it was. But, was it worth it? Yeppppppp it was!

Burgers were smash Steak 'n Shake style! Fries were greaaat as were the onion rings. Onion rings had that awesome CRUNCH factor, maybe a tad bit too much batter but really can you have too much?! 

Kids meals were a nice addition and the bustiers came with fries, cheese only .50 extra. 

Can't wait to go back and try their SnoBalls on a hot day!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: It's really nice to have a coffee option in House Springs that isn't a gas station. The staff is super nice and they have a pretty good reward program. I've yet to try the food but I've several people eating and it looks awesome.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: I come here a lot. I love the tacos. Sometimes it's AMAZING and sometimes it's a little dry or lacking in sauce/limes so I just have to remember to ask for extra, but overall have a great time here. Plus, where can you get this delicious of tacos for this great a price. I want it right now.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Second go-around at Seoul Taco was better than the first. Got steak nachos and a steak taco and both were great. It is a bit sweet so I think the sweet sauce should be on the side but otherwise pretty enjoyable
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I was excited about this place when I heard about it but it was a let down. Let's just say the cheese is weird. It's just not the normal cheese for a philly. Also, you can't even get a choice of whizz cheese?!?! I got the large and was a little taken back it wasn't cut in half. I had to rip it in half in order to eat it in the car.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Stopped by almost on accident. Local restaurant, the prices are really affordable but the food is out of this world. Never had Korean chicken but now we are hooked! Definitely try it, we even had our kids bday celebration and they are super accommodating!
name: Chicken Seven

text: Had both a thick crust and thin. Thin was better than thick. We think we got the wrong pizza as we ordered pepperoni/bacon and ended up w sausage. Crust on the thick crust is just too hard. Perhaps overdone?  Caesar salad was good.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Awesome! Fantastic customer service, delicious food. I've been here four or five times in the past six months, and it has been a great experience every single time.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Nice family friendly atmosphere, complete with a place for the kids to play and games. We will be back many times over.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: Our family had a great time at The Parkmoor Drive-In! Large menu (don't miss the wings, buffalo chicken ravioli and juicy burgers), excellent & fast service, modern atmosphere, delicious cocktails (bourbon smash) and PIE!! Great location in the heart of WG. Thanks for a great evening!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: The staff had no idea what they were doing. They definitely need a real manager to come in and run the kitchen. No one had any sense of urgency or knowledge of the food service industry. By the time my fiancÃ© and I got our food, the burrito was ice cold and steak in the Gogi bowl was charred beyond belief. We have loved our food and service at other ST locations but the ST in The Grove was unbelievably bad.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
Got the spicy pork burrito and chicken tacos to go. Loved the spicy pork burrito! It was tasty, filling, and did not disappoint. The chicken tacos were ok. They were spicier than I expected and it probably is not a great item to get to go because it looks like a mess if it gets shifted around. The burrito was better than the tacos.

Curbside parking was available in front of the store. The food was ready very quickly! Great stop for Korean-Mexican food.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I had a pork burrito and some Rico fries - both excellent. The burrito filling is a sort of mass of deliciousness that all melds together as it melts in your mouth. And the fries are a filling side to split of wedges with gentle but flavorful seasonings. Others got chicken burrito bowl and a Rico burger - both were very pleased. Service was quick for pickup and very friendly and clean.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Phillies cheesesteaks is pretty awesome I went with my friend on the opening day and definitely wasn't disappointed. I love the teriyaki chicken sandwich but everything I have tried so far is really good. The bread is fresh the steak and chicken is cooked well and everything is seasoned adequately. They also have really good deals sometimes
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
This review is based on drive thru the first week they were open so maybe issues have disappeared.  Called prior to ordering online to ask what WHET includes on the burritos and either the gent didn't want to tell me or didn't know because he hung up.  Undeterred, I ordered online.  Pick up (drive thru) was just plain odd.  Text/email said food was ready so I get into the drive thru lane and wait for 5 minutes for the car in front of me to get their order.  Once at the drive thru window I have to wait another 5 minutes for my food order.  While waiting, you get a great view of the kitchen staff doing their stuff which doesn't give me much confidence in a great outcome.  2 stars for the lead up to dinner.
Carbon Burrito (still have no idea what WHET includes) was very good but I was hungry so a shoe may have tasted fine.  I would try it again.  Bacon pizza was great, certainly hit the mark here according to kid #1.  Wife enjoyed her Rico salad w/chicken.  Kid #2 had a  Carbon quesadilla which I finished off as leftovers the next day.  That was pretty tasty! For the actual food I'd give it 3.5 stars. Pricey for a drive thru.  
Overall review rounds up to 3 stars
Location is great but also a curse. The night I picked up, people waiting for their orders blocked much of the ingress/egress which made the drive thru challenging.  Interesting comment from someone else about the tax rate - 11.1% does seem high
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: If you crave nostalgia, probably worth a trip. If you want the best $10 cheeseburger in town, this isn't it. Nothing special at all. I will say the heavily battered onion rings were tasty. And, how can you claim to be Parkmoor reincarnated and not serve shakes! Server was clueless about almost everything. If it weren't within walking distance from my house, I'm sure I would never return. Since it is, maybe I will see if the bologna sandwich is the house specialty!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: My wife and I split the King burger and the fried Bologna sandwich. OMG. Both were amazing. The onion rings were some of the best I've had!  We will be back!!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I love this place for a tasty, healthy, inexpensive takeout meal. They have an enormous menu, but I usually go with the "diet menu" steamed chicken and veggies. Chicken is tender and perfectly steamed and veggies crisp and super fresh. Portions are very generous.?They also have tables for dining in, if you prefer. Staff is unfailingly polite and accommodating. I see they've now enabled Grub Hub for online orders, so have additional cost for this convenience. Please tip generously, folks. These are lovely, hard working folks.
name: China King

text: Friendliest staff and great coffee! All the treats they offer are so delicious. My daughter really enjoys all their unique cake pops. This has been our go to coffee shop since they've opened their doors.

text:
Neighborhood Gem Alert!!
This little cozy coffee house is awesome!

I get the cold brew with milk. My fav! This has such a distinct taste that I find it addicting in the summer.
 They have wonderful homemade bakery items. I do banana bread and it has toasted pecans baked in which is so tasty. (that's how I do mine at home now! )  

The owners and staff are amazing too. Always friendly, kind and striving continually towards making their business shine and their customers happy.
That's my experience and we've been here plenty. 

The atmosphere is cute too. Cabin-Moose-murals-theme. Games & books/kiddie section/locals artwork on walls for purchase. 
Proud and happy to have this little gem as my local coffee house!
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: This place is exactly what 2020 needed! We tried this on a weeknight a couple weeks after they opened. We are big fans of Pi pizza and now it's right down the street...WITH A DRIVE THRU!!! Highly recommend the Glendale pizza and treat yourself to a Cadillac Margarita...one was plenty for 2 people. Convenient timed online ordering  with a text message when it's ready to pick up at the window. The easiest carry out ever and friendly.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Great addition to the neighborhood. Friendly staff and great tasting food! I highly recommend the boneless chicken with honey garlic sauce--very crispy and just the right amount of sauce to give it the perfect flavor.
name: Chicken Seven

text: Coffee is good, they have it all. Service is friendly and fast. Nice addition to the area. They are very welcoming and have a nice set up. They offer games to use and have large tables to play them at.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: This is a great little coffee shop in an unlikely spot.  There are no other coffee shops that I'm aware of nearby, but Toasted covers the bases extremely well.  Their coffee is very, very good.  My wife bought me some whole bean coffee from them to take home and it was really wonderful, and every drink I've had in the shop has been excellent.  Food is tasty too, and my wife loves their fresh baked loaves of bread. In addition to the food and drinks the atmosphere is inviting, they have games and books available, merchandise from local artisans and authors, and a nice little play area for kids with toys and chalkboard walls.  If you are in the High Ridge, Cedar Hill, Dittmer, Byrnes Mill, House Springs, or Fenton areas check out Toasted.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: My stomach is happy to give this place a five star review. There are not many places that have healthy options these day. NO fast food greasy here. NO stand in line at the trough to eat as much as you can here.  Just yummy satisfying deliciousness here. Good place to sample vegan made items.  We got our food to go as we were passing thru the area.

text: It was ok at best, some good flavors in there but kind not really complementing each other. text: This is a long over due post. I ordered large cupcakes for my son's first birthday party, and toasted exceeded my expectations! I sent the owners a picture of my son's birthday invitation to provide the color scheme. I had told them I would be happy with plain icing but gave them creative freedom based on the invitation. When we went to pick them up, the store was set up beautifully. In addition, the staff was so kind and made us feel special as we talked about our order. They went above and beyond! We ended up with bakery level cupcakes for an amazing price. I can't wait to try their in house pastries the next time I am there. These ladies are extremely talented and we couldn't have been more pleased with our experience! I highly recommend toasted for catering and will be using them again in the future.
name: Toasted Coffee House

text: This was definitely some of the best hard shell tacos and beans and rice I have ever had. Love the atmosphere too. Veggie burrito was tops too!

text: BRA.VO. to this Coffee Shop! Coffee, Food, Service and Atmosphere is above and beyond. This locally owned and operated coffee shop brings life to High Ridge! text:
Went on Christmas eve.  It was empty!  I had the Kung Pao Baby Shrimp.  Came with the usual vegetables and a scoop of white rice (they have brown, but I forgot to ask).  My  vegan date had a bowl of bean curd soup, a bowl of mixed veggies, and brown rice.  Net price including 4 vegetarian egg rolls and one fountain drink, ~ $25.

Got the impression that it's more if a carry-out than eat-in, as many of these little Chinese places are.

Would definitely recommend.

text: This new Glendale location is pretty convenient as far as picking up on my way home from work. The drive thru pick-up window makes that even more convenient! I ordered a Deep Dish Cornmeal Crust Pepperoni and Bacon. This pizza is not Chicago deep dish but it's still great. It had been a while since I had it and the cornmeal crust is really good and substantial. It is a little grainy in a good way. There's a whole lot of cheese and the chunky tomato sauce on the top. Slightly sparse on the pizza toppings. A few sprinkles of crushed red pepper make it even better! This was a welcome, and rare, departure from my usual St. Louis style flat pizza. It was also excellent leftover and cold. I'm one of those people who love cold pizza. I enjoyed it and I am going to remember I like it. I'm sure I will be back!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
I'll be real honest with you: the only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the poor customer service/interaction at the checkout. Watched lady at the front running register kind of be a dick to a guy who walked in wondering if she had said something to him (which if you were there, you would understand).

Will re-rate after my next experience (should there be one).
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
We actually had higher hopes for this place.  They skimped on the meat in the bulgogi bowl and especially in the spicy pork tacos.  It was as though they ran out of pork and had just a little bit to spread across our 3 tacos.  We ate again shortly after coming here because these meals weren't filling enough.  Also the pork was a little overcooked.

We are normally huge fans of Korean BBQ restaurants and this place unfortunately isn't up to par with most others when it comes to the taste & quantity of the food.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I'm so glad that Pi is back in the Webster/Kirkwood bubble. I love the concept of this pick up location for what I think is one if not the top multi location pizza places is the area. 

The order was extremely easy to place online. I was even provided with a pick up time. I am a gluten free gal so that is an important feature for me. I ordered a GF pizza that didn't have fully GF ingredients and was called by the restaurant to substitute. How cool is that!!

When I arrived at the drive through at the designated time I was treated by an employee so friendly, I would have loved to had stayed to chat! We received our order quickly and we're on our way! Everything was as smooth as could be and the pizza was spot on. The only downside to Pi is the price but three pizzas fed a family of 5 with no complaints.

Will try RICO next time!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Very happy to have a Seoul Taco in the Grove! Can't really go wrong with anything on their menu, but I'm a particular fan of their bulgogi and spicy pork tacos & bowls.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I was so happy when I heard that Pi was reopening in the area! This location is convenient for me and I love the drive thru window. After being open a week or so, none of the issues shared in some previous reviews happened for our Sunday night order. I placed the order mid-day for a 5:15 pickup. Order was two pizzas, two salads and a kids meal. I got a text that it was ready at 5:10 and pulled in shortly thereafter. Was handed my food and out in seconds.

Everyone greatly enjoyed the food! The pizza was delicious, salads were fresh, and the kids meal had a ton of food (fed both my kids with one).

I'll definitely be back and am glad to have them nearby!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: While the food was decent, it was rather expensive for a what we got,    Two in our party got burgers,   I got the philly roast beef.    Everyone enjoyed what they got.  Onion Rings were fantastic.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: We're so happy to have this place within walking distance! We loved the old PiPizza and missed it when it closed.  Even better now with the expanded Rico menu and some sandwiches too! We had the bada bing salad ( even the small is enough to share) and half and half pizza, craft beers. Service and food was excellent. Katie at the bar was great. Welcome to the neighborhood!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
China King is a good option for what I think of as traditional St. Louis style Chinese takeout. 

The combo meals are definitely the way to go! They come with an entree, pork fried rice and an egg roll. I had the sweet and sour chicken which was delicious. The sauce comes on the side and was pretty thin (I liked it a lot, the consistency for me was better than other places which have a really thick sauce). The egg rolls were also awesome - filled with lots of meat and veggies with a good crispy outside. The fried rice was nothing special, definitely tasted better with some extra soy sauce added in. I also tried an appetizer of dumplings. You can choose fried or steamed and I went with fried. The dough was tender on the inside and crispy on the bottom. The filling was seasoned well and they came with a tasty dipping sauce with a little kick. 

We ordered through door dash and the food arrived quickly and was still hot and crispy when it arrived.
name: China King

text: This place turned out to be so different from what I expected based on the online photos and website and I'm so happy. Decor... this place is fun! Bright colors, open space and a scoreboard on the wall. Mason was my assigned staff member and he was very friendly, attentive and helpful. I was stuck between the King Burger, Crispy Chick and Shrimp Po'boy. Even though he recommended the Po'Boy, I went with the Crispy Chick add bacon, Swiss, lettuce and tomato w/fries, Wedge Salad to start. Huge salad with ample toppings, fresh and very tasty. They've got great ranch dressing, not heavy on the mayo side. Chicken Sandwich was amazing! This is what I call a freshly hand breaded chicken sandwich! The crust was seasoned well and not too thick. Now, this place serves Snowcones and Adult Snowcones along with Pies, but I didn't have any room for dessert... next time though!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Went for lunch with my family and sat outside and was happy to have the space heater.  So happy I went as I was not very interested in going and being at a restaurant.  Seating was well spaced and there were plenty of heaters.

The food rocked! The toasted Raviolis were a big surprise - loved the Spicy seasoning.  Crispy Chick, Shrimp PO Boy, and Cheeseburger all got thumbs up, but the menu standout item was the Frankfurter.  

A big thanks to the staff who were fantastic - we appreciated the menu recommendations and attentiveness.  Saw 5-6 cars pull up for carry out and it looked like well organized.

We will be back and try carry out as well.  This is a restaurant I want to support and make sure it gets through Covid!

text: This Seoul Taco is by far the worst Seoul Taco location all caused by the staff not caring and obviously management not doing anything about it. I have been to this location for probably close to 200 times and I always get the same thing, a gogi bowl. The only consistent thing about it is that the meat is always seasoned well (the reason I keep coming back) other than that the bowls are never the same. They always pre cook the eggs so they end up being a hard egg, not the sunny side up as it should be. Out of those 200 times I have ordered this bowl I always get it with Seoul sauce, out of those times they have not put it on the bowl at least 150 of those orders. They also have the audacity to charge 50 cents for a tablespoon of that sauce that you may or may not get. I truly think that if the owner would audit this location he would be deeply upset with the quality of food that is coming out of there.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
St. Louis: you guys have an absolute gem of a Korean fried chicken restaurant. Not only is this probably the best fried chicken I've had in the States, but you'll be hard-pressed to find a better one in South Korea. Certainly lives up to the hype of St Louis' proud reputation as one of the best food cities in America.

Upon entrance, it's a humble, clean interior. An added bonus for the bathrooms being clean and the sunlight beaming through helps you feel like you're getting a blessing of sorts, which is exactly what this place is.

The main event is of course the chicken itself-- the breading is extra crispy and light and allows the sauce to shine through. I got both the YumYum & spicy soy garlic. I'd recommend the latter as the spice factor seems a bit more prominent on it but the sauces were light, flavorful, and hit the sweet & savory notes we love to taste. I was pretty surprised to see that a LARGE drumstick(s) was included. Not only was the drumstick huge, but it was extremely flavorful as well. You can tell they've done something extra with it, perhaps a brining of sorts to help also get the poultry edge off of it too. I'm more of a wings/flats guy but this drumstick was absolutely excellent. All in all an unforgettable experience. 

I got the ra-bap and Korean corndog too. I love me some black pepper in my fried rice and I love how they really lean into it. It's wonderfully seasoned and the cheese rounds out the flavors extremely well too. I've only made this at home for myself and  I personally make it with the noodles uncooked to give it a crunch, but the noodles are cooked through here. The corndog has a light coating of ketchup & sugar and the sausage is separately at the bottom while the corndog itself is stuffed with cheese. Just like it should be if you were to get them from a street stall in Korea.

Trust me on this one y'all. It delivers proper justice to Korean fried chicken. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and will absolutely make it a point to return when I come through St Louis again. Thank you, Chicken Seven!
name: Chicken Seven

text: Delicious!  We were in Grafton to see the eagles and were so surprised to see a vegan/vegetarian place in the area with such great options.  We had the fried chicken sandwiches (McDonalds style, but more delicious), the onion ring beyond burger, the ISH (fake-fish) pieces, impossible crunch taco, and the illy (Philly) cheesesteak sandwich.  All were amazing.  The sandwiches and burgers came with fries.  I am picky about my fries- I think most places get them wrong- but these were outstanding.   If I got the onion ring burger again, I might see if I can get it with the impossible burger instead of the beyond burger, since it looks from their menu like they have both and I like the impossible burger better.  I'm vegetarian, and my husband's an omnivore, and our meal was a hit with both of us, and our kids!

text:
Ah, The Parkmoor. Just the name conjures up grad school breakfast meetings. How I missed it when it closed.

The Parkmoor Webster Groves addition does an excellent job of bringing back all the feels while modernizing the drive in for the new millennium. In the days of Covid, we enjoyed our Saturday lunch on the sidewalk "patio". The tables were comfortably distanced with large umbrellas. 

We had the single burger, mine with onion rings, the hubs had fries. Both were delicious! These are diner-style "smashburgers". They come with the standard lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion and this amazing Parkmoor sauce. The portions were large enough that I couldn't finish my onion rings (and that was after a 2 hour workout).

We didn't try a snowball or other dessert, but I'm definitely game WHEN I go back. They also have other great menu options, including a hot dog I was oogling when it came out for another table.  

Bottom line--splurge on calories and get yourself to the new Parkmoor.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

We called and they had a pretty long wait. But when I showed up they had the food ready and it was tremendous. Carnitas taco, BLT Salad and deep dish pizza. It was all great and we will be back.

text:
The Parkmoor is in the old Half and Half in Old Webster across from Straubs. Im not sure of the owner is a relative of the old Parkmoor that I knew at Big Bend and Clayton, but there are definitely things from there in this new Parkmoor. 

I had the fried bologna sandwich.  Its a very healthy low calorie snack...NOT!!!! Basically its layers of fried bologna with two grilled cheese sandwiches as the bread. Ummm Yummmmmm! The fries were pretty dang good too. I had them with the cheese sauce.  This is not for people that have had by-pass surgery. 

My wife had the single burger with onion rings. The burger is a smash type burger. It was delicious. The onion rings were AWESOME! Some of the best I've had. 

Lastly, we had peach pie ala mode. It tasted like it was made by a chef, because it was. We both surmised this was not an off the rack pie. The waitress told.us the chef did indeed make it. You could tell the peaches were fresh just by looking at them.  If you're here, I recommend at least sharing a piece with someone just so you can try it. Ill try the others on my return trip.

Great place to eat!!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
With football season upon us, we found ourselves in the mood for wings but not wanting to go to a standard chain restaurant, insert Chicken Seven.
I've eaten at Korean chicken restaurants in a few other cities, and was so excited to hear we now have one in St. Louis!
I am happy to report that this place did not disappoint!! We ordered a "little" of everything - ra-bap, rice crispy chicken, wings, and drumsticks (+ fries). First of all - THE PORTIONS!!! They are huge! We knew we would have leftovers but we will be eating on it all week! The drumsticks are very large and the wings are much bigger than what you'd get from a chain. Both were very flavorful and tender. The spicy soy flavor is not for the faint of heart - the heat builds up over time and you definitely need their vinegar-based slaw to cool off (comes with the combo). You also get fries with the combo meals, and they were surprisingly delicious! 
I have never had cheese with a Korean rice dish, so that was a nice surprise in the ra-bap. We did ask for a side of standard oy sauce for this dish. After eating the super flavorful wings, the rice dish just needed a little salt boost.
The crispy chicken tenders were very good! Crunchy and light! 

Some extra notes:
-I believe they are still adjusting to dine-in service and are more used to supporting deliveries, but once we all got in the swing of things, everything was great and the server was awesome!
-They don't have a liquor license yet and is BYOB for now.
-There were 2 small TVs above the bar with NFL games on. There was a larger TV in the dining area, but it was playing music videos. I am not sure if that TV isn't able to get cable or if no one asked to change the channel. Either 
way, it was nice to have the TVs above the bar.
-No outdoor dining available (yet?), but I read they plan to add a few tables in the future.
name: Chicken Seven

text: So here goes. I remember over thirteen years ago having one of the first Korean taco food trucks in the nation, Kogi, while I was in NYC. I see the Korean taco has finally made it big to this area. We were told Seoul Taco was good so I decided to see what was up. We split the bulgogi burrito and asked for sauce on the side. It really was the perfect portion to split for me and my husband. The bulgogi was tender but flavored as well as bulgogi is. How would I even know?  I'm Korean. We grew up eating this almost weekly and we just moved here from Houston and we are laden with Korean BBQ joints. We've also hit up the ones in LA and of course the OGs in Korea. So beef tender and close but completely bulgogi. I really liked the kimchi rice inside the burrito. I wish the rice had actual pieces of kimchi in it. The flavor was good. The side sauces were good too.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
First time here with my family, we were really excited to try it out.  Husband ordered the po boy shrimp sandwich, that was ok but the bread ended up being soggy. I ordered the veggie burger and that was good. our daughter had the mac and cheese, again another good one!  I gave this place 3 stars only. Because the service could be better, I felt our table was not getting the attention. 

also we really went here to try out the sno ball , but we did not get it because it took FOREVER, so we just asked for the check and left. 

It shouldn't take 25+ minutes to get one order of sno ball out, we were waiting on our blue raspberry sno cone, by the time the waiter made it back to our table, i sure he forgot about us and the sno ball, he said he checked on it but it turns out it was melting and asked if we want to wait for another one. No thank you.  So we drove elsewhere for desserts.

text: I have been wanting to try this place out since they opened last year. I saw an advertisement on Instagram for BOGO this weekend so I went. I ordered a classic Philly cheesesteak, fries, and a sprite. I called to order and they wouldn't allow me to since it was a special nor could i order online. I went inside and placed my order. I paid an extra $.75 to add tomatoes to the sandwich. I waited about 10 minutes and my food was ready. The man at the counter was really nice and patient. The Philly came with some kind of liquid four cheese mix and it was just okay as it lacked a lot of flavor. The sandwich itself and the fries were just okay. I would definitely say penn station Philly cheesesteaks taste better. I noticed my green peppers looked almost raw and they would taste better cooked on a Philly. My daughter and I were both underwhelmed with the taste.

categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Haven't even eaten the food but the ordering is painful. It said I could pick it up after 12:20. At 12:40 it still wasn't ready. It doesn't appear to be busy, but given that there is an employ wearing a mask under their nose I don't love spending too much time in here. At this point I see the employee ask someone if they are there for pick up. The sign says if you are getting pick up or delivery to stand in a very specific spot and they were bringing them out to other people so I assumed I wouldn't need to check in as nobody said anything and there was a table there with spots to pickup orders. Turns out that my order had been sitting there the entire time in a black box off to the side . Either have clear signs and follow a system or ask every customer that is standing in the pick up area what their name is.

categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
Extremely average.

I came here yesterday for Burger Week. The place was clean, pretty full, and really loud and rowdy. Noise just bounces from the floor to the ceiling, to the wooden tables/chairs/booths. I couldn't hear myself talking to my sister on the phone, who also said "where are you because it's really loud?" 

To give a quick rundown of the food and my cocktail: the bourbon cocktail I had was excellent! The burger was trying to be on the same level of Shake Shack and doesn't compare. It was bland and basic. Read my experience below for more details on that. The fries are essentially McDonalds fries. Would you pay $13.75 to get McDonalds fries and a lesser version of Shake Shack burger? 

The service was fair but friendly. My waitress suggested that I go with one of their regular menu burgers instead of the $6 Burger Week burger because she said it's really small. I was starving so I agreed. I ordered the King Burger with fries and a bourbon cocktail (the one with mint, simple syrup, and lemon juice, sorry I can't remember the name). 

I got my food really fast, like rocket speed, but it was missing onions which was noted on the menu and my waitress directly told me that "raw onions" come on the burger. I looked throughout my burger and found no onions. I flagged my waitress and told her. She apologized and said she'd go get some, and confirmed if I wanted raw or grilled onions. I replied that I wanted raw. She turns to walk away and 10 seconds later turns back saying that she thinks she sees them on the bottom of my burger. Honey, I've looked and there are none. She stood there and basically had me dissect my double patty burger, ripping the patties apart tearing the cheese up all to show her YET AGAIN, THAT THERE ARE NO ONIONS ON THE BURGER. She then walked away to go get them. Why did she come back less than a minute later with grilled onions saying "I brought you grilled onions because they taste better." Ma'am, I asked for raw. I accepted the grilled, which legit tasted like White Castle onions. They did absolutely nothing for the burger, and I think the raw, as designated on the menu for this burger would have been a much better choice, which was my choice in fact, but I did not complain.

By this point, I was ready to go. They offer basic desserts including snowballs and ice cream, but my experience and the loud noise kept me from wanting to endure this experience any longer. The cocktail is the only redeeming value of my experience as it was exceptionally good, but everything else was subpar from other dining experiences in the near vicinity or greater metro area. This place seems to be confused on what it's trying to be. It has the appearance of a family friendly restaurant with its bright colors and cheerful demeanor, but with a bar, and with loud ambiance. It kind of seems like it's trying to be a kid-friendly sports bar and grill, which you can just do Applebee's, Buffalo Wild Wings, etc. for that. It's too much and not enough at the same time.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: A family favorite! The snow cones should not be skipped. Onion Rings with parkmoor sauce, crispy chick with spicy sauce and cheese fries are our faves. Service and quality always great!

text: I grabbed dinner here last night. Boy I'm glad I did. One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. They made it fresh and it tasted that way. Couldn't have picked a better side with those fries too. Delicious! I can't wait to go back and try the other options. My one nit is pricing. If they get me out the door with a combo for $10, I will up this to five stars. I got the big sandwich, fries, and a diet (lol) coke. It set me back $18. Knowing what I know now, I shoulda gotten the half but even that would be around 13-14, idk. I think a $10 combo would get me coming here weekly. At $18, I have to save up and go monthly lol. text:
Chicken Seven is a privately owned Korean fried chicken joint on far S Grand, just north of Carondelet Park. The building is painted yellow. It's small, but you will not miss it.

The chicken is coated with a sweet hot sauce  that isn't overpowering. The menu is small, but tasty. Chicken Seven is not a diabetic /low carb paradise, but the food is yummy and different if you are looking a change. 

The restaurant was formally a neighborhood bar. Not full of ambience, but it does the job. It's mostly carry out due to staff shortages. Either way, they ask that you order online before you come.

I recommend that you give it a try. It's not my every day place, but it's good!

text: New establishment, so we decided to give them a try. Service was great, everyone was attentive, and nice. It was obvious that they are a new operation and still fine tuning some things, but no setbacks. We tried their Korean Corndogs, Drumsticks, Wings, and Rice Crispy Chicken Breast. Everything tasted great, fresh, crispy, and unique. The only thing that we wish that they had was more napkins at the table or some wet-naps/wet-wipes to clean up your hands at the end.  They had some plastic finger covers, but we preferred to just dig in naturally and their tasty sauces like to stick on your hands. A tip is to order ahead if you're short on time. They're food is freshly made to order and the chicken can take up to 40 minutes to prepare. In summary, a nice new addition to the South City food scene with a crispy K-Pop twist.
name: Chicken Seven

text:
Chicken seven is a brand new Korean chicken place down on South Grand. They do thick and crispy breaded chicken (boneless breasts wings and legs) 

Dine in is open as of August 6

We ordered the rice crispy chicken breast (delicious crispy spicy boneless chicken),
the drumstick wing combo with original, soy garlic, and yumyum and the takoyaki

Drumsticks are massive!!!!! Wings not so much. Personal favorite so far is the soy garlic. Great flavor on everything. Not sure if you order the regular wings if they use different ones.

Korean chicken is an extra crispy thick breading while still being extremely juicy and moist.  A multitude of different sauces, definitely something for you here.

The takoyaki is a slightly crispy with a great sweet and salty flavor.

text: Picked up a late dinner consisting of 3 menu items. Arrived home and found a cigarette butt in one of the dishes. Immediately called the China King on Manchester Rd in Des Peres, MO  to inform them of it. The call was taken by the female owner and she asked if I would like a new order or a refund. Was she kidding about a new order? Really?!?! I opted for a refund and informed her I would return the next day since I was already at home and had lost my appetite. The next day I returned to the restaurant and the female owner was quick to pull cash out of the register to hand me. Since I frequented this restaurant I trusted the female owner so I didn't even bother to check how much she handed me. I took a few steps away from the counter and so happened to find I was refunded for only 1 dish from my whole order. When I returned to the register I informed the female owner that I was not given the correct amount. She explained that she refunded me only for the dish that had the cigarette butt in it. I informed her that I wanted a full refund and that the whole order was untouched knowing the unsanitary prep/handling of the food. The complete untouched food was in my vehicle and I asked if she would like to take it back. She did not want the food back and ended up refunding the whole amount. I was very disappointed w/ how the female owner handled the situation and disgusted knowing that the cooks smoke while preparing the meals. I went back and forth with deciding whether or not I should review this establishment but I only find it fair that their customers should know to be aware of their unsanitary food prep. Customers check your food before you chow down. As for China King you can be assured this will be brought to the attention of the STL DOH and BBB.
name: China King

text:
OMG!!!!!!!!!!!

I've been many many times to CC's, and I've never had a negative experience. Their vegan food is amazing!

I've been vegan for 3 years, and pre-vegan my favorite food was fried catfish. I'm from the rural South, and I've missed catfish so much. But since going vegan, I've been unable ethically to eat fish. So today - I ordered CC's ish bites. It came with their tartar sauce, onions, and pickles. Can I just tell you - my taste buds went back in time to my childhood - and the many memories I have of eating fried catfish. 

Please - get down to CC's and support this small business! We can't let this place disappear....I'm begging you.
