text:
Update: Food seems to be more consistent now with each time I order.

This Seoul Taco is by far the worst Seoul Taco location all caused by the staff not caring and obviously management not doing anything about it. I have been to this location for probably close to 200 times and I always get the same thing, a gogi bowl. The only consistent thing about it is that the meat is always seasoned well (the reason I keep coming back) other than that the bowls are never the same. They always pre cook the eggs so they end up being a hard egg, not the sunny side up as it should be. Out of those 200 times I have ordered this bowl I always get it with Seoul sauce, out of those times they have not put it on the bowl at least 150 of those orders. They also have the audacity to charge 50 cents for a tablespoon of that sauce that you may or may not get. I truly think that if the owner would audit this location he would be deeply upset with the quality of food that is coming out of there.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I love that we are having all sorts of new places opening in my hood! This is no different. Here are some pros and cons of the Parkmoor after two visits:

PROS
- Easy online ordering for curbside and quick delivery of meal
- Outdoor seating that is well spaced (not all gathered in a small area)
- Walk up window to order sno cones
- DELICIOUS sno cones, tons of flavors and sizes, and optional boozy sno
- Delicious fries
- Good portions
- Husband loved the burger

CONS
- Vegetarian options severely lacking. Would love a veggie burger, adult grilled cheese, or a more substantial salad
- Kids grilled cheese was not good (american on white bread)
- One of my big memories from the old Parkmoor was vanilla malts. No shakes/malts on the menu.

Will I be back? Yes for sno and fries, but would love to see those veg options for a full meal to appeal!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: We had burgers & snowballs for dessert.  We'll go back but only trying out some other new restaurants that we've been wanting to try too.  Service was a little slow but probably because it d shortage on waitresses?
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: DELICIOUS FOOD! I've been vegan for 4 years, and local vegan places like these make my world go 'round. My friend (vegetarian) and I (vegan, obviously) ordered: fries, the Illy cheesesteak, the buffalo chickN wrap, the cauliflower bites, the notcho nachos, fries, and a mango icee (we were hungry). The food was exquisite. The vegan cheese was creamy and deeply satisfying. Everything was seasoned well. My cheesesteak blew my mind even though I didn't like normal cheesesteaks when I wasn't vegan (it must've been that cheese!). I would give a 6/5 if I could. Will revisit.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text: This place is definitely just takeout since there's no seating but it's Covid times so no dining in for me anyway. The cashier was nice. Seems like a popular place since there was a small line when I got there but it went pretty fast. Simple menu with different Philly sandwich options. Got the chicken and the classic steak. It's definitely expensive for Philly sandwiches but you also get a lot of sandwich for the price. They were tasty but I think they should add a little more meat for the price. It was mostly bread. We also got the cheese fries and it was very good as well. Will come back if we feel like Philly sandwiches again.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: My family and I have been searching STL for an authentic Philly with actual cheddar Whiz since we got back from Philadelphia about 2-3 years ago. We finally found it! This place has AWESOME food! The sandwiches were perfect, absolutely delicious, and even the special order sandwich was spot on! The bread, the meat, and the cheese we all so good and put together right with plenty of everything. The staff was also very nice and helpful. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: People were raving about this place so I thought i was in for a treat. The inside is clean and they have good customer service. You can't call in your order so you have to wait, which is not convenient especially with Covid. The inside is small. I think it would be helpful if more people gave some honest feedback about the food. The bread is thick. They may benefit from steaming the bread so that it's softer and moist. The chicken and veggies did not have any flavor on the chicken philly. It tasted like they may have used a cheese blend that included Parmesan cheese which does not compliment a philly well. Hopefully they make some improvements as they go along.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Microphone system in this place is awful. They can't hear you at all so they make the wrong order. Then you get home find a hair in it. You call the store to explain the awful experience and they ask if you can hold. BEWARE! Also, the pork fried rice, not lo main, doesn't have much meat in it.

I received my food and there was a ton of sauce! I requested no Seoul sauce nor sour cream and yet I bite into and there is sauce everywhere.

text:
We've enjoyed Pi Pizza for years, but tonight it's about what's been added to Pi's Menu.... More Specifically TACOS!

Everyone knows we love a great Taco and tonight we have crowned a new STL area Taco Champion!
Why?  Crunchy Tacos that we had to add.... thats right NOTHING To!
More of a Tex Mex Vibe, yes But what we were after!
The Flavors/Seasonings were spot on!
As I've pointed out before, Most places serve ground beef tacos (IF they serve Ground Beef Tacos at all) they are typically lacking in the seasoning department.  Another plus was the prices are good! 
I've given other local eateries high ratings in the past but their prices can at times lean on the pricey side. These Tacos were priced right and every bit as good as any we've had in the area!

RICO/Pi Menu is a Great Idea, Maybe I want Pizza, and she wants Tacos? Well they do that and do it well.... Oops They say they also have Burgers that are excellent! So the diversity of this menu covers a lot of bases WITHOUT sacrificing quality!  Great Job guys!

BTW Love the new location: Spacious and roomy a great vibe=We will be back!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:

My husband had the fried bologna sandwich and loved it and the onion rings were awesome. The single burger was good but the bun is very bread-y for a smaller burger. However, it's probably an appropriate amount of bun for the double burger.

We will be back probably many, many times and I'm looking forward to trying a sno-ball!

text:
China King is our go-to Chinese food take-out spot.  The value is good.  The dinner combination plates are $8 and come with fried rice and an egg roll.  If you are really looking for a bargain, order one of their party platters.  For $24 you'll get enough food to feed a family of 8.  

The food is ok.  While the menu is robust, many of the dishes tate very similar.  My wife likes the sweet and sour chicken and Singapore Mai Fun.  I like the Curry Shrimp and steamed dumplings, We enjoy the St. Paul sandwhiches too.  

I live a little over a mile away.  After I call in my order, put on my jacket and drive over, the food is very often ready... they are quick.
name: China King

text:
OMG.
I never write reviews about how great a place is because I forget (that's how you start these, amiright?) but I had to make an exception for this restaurant. 
Today is my anniversary with my fiance, and he was really craving some Chinese delivery. This was the only China King in our area and we thought they would deliver for us, but once we completed our order they said our address was too far. Just before we were about to settle for a lesser restaurant I got a call from them! THEY SAID THEY WOULD DO THE DELIVERY FOR US if we gave a tip (I love tipping generously people who blow my mind away with great customer service) to which I said I was going to tip anyways! Lol! 
Once we had our food.. and we were taking bites into the amazing General Tso's Chicken and their fried rice I realized that the $10 tip I left them for a $20 order was 100% worth it. 
Our delivery box came with all kinds of sauces, silver/plasticware, fortune cookie, AND TWO OTHER WHOLE COOKIES!! Thank you for how awesome this experience was. 10/10 would totally recommend.
name: China King

text: One of the greatest places to dine in St Louis.  My Parents and Grandparents took my brother and me.  My Wife and I were lucky to be able to take our kids to Parkmoor before they closed off of Clayton Road.  Once they reopened we took our Son and Wife with our Grandkids.  They loved it and ask to go all the time.  The Onion rings are amazing and the King Burger too. Everything is the way We remember it was for flavor and the quality is top notch.  Thank you for reopening and helping to keep a tradition alive.  This place reminds me of some of the greatest and happiest times.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
We were excited to have some Korean fried chicken for our NYE celebration and decided to give this place a try! Definitely a hit for our NYE crew. We ordered earlier in the day for pick up later that evening. They were so helpful to accommodate and called us as soon as it was ready for pick up. Great customer service! 

The chicken itself was pretty good. We ordered the YumYum, Soy Garlic, and Honey Garlic wings and drumsticks. Having had Korean fried chicken in South Korea, the batter resembled the same light and airy texture. We placed the chicken on a rack in the oven to warm up and it still maintain its crunchiness. 

The wings & Yum Yum sauce were the best! The YumYum sauce really stuck to the chicken, especially the wings! The legs were almost too big and I thought a bit dry. The dryness could have been due to it being take out and not eating right away. The other sauces (soy garlic and honey garlic) were good but just didn't have too much of a flavor difference. 

The chicken also came with coleslaw and fries. The coleslaw was okay, but lacked flavor. The fries, however, were loved by all! They tasted great, and I popped them in the toaster oven. I was surprised by the maintained crispiness!

Overall, pretty good based on the texture of the meat, fries, flavor and YumYum sauce. I also would love to try some other sauces and street food. Those items look great!
name: Chicken Seven

text:
Nutshell:  Food has great fusion flavors, great portions, great price.  Worth a stop in.

I've been to the Delmar location a bunch, but technically this new location is closer...by like a minute.  That's one less minute I have to wait to get that food in my belly!  This is the second time I've been to the new location on Chouteau.  So I'm going to combine.  Both times I ordered pickup on their website and both times I got the chicken burrito.  I always get the chicken burrito, why mess with perfection?!  The burrito is amazing.  It's huge, lil sweet, lil savory, lil spicy.  It's got kimchi fried rice, lettuce, cheese, shredded carrots, green onion, sour cream, and Seoul sauce (not sure what it is, but it rivals Boss sauce...if you know, you know).  I'm not a kimchi person but I really like how they do it, so don't let that sway you away if you're like me.  My total was about $10 and change.  The only difference between the two visits was the pickup process.  The first time, I showed up at my pickup time and everyone and their mother must have ordered at the same time.  They were running behind by about 15-20 minutes, which was apologetically communicated to me.  It was Friday night and I had nothing to rush off to, so I just popped back outside (because people are gross right now) and waited.  After about 15 minutes I went back in and they were still working on orders.  Total I think I waited about 25 minutes.  The staff were a bit frazzled, but they were still pleasant.  I would say this was a freak anomaly.  This time, I popped in early Sunday evening.  I was actually late, so everything was ready to go.  From the signage I could see, I didn't know what the pickup process was and I told the cashier that I had a pickup order and my name.  I felt like this annoyed the guy working the cashier.  To prevent you from making my error, walk in on the Manchester side, bypass the cashier area and go to the back where you see a line of tables.  They do the pickup orders back there.  The guy back there was very nice and I walked out and went home to gorge myself.  I still love the Delmar location best, but this place isn't bad.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
Tried the new Parkmoor today and was not disappointed.  Amy was our server and she was terrific!  We dined outside.  It was a little cool and windy so she turned the heater on upon my request.  Husband got the single cheeseburger and I elected to try the footlong with chili, grilled onions, cheddar and had bacon added.  Both  were delicious.  We both had onion rings and they were right on mark for the beloved Parkmoor from years ago.
Amy was attentive, friendly, accomandating and made our experience very pleasant.   We will be back.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
The Parkmoor was a chain of diners that that had several locations around STL between 1931-1999, and now it's back! This is a retro spot with all of the basic American staples, and they do them well! They also have both indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a HUGE variety of "snow-balls" (AKA snow cones) for desert).

I tried their wings, nachos, and a "wedding cake" snow cone and it was all delicious! Great new addition to the STL food scene!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: The nostalgic tastes you remember from the original Parkmoor. The onion rings...those sweet sweet onion rings and that king burger are what dreams are made of. Run, don't walk!

text: I have been dying to try C.C.'s so I finally made the trip for the last day of the special "chicken" dinner. It absolutely did not disappoint. I also got the pita with hummus which was quite tasty. The "chicken" dinner came with a side "bacon chicken" salad which was very good and would probably have been pretty good on its own! I was so happy to have mashed potatoes with gravy, I can't even remember the last time I had gravy (one of the few things I miss as a vegetarian). The online ordering process was great and I didn't even have to get out of the car. I really wish I had an excuse to go to Alton more often because I can't wait to try more things on the menu!

text: So Cheesesteak?  Lots of places advertise them and here in flyover country I am always looking for a Genos or a Pats. I mean seriously, how hard can it be?  Bun, Steak, whiz, onions. It does not seem like rocket science. But although some folks get close it is never quite right. I am not saying Phillies is perfect. But it is pretty damn close. We went on a Friday night. It was a treat. We did not pre order. You can check their menu. On our first trip we got bastardized chicken and steak with whiz and onions. They had Super Bowl special and we got a whole for the price of a half. Very friendly and it took about ten minutes. There is no real seating and we wanted it hot so we ate I. The car so I couldn't take a picture. It was awesome, savory and no chewy pieces. My wife raved about it and I thought it was very good. Fries were crispy with that crispy coating that I don't love but it worked. Drink selections were limited to kool aid amd lemonade or water. I am looking forward to running up there from Clayton and getting lunch.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
Crispy Korean Fried Chicken, 7 ways. "7 ways" is actually 6 different sauces and the original "rice crispy." I didn't confirm this is the reason for the "Chicken 7" name, but that is my logical assumption.  Located in S. City near Carondolet Park in what used to be a small Italian restaurant. 

The menu is limited and focused on one thing - CHICKEN. Bone in wings, drumsticks, breasts, or boneless bites. I went boneless. The chicken itself was fresh and fried perfectly. OG KFC traditionally uses rice flour to make sure it's extra crispy. I believe that is the case here. Served with lemon seasoned fries and a green cabbage slaw with canned corn and a lightly spicy Mayo based dressing. Small meal was priced reasonably at $15 for a portion that could easily serve 2. 

The sauces - The OG YumYum sauce was sweet with a hint of black pepper. Definitely recommend! The spicy soy garlic was too spicy in my opinion - I like spicy food but the 9 of 10 spice level wasn't what I was expecting. 

With amazing chicken, why not 5 stars? I wish they had more sides to compliment the chicken. The chicken itself was 5 stars but the menu felt like a limited pop up menu. I would like some different kimchi's or even just a cucumber salad to add on to cool down the spice. 

Atmosphere and decor- Super clean restaurant. The bar area looks cool, however, overall the restaurant decor felt like it lacked originality. Props for the little kid's drawing on the wall. Plenty of table seating. Music "radio" on the TV - similar to "music choice" if you know what I mean. 

Booze? No alcohol served at the bar but I believe you can byob or wine in. Will call ahead to inquire next time if I bring others. A beer would go great with the menu.

Service- I ordered takeout from the bar and good service from my server. The chef brought me my order himself. Very friendly staff. They are smart to cut holes in the to-go container so the chicken doesn't steam itself and lose crispiness. Due to the holes in the container the smell will get you chicken drunk if you drive home with an order. 

Overall, 3.5 - 4 stars, leaning towards 4. Chicken 7 is good but they have a little bit of work to do. Definitely worth a stop to see for yourself!
name: Chicken Seven

I was surprised and pleased to find a new Pizzeria location on Manchester! That being said, if you're used to the old Manchester Pi Pizzeria location with the nice ambiance and plentiful indoor and outdoor dining options then you'd be better served going to another location. 

This spot is more for carry out orders as they only have a few tables. That being said, they still offer the same Pi Pizzeria favorites with the added bonus of Rico's Tacos. The staff was friendly and our order only took about 20 minutes for the pizza  which is to be expected. We ordered a Rico Pi and tried a Carnitas taco. It had good flavor and while far superior to Taco Bell or other fast food Mexican spots it definitely was not an authentic Mexican taco. Overall, this place definitely works for a solid pizza/taco takeout option.

text:
As I am not a native of St. Louis, I cannot claim any specific knowledge of the "original" Parkmoor, of which I understand this to be a re-boot or re-imagining.  My visit for lunch today was therefore not an exercise in nostalgia, but a search for a clean, comfortable, casual, friendly and reasonably priced restaurant serving what has come to be called "comfort food" - great hamburgers, sandwiches, salads, etc.  
The Parkmoor certainly checks all the boxes on the first three factors - clean, yes (although some of the servers masks failed to cover noses or mouths); casual (yes, with colorful but somewhat plain looking wooden chairs, tables and booths inside); and service was efficient and friendly, certainly as to our personable waitress and the waiter we frequently overheard.
Reasonably priced?  Well, I'll give them that too, as while prices seemed a touch high on the menu, portions were fairly large and many patrons, ourselves included, took home a loaded to-go box from the tall and long entrees (e.g., a fried baloney sandwich served on two grilled cheese sandwiches).
But great comfort food?  Sorry, not to my taste.  Mediocre or average at best, to be kind. 
The Philly cheesesteak, described on the menu as "slow roasted beef griddled with green peppers, caramelized onions, giardiniera (pickled vegetables), finished with melted provolone and liquid gold cheese sauce" was seemingly composed of Arby's roast beef with few green pepper fragment, no onions (but instead a bevy of garlic cloves - same color?), three slivers of pickled carrots (which ain't giardiniera in Chicago or Philly, as far as I know) with two slices of provolone and a cheese sauce not unlike the radioactive, non-perishable cheese sauce often found on movie or sporting event nachos.  I derived little true comfort from this cheesesteak.  (P.S. - fries were very salty and not very hot.)
My advice - go for the nostalgia, but ... eat the entrees only if you need to invoke the good ole memories.  (And I don't recommend the cheesesteak.)
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
My friend wanted to find a place to dine outdoors for lunch so since Parkmoor was on my shortlist of places to try we went there.

Thankfully we got a spot under the umbrella in the shade. Flies were abundant but I guess that comes with being outside right?. 

We were quickly approached by our server and I honestly could not decide what I wanted to eat because everything sounded really good. I asked our waiter what he recommended and he suggested the Shrimp Po Boy. I was eyeballing that as an option so I went ahead with it.

My friend got the chicken sandwich and we both got fries as our side. I was surprised at how fast the food came out, but thankful as I was on a lunch break. Everything was hot and fresh and looked delicious.  I was very pleased with my choice. The shrimp was really good and tasty. I was hoping a few more pieces would be hiding amongst the sauce and lettuce since I couldn't eat all of the bread.

Our waiter Mason was great. Perfect amount of check-ins, very knowledgeable about the menu and a great attitude. 

I'm really happy I tried this place and I'll definitely be back to try the menu.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I'm giving this place three stars for food and an extra star for customer service. I was really surprised that the bread was so soft. I'm not sure if there's an option for toasted but I would prefer that. The sandwich filling made the bread soggy. The cheese fries were ok. My expectation wasn't met as far as the seasoning but I would be willing to give it another try with the chicken Philly. The customer service was great!

text:
This is a tough one to review and rate. I don't know what to make of this place.

We dined in and tried to understand the menu. Not that it's not in english but without the pictures on Yelp we wouldn't have been able to figure out what is what. I still don't know what the korean corn dog is. The only thing I know about it is what it looks like on the outside, not necessarily what it's like on the inside. Maybe I just haven't read enough reviews. They try to have an explanation of what the food is but because it's so different than anything else you've ever had before it's hard to picture. 

I got the five piece chicken drumstick, original, my wife got the boneless wings with the korean pepper sauce. 

The drumsticks were quite big - bigger than I thought they'd be. And for the price they were quite a surprise. They were very good. I had one and the other four I took home. 

The boneless wings were extremely good, they were crispy and the sauce was completely spicy and oh so good. Be prepared to have your lips burned off. 

The service was good. We had a new server that was just starting out - she was getting instructions from one of the other employees. 

They have soda in a can. 

 The ambiance is nice. It wasn't loud at all and it was very comfortable. 

Told you this was a tough one for me to review.

We'll definitely be back. We live in the immediate area and I'm all about local business. I guess it's just a matter of exploring the menu.
name: Chicken Seven

text: At long last, the holy grail of Philly cheesesteaks has arrived to the Midwest. St. Louis has long been in need of an authentic cheesesteak place and Phillies is that answer!! I cannot stress this enough. I tried the Authentic Philly Steak (steak, cheese whiz, onions) -- I thought I was back in Philadelphia, delicious! Got a bag of fries as well -- second to none! Chatted with the CEO and it sounds like he really did his research which it definitely shows, with the variety in their menu and great customer service. As a transplant from the Philly area, I can say this is my cheesesteak spot from now on, 10/10 will be coming back. Keep up the great work. Philly would be proud!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: I found this place on yelp and was definitely interested in trying it out, seeing as how the food was different, unique and looked delicious. Walking in I was the only guest and it was very clean and I like the remodel. I did dine in so I wasn't that happy that my food was brought to me on to go plates but maybe she did that because I was by myself and I did order a lot of food and she knew I wasn't gonna eat all of that but I did wanna try some things! So I wasn't too offended but I knew my photos wouldn't look that great! Let's start with the Ra-Bap (spicy chicken fried rice) It wasn't exactly what I expected it was like it had noodles in the rice to It didn't taste bad but it was different, And there was a shredded cheese mixture on top which again was different I asked if there was any Red pepper, soy sauce, sweet-and-sour sauce normal things that I like to put on my rice they didn't have none of that so she put some Sriracha on there for me! It helped but still wasn't as flavorful as I would've liked! The next thing I ordered was the boneless Yum Yum which Came in medium and large size I honestly wish they had a small size but that's just my opinion the chicken was cooked very good the coating was really crispy, I also enjoyed the sauce that I picked the fries were just your  normal Frozen fries that you re-cook I'm more of a fan of natural cut fries but they do have that tornado thing if you're more into that and it came with a slaw salad, that was actually good! I would be interested in coming back and trying some other things on the menu, So I'll check back in the next time I stop by! Happy Yelping!
name: Chicken Seven

text:
I had seen so many foodies (Shout out Mary A and Orlando P!) posting about Chicken Seven and it gave me major FOMO. I kept trying to make it to Chicken Seven because photos of their food looked amazing. When I finally got the chance to visit for a to-go lunch, I was blown away!

Ordering my lunch was super simple through their website. I perused the menu, made me selections and drove to pick it up. So simple! The Chicken Seven location is a small building in South City, but is easy to find because it's painted bright yellow. My food was ready as soon as I walked in. The worker behind the bar was super friendly during our brief interaction while I picked up my lunch.

I'll say... I definitely over ordered! Chicken Seven serves up hearty portions. So keep that in mind while you're ordering. The first thing I ordered was the Tteokbokki. This bowl of pepper sauce was covered in flavorful, gooey cheese. The thing I loved even more about it was Korean rice cakes swimming around this tasty dish. They were delightfully chewy and made the dish a filling meal. I was obsessed with the rice krispee chicken! These bites were flavorful and tender. So juicy. And the best part were the crunchy cereal crisps on the chicken bites. Not sure what sauce was served with the chicken but it was SO yummy.

Can't wait to visit Chicken Seven for a sit down meal!
name: Chicken Seven

text:
We got takeout from the Rico Mexican menu tonight and tried the chicken burrito, carnitas burrito, and a quesadilla kid's meal for my daughter. 

The chicken burrito was delicious, albeit the texture was very homogeneous and it was hard to tell where the rice and cheese was; I think it was mostly refried beans and chicken. I didn't realize that the carnitas burrito had chorizo,  which had a powerful, overwhelming spice/flavor. I loved the salsa and guacamole, which paired well with the burritos.  

My daughter loved her cheese quesadilla but they used the same rice and refried beans in the kids' meal and she was not able to eat it because they were too spicy. I will try the pizza side of their menu next time. It's a convenient location with ample seating and parking.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
The classic look of The Parkmoor on Yelp has caught my eye more than a few times as it keeps popping up on Collections of burger joints and lunch spots in the Lou. My former coworker, Lucas, and I like to periodically catch up over lunch. We usually have to meet in Webster Groves as it is kind of the middle point between his new office and my (home) office. The Parkmoor's bold presence on the web definitely sets it apart from other lunch spots and caught our interest for one of our lunchtime pow-wows. 

Finding the The Parkmoor is super simple. It's located on the bustling business district portion of Lockwood. I easily found on street parking, but had to dodge a few cars going a tad too fast for such a pedestrian heavy locale. 

The retro interior of The Parkmoor is so engaging. Bold colors. Strong lines. And a subtle sports theme. The restaurant had a vibrant energy that lent itself to a jovial meeting with Lucas! Additionally, our waitress was such a gem. She was polite and not pushy. Definitely added to the feel-good vibes of The Parkmoor. 

I will be the first to admit that I'm not the biggest burger person. They're fine. I just never get excited about them. EEEEEEESpecially when they're served on brioche. Ok. So I hate brioche buns. It is objectively the actual worst bread out there. Dryer than saltines. For YEARS I've voiced my displeasure with restaurants touting this garbage excuse of a carb as a high end bread. It's trash. stop using it everywhere. Please. I was a bit bummed that the menu at The Parkmoor didn't clearly identify the bun as brioche, but simply a buttered bun. Had I known I would have ordered something else. But I made it work. Slather enough ketchup on a brioche bun and it'll pass. The actual flavors of my mushroom swiss burger were really good. The mushrooms were tender and added a little extra heft to the smash patties.

Since this lunch was pre-2022 and I wasn't really paying attention to what I was eating, I started the meal with a bowl of their gumbo. The bowl was massive and definitely enough for a meal! I appreciated the selection of hot sauces The Parkmoor offered. I would absolutely get the gumbo again.

Excited to visit The Parkmoor again during the summer to try one of their New Orleans style sno cones. The photos make them look like the perfect summer treat. Especially because you can add a little booze to them to get your night started.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
I remember going to The Parkmoor in Clayton with my mom as a kid. I'm a sucker for nostalgia and my visit here took me back. Katie is so friendly and took excellent care of us. We tried the buffalo chicken toasted ravioli. Red hot ripplet seasoning is my kryptonite! I enjoyed super grilled cheese sandwich with onion rings. The rings were crispy and the best beer batter. The grilled cheese was phenomenal. It comes with caramelized onions which elevated a grilled cheese sandwich to next level. Not to mention the pimento cheese!!! We enjoyed boozy sno cones  in a variety of flavors. Hands down definitely a must visit from the friendliness of the team to the delicious food and the dose of childhood nostalgia. 
p.s. try the cheese sauce with your fries!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Always friendly, down to earth and a exceptional taste of coffee and food! 
Jessica K
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: The staff is wonderful to work with. Food is great and they offer monthly coffee and food specials. Sourdough bread, cake pops, gooey butter cake, banana bread, cinnamon rolls. Can shop local from various vendors. Poetry nights. Live music. I am a frequent buyer and do use the rewards program. My favorite is the mocha coffee with various flavors added in. Chocolate chip cookies are the best I ever had. Not crunchy. Coffee is fresh and not bitter.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: Love that when I come in they are very hospitable and caring. They are quick and responsive. Love their beef bugogi bowl. Love that spicy gachujang sauce.

categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I've been to Seoul Taco in Chicago, but this one was okay at best. Very little toppings on the nachos. I was greatly disappointed. It was amazing in Chicago, and this was not even good.

categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
Everything about this was great! We ordered the loaded fries, Rico-cini, and a chicken taco salad. They have truly perfected take out-- keeping the warm, shredded chicken separate from the salad, and the fries topping separate from the fries-- until ready for consumption. The Rico-cini were flavorful and gooey!

I cannot wait to try so many more things on the menu!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: I'm so impressed! I used to live in south St Louis & still visit my parents every few months. I usually stick to 2 places on S. Grand for my vegan food cravings but I'm thrilled I discovered CCs and will definitely make it my go to! Even if you're not vegan the food here is to die for. The flavors, variety of options and thoughtfulness that goes into each dish is wonderful. My friend suggested I get the supreme burger & it was incredibly juicy & filling (I would have taken a photo but I essentially inhaled it upon seeing it). I can't wait to try more menu items when I'm back in town.

text:
Came back a few months later after we already ate dinner since we were in the area just to get a small bite... Their food is actually even better! This time we ordered the Korean dog, the wing drumstick combo, and the rice crispy chicken tenders.

The breading on the chicken tender is even better now with great sauces to dip into! The fries are nice, crispy, and seasoned, much better than before; and the chicken wings were bigger than the first time when we came.

Still the same great breading; garlic soy is still our favorite flavor but definitely want to try more of the other ones.

We came a little later at night and had no issues with orders or service so can't comment on that.

text:
I enjoyed my first visit to CC's. They only take orders online and are currently doing carry out due to COVID. 

I was firstly excited to have a vegan restaurant so close to home. So after reading about it I hopped in my car and drove to Alton. 

I ordered the beet burger and fried oyster mushrooms. Everything was packaged in earth friendly recycled paper. The mushrooms come with 2 sauces- a sweet & spicy honey mustard as well as a dill sauce. Both were delicious!

I also enjoyed my beet burger and it was tasty too. I wish I had gotten the double burger, but I'll do that next time. 

There was lots of traffic and I can't wait to visit again.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text:
I was extremely excited to try this place after seeing the ads in IG. I love  The OG Chessesteaks from PA.  When we were on/go to the east coast I don't leave without stopping by a good sandwich joint.   So needless to say the commercial had me geeked.  

As we walked in the atmosphere was pleasant thanks to the very hospitable cashier. As we began to order I was like thumbs up  to their specialty drinks which included but not limited to KoolAid yep that's right good ole fashioned koolaid.... Although I didn't partake in this indulgent I was delighted and a bit tickled to see it as a drink option.  

Now with so many good things, it would be a triple A if the food lived up to its name, and here's were it goes average.... The sandwich I order the Classic tasted nothing like one from PA and the other sandwich the Buffalo chicken well was seasoned the same.  I truly don't care for it when all items on the menu tasted the same... Now I remind you we only had two sandwiches so I'm not says all their sandwiches tasted the same only the two we had....

Anywho I was impressed that our food stayed warm cause we had a ways to travel about 20 mins or more. And although it's not a PA Philly steak it was no bad either... Glad We tried it but don't see us going back.  Oh no pictures cause by the time we got home that was the last thing I was doing... lol
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: First time trying CCs Vegan Spot! Everyone was welcoming as soon as you walked in. The menu is completely vegan and delicious! Got the Double Trouble Burger and Mac N Cheese. The burger was huge with loads of toppings. Their menu is online only. So make sure you have a way to look it up online. The wait for food is approx 15min. I'd advise ordering online prior to arrival if you don't want to wait.

text: We ordered in store. I was told there would be a wait maybe 20 minutes. I waited 1 HOUR! For 2 sandwiches that where mediocre at best. They were moderately busy. As someone that works the line in a restaurant the wait was ridiculous for the amount of orders they had on the rail. I'm willing to wait but the food wasn't not worth it. There customer  service was good but you would wait 15 minutes at the register to get your order taken so I recommend ordering online but even then I saw people wait 40 minutes for a online order. The manger left at one point to go to the store to grab a ingredient they ran out of. At this time the cook was not able to take walk in orders and had them wait for the manger to return
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: My first time at this location, and was a bit let down.  Don't get me wrong, the food was great.  Seana ordered the Munchwrap which was just STUPENDOUS!  We shared some Kimchi Slaw and an order of dumplings.  I got my normal Gogi Bowl with brown rice and spicy pork, and none of these items disappointed.  But we got there shortly after they'd opened, and the floors looked like they hadn't been swept or mopped in quite some time.  Also, we ordered a fountain drink, intending to mix unsweetened ice tea with lemonade.  They were out of BOTH, and knew it (when Seana asked, they said, "oh yeah, we're out of those."), so WHY didn't they have it posted???  Seoul Taco hasn't lost me as a customer, but I think this particular location has.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Went on opening day at their new location on Loughborough.  Food took a little longer than expected,  but hey, it was their 1st day. And it wasn't that long. The food was totally worth it! Heard a lot about this restaurant from lots of people who loved this place so I had to come by. I came around lunch time but it wasn't as busy as I thought so that was pretty good. They don't sell alcohol at the moment but offer soft drinks. 

I ended up getting the Wing/Drum stick combo with Yum Yum sauce. Absolutely loved the taste of the sauce and the chicken had an excellent crunch to them. I recommend that sauce but next time I think I want to try the spicy soy i heard that was a good flavor as well. 
Also had the Korean corn dog. *Fun fact* these is no hotdog inside but gooey cheese. This is something that I think is absolutely delicious. I wanted to order another one. 

This spot i highly recommend!!

My husband and I went there for dinner last night. We tried the rainbow jalapeÃ±o appetizer with several cuts of fish in a yummy sauce with jalapeÃ±os on top. The fish tasted fresh, and the sauce was a nice complement.

text:
I've seen this place a few times when jumping on I-55.  It's right by the entrance ramp of the Imperial to 55 north. 

Inside the place is new but a little tacky.   Oh well.  I didn't come here based on the decor.  It is in a Jefferson County strip mall.

I tried the seaweed salad, the New Orleans roll, and Rocky II roll.  The salad was fresh.  The rolls were packed with flavor and very large and everything seemed to be made with care. Based on the location and decor, I didn't think the food was going to be this good.

For sushi lovers, this place is a gem.  There are many other items on the menu other than sushi so don't feel like you can't bring your sushi-intimidated friends.  Prices are reasonable, service was average.

One odd complaint... the table must have had a bow in it... the plates all rocked and spun around.
name: Fuji Sushi

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}

categories: Restaurants, Japanese, Sushi Bars

text:
It's been a couple years at least, but I have been here twice with my husband & on a third occasion for take-out.

It has always been pretty good!  The only time the food wasn't perfect was when we got it to go.  We got all the way out to my mother-in-law's & my husband said something was wrong with his order, but it was still edible.  I think it was a wrong item & a missing item if I remember right.  We were hungry & he didn't want to drive back out there.

I know I have usually gotten the avocado roll.  I have also tried the dragon roll, I believe it was called.  Avocado & tempura, etc. in the roll.  I have also had the vegetable tempura.  I must admit I am not certain if the batter is vegan, but it does taste pretty good, especially if you're lucky enough to get a mushroom.  =)  I have always been surprisingly full when dining here & order too much.  I wouldn't mind getting extra to take home if we ever get to return.

We have enjoyed going here to get out of the house.  It has nice decor & a decent atmosphere.  Could be a little more lively perhaps.  Take a sweater when the a/c is on, but that is true of most restaurants in summertime.  Fuji is definitely a gem that I didn't expect to find in a mini mall in Imperial, Missouri.  

I would definitely go back anytime for some more food & Japanese beer.  They also have sake if you're into that like my husband.  I have yet to acquire a taste for it.  We did take pictures of our food on our last visit dining in, if that tells you anything.
name: Fuji Sushi

The empanadas here are absolutely phenomenal. The spicy beef is actually spicy and has a nice flavor to go with that kick. We also tried the ham. We liked the beef a bit better but both were excellent. They don't look very large but they are filling. 2 makes a decent meal. 

We will definitely be back soon.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
Adoro mucho las empanadas de la Argentina y TANGO tiene las empanadas que adoro tambien.

Siempre que haya un festival hispano en el centro de la cuidad San Louis y yo podemos hacerlo allÃ­, TANGO estÃ¡ siempre allÃ­, y siempre compro empanadas de ellos. Lo que ellos ofrecen para su empanadas es muy simple y bÃ¡sico pero sus empanadas estÃ¡n siempre realmente bien. Los rellenos que ellas tienen son siempre deliciosos y ofrecen cuatro tipos diferentes en los Festivales hispanos donde tener una cabina de alimento. He tenido empanadas que han sido horneados en el horno y empanadas que han sido fritas en el petrÃ³leo, tambiÃ©n, pero el empanadas que el TANGO tiene son fritas y prueba realmente bien aquel camino. La masa que ellos usan es siempre cripsy y crujiente cuando ellas son el amigo y es lo que me gustan aproximadamente ellas.

Ahora ellos tienen un pequeÃ±o lugar en San Charles donde usted puede comprar, comer y disfrutar de su empanadas todo el aÃ±o por ahÃ­ en vez de sÃ³lo ir al Festival hispano o alguno otros de los festivales alrededor de la ciudad cuando ellos tienen su cabina de alimento. Y estoy muy feliz ahora.

(Lo siento mucho si mi espaÃ±ol no estÃ¡ bien porque ha sido un rato ya que lo dije.)
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
So, this place is a bar. I don't think Yelp makes that super clear. It's a loud, smokey, dark, video game filled bar with uneven tables and questionable cleaning practices. That being said, they served me the best drink I've ever had- a pineapple upside down cake martini. Girly, yes, but even my beer drinking husband liked it. His only complaint was their lack of beer selection. 

The food was REALLY good. Unexpectedly so. Burgers tasted homemade. Fries and onion rings were crispy and delicious. Stuffed jalapeÃ±os were awesome. The food could easily stand at a more typical restaurant. 

While I wouldn't recommend this place to just anyone, I enjoyed it. It was a great value for some good food.
name: D's Place

text: D's Place is a good little bar to drink cheap. They recently remodeled and it's now a no smoking establishment. They have excellent food and their ranch and blue cheese dressing is the bees knees. However, the service is usually pretty bad. It seems like every time I come into D's, the bartenders are busy chatting up the 'regulars' at the bar. Actually walked out of here on a Friday night after sitting at a table for 35 minutes without being served or acknowledged by any of the staff. My fiance got a drink from the bar and asked for a menu after about 15 minutes of waiting. We finished our drinks, waited a few more minutes, paid our tab at the bar then left. I've been in here a bunch of times and the service is always pretty slow, but someone eventually comes to take your order. Usually. It's a cool bar, but I feel like if the bartenders don't know you, they aren't really concerned with taking your order or acknowledging your existence. Great wings though.
name: D's Place

text:
Fried Rice.

For me, the rule is the nicer the place," the worse their fried rice is.

This is the main reason why I try all the ghetto places in town, even if they're right next to more "legitimate" places.

The stuff I usually try at these places are wings and fried rice.  The wings at Lam's are typical of any other takeout place, nicely marinated in what is likely soy / sugar / sesame oil and coated in whatever they coat their general tso's in.  I think people underestimate the quality of takeout wings.  

The fried rice, however, is pretty good, but not something I'd get out of my way for.  The main thing that I didn't like about it was that a lot of the meat was dry.

Either way, if I'm jonesing for fried rice and wings, I hit this place up or Wong's Wok.  However, Sun Restaurant still holds my heart as the best ghetto takeout place in town.
name: Lam's Garden

text:
D's has been open for a while now, but I've always been scared to go into the place because I heard it was filled with ho's--or is it hoes? Regardless, I don't like ho's/hoes; they annoy me because they think I'm really that shallow to tip them more than normal because of their big boobs/ exposed thong/ pierced belly button. Show me a place with ho's, and I'll show you a place without me (I know--its inversely related to "College Me."). 

Anyway, so I finally take the step, literally, into D's Place, and what do you know? No ho's/hoes! In fact, there were no servers at all!

When we walked in three guys said hi to us--and not like, "what's up, fellow bar patron," but more like "hello, and welcome to D's." I thought the first two were employees, so I was going to ask if there were servers, or if we simply went up to the bar--but then they left. When the third came by our table and saluted us in the same manner, I simply ignored him, thinking he too was just another customer, but then he asked us if we'd been helped. 

Jesus, I suck at this game. 

So the waitress/bartender finally comes over for our order--which takes forever to get, and when we asked for menus, she brought them over and didn't come back for 15 minutes. Redonkulous. 

Anyway, the most important thing: drinks here--that is, domestic beer and well drinks--are ALWAYS $2. And these aren't served in rocks glasses (for the drinks), they're served in PINT glasses. Also, for you bartenders/drunks out there, its not a tall, its an actual double pour pint glass. 

So, to recap: crappy service (at least on a Wednesday evening), $2 Big Boy cocktails. WINNER!

This place is a serious dive bar. Its the place where you go after playing pick up basketball with your friends because you don't care what you look like. Just make certain to go to the bar instead of waiting for it to come to you.

Oh, but don't eat here--the food is crap. 

NO HO'S!
name: D's Place

text:
I only regret that I waited so long to step foot into this place. The other reviews are right- a lot of regulars hang out here, but every time we go here, we feel welcome by everyone. This should not be seen as a negative thing.

Their wings are fantastic, and they have a really good side salad. The chicken strips are not your standard strips- they are seasoned very well and very crispy. Burgers, buffalo chicken sandwich, and potato skins are also great! One thing that shocked us is that they have some of the best crab Rangoon we have had in St Louis. We ordered it one night after a few too many beers, and it is now something we crave on a regular basis. You really can't go wrong here, folks!
name: D's Place

text:
Miami Grill's advertising hook is "Home of the $10 T-Bone Dinner," and ... well, if you aren't sold yet, what the hell is wrong with you?

It's a "to go/carryout" place -- your food comes in a styrofoam box, and inside is wrapped in tinfoil. They include butter, sour cream and steak sauce, as well as a plastic dinnerware/napkin packet (but I go home and use real silverware).

As far as I can tell, the steaks are cooked fresh and to order, and they're quite nice. I've had the t-bone dinner and the slightly less expensive ribeye. They're of reasonably good quality, very flavorful, tender ... nothing to complain about at all there.

These dinners come with a side baked potato, a slice of bread (optimistically described as Texas toast), and a small salad. Everything's good; the potato and bread could be larger, but for the price, once again, I can't complain. At least not much. That's probably the difference between 4 and 5 stars.

I haven't eaten a whole gyro, just sampled my significant other's a couple of times, but they're definitely worth the price -- if I craved a gyro I'd go there unless I just happened to be closer to Majestic in the Central West End or  Olympia on McCausland just south of I-40, my other two go-to spots for that kind of thing.

I haven't tried the wings. They serve two styles, Miami (i.e. naked) and Chicago (battered), and have some nice price specials for large quantities.

The service is fast and friendly, and when I've called ahead they've been courteous, they've gotten the order right, and they've had it ready when we arrived (it's an 8 or 9 minute drive from home).

Recommended.
name: Miami Grill

text: My husband and I tried this restaurant because it is right by our house. I wish I could recommend it since it is a local establishment, but the sushi was absolutely terrible. I have been to dozens of other sushi restaurants in St. Louis that were better than this - even Dierbergs take home sushi is better! The rolls were small and were loosely held together. The salad had a very watery dressing with pineapple chunks in it. My husband had steak teriyaki which may as well have been boiled because it had no flavor, with some teriyaki sauce poured over it. Not a great dinner experience, especially for the price.

text:
D's Place in Soulard... oh how I miss thee.  Let me count the ways...
1) Tuesday night trivia... debauchery and drinking with relatively easy questions.  
2) Bingo night.  Come in with your pants pulled over your belly button and white socks with loafers... everyone is doing it.
3) Half price pizzas during all the home team games... Plus happy hour is 11-7.  I've never been happy for 8 hours in a row in my life... except for that one time in Mexico... but let's not go there.
4) Sunday brunch with $15 bottomless mimosas from 11-3.  My record is 27... can you beat me?
5) Food better than it should be... try the hand-made buffalo chicken wontons.
6) Some of the best bartenders around.  Jess is a true gem.  Ask for her shot specialty... it's called a chicken-bomb.  It'll get you effed up and feeling like Donald Trump imitating Richard Simmons.
name: D's Place

text:
Fantastic Place! Just discovered this hidden gem upon recommendation from my friends. The atmosphere is nice, clean and modern. The food is probably the best sushi I've had in the area, although admittedly, I haven't eaten at too many sushi places in the Midwest.
This was my first visit, and I ordered the sushi lunch platter which included four sushi pieces, a California roll and small cup of miso soup - all for less than 10 dollars. The sushi I ordered, two Tuna and two Salmon, came out looking and tasting very fresh. I also hear great things about the Yaki Soba here.
With the quality of the food, extensive selection on the menu and great prices, this is definitely a place I'll be returning to and recommend it for anyone looking for good Sushi in the area.
name: Fuji Sushi

categories: Chinese, Restaurants

text:
I had Spicy Szechuan Chicken and it was pretty good.  But seriously...

Garden?  More like a former Chuck-A-Burger.  The Chuck-A_Burgerness of the place was reason #1 I drove past so many times hungry and in search of sodium.  Garden?  Who keeps a filthy stationary bike in their garden?  Yet there it is, amongst the tables.   Maybe a better name would be Lam's Former Chuck-A-Burger and Crappy Gym.

And the Vess salesman surely saw these people coming from five miles away.  Or, more, likely, he's their son.  They have five year's worth of every possible flavor, cans and bottles, colorfully displayed in the cooler.

Me:  Do you have Diet Orange-Pineapple Soda?
Lady:  Yes! YES!! I think nobody evah ask!!
Me:  I'll have a Diet Coke (then to myself: hee hee)
God:  I wish I would have thought of all these flavors when I made the Garden of Eden, then Eve would have just had an apple soda.

Wait a minute...colorful display, Garden of Eden.  Now I get the name!

Tip:  When you go to Lam's Soda Garden, bring your own fork.  Or chopsticks, I guess.  Just don't try to use the extra EXTRA cheap, flimsy and tiny little fork they give you.  What horrible company sells these things?  These forks couldn't stab a bowl of pudding, much less big chunks of onion and green pepper.  Try loading those onions, peppers and maybe some chicken onto one of those little forks for a good bite and you'll understand why I stayed up all night thinking of creative ways to dis this place.

Next visit:

Me:  I'm Back!  And I brought my own fork!!
Lady:  You that Yelpah.  No food!  Go home!!
Me:  Uh...do you have strawberry kiwi soda?
Lady:  Okay, you stay.
God:  Next time see if they have apple.
name: Lam's Garden

text:
Fuji sushi is located in a small strip mall just off of the Imperial exit on Highway 55 on the way to Kimmswick.  I ordered a large to go order.  I ordered the pineapple fried rice that came with good quality and large shrimp and scallops.  Very pleased.  I ordered the Philadelphia roll and asked for fresh salmon instead of smoke salmon.  They complied and the generous portion of salmon was very fresh.  Unfortunately, the volcano roll, asparagus roll and eel roll were drenched in a sweet sauce and so rich that they were inedible.  Epic fail on the overall sushi quality, which stinks since that is primarily what they serve.  The tempura we ordered was just okay, as well, but it was carry out, which is never a good idea for fried food.  

Overall, I would say that it wouldn't be m first choice of sushi bars in the area, but I would order some of the other items  If you do order sushi, ask them to avoid or go light on the sauces.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
Another fun Soulard Dive bar, I returned to D's Place on Saturday night after the Blues game to catch up with my friend's bachelor party.  I hadn't been here since I moved out of Soulard and the place hasn't changed.  

Plenty of games to play in the place, just watch your step moving from the bar area to the game room, especially if you've had a bit too much to drink and aren't paying attention.  Golden Tee, Big Buck Hunter, and Silver Strike were all still there with a dart board as well.  

Drinks aren't that expensive and they do have some interesting shots.  They have a sign above the entrance to the game room that has the special shots for that day.  Since I don't do shots (that often) I couldn't tell you what the featured shot was for Saturday night.  The Bartenders were great, especially when dealing with the rowdy crowd of the party I was with but a good time was had by all.  

Definitely one of the places I miss since moving out of Soulard.  Hope to come back again soon.
name: D's Place

text:
D's Place is a dive bar located in Soulard just blocks from the brewery. Since it is a dive bar, I am rating it accordingly. It's smoky, has lots of video games, a big domestic beer list, and it could do with a good cleaning. 

On the plus side, it is a combo neighborhood bar and brewery employee fave. So, there is a good cross section of people. They have karaoke on Mondays with a small, but fun group and the staff is nice. 

Another plus is that they actually serve good pub grub. Meaning the food is homemade, not over the top with breading on every item and not freezer to fryer. The pizza's, fried pickles, and burgers are homemade and yum. They also have a large variety of wings/sauces.
name: D's Place

text:
Tip of the day: If you order carry out, allow extra 10 minutes for your order. (It's worth the wait! Believe me ) 
Special rolls were HUGE! I'm enjoying the Maki rolls more now adays. I believe they are spicier here lately. Also, props to the server today! She prepared all the right goodies in the bag. I was so upset with myself because I forgot to ask for chopsticks. Guess what?! Yep! They're were a FEW packs of them! She also brought my order to the car because I was entertaining my dog  PLEASE EVERYONE EAT SUSHI HERE! I so love this place!
name: Fuji Sushi

text: I was craving sushi and decided to stop by on my way home for take out. I had seen this sushi restaurant before and did not have high expectations. For some reason sushi from Imperial Missouri does not sound the most appetizing. The place does not look so great from the outside but I was quite impressed with how authentic the restaurant looked on the inside. I ordered the rainbow roll and sake nigiri sushi to go. It only took the chef about 5 minutes to make. The fish tasted very fresh and I was pleasantly surprised. I will definitely come back.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
This is about as close to "your neighborhood watering hole" as it can get. It can go from quiet to party in a matter of minutes, so just be aware of that - it is Soulard after all. 

Biggest surprise about this place: the food! Their wings, spicy chicken sandwich, burgers, and pizza are all great. All homemade salad dressings. 

Service is typically one bartender and no servers, so be prepared to wait a bit. If you're not in a hurry, which you shouldn't be here, it's not a big deal.

Overall surprisingly good food for a neighborhood pub. Definitely worth stopping in.
name: D's Place

text:
I love Mike's advice... "It's a dive.  Know it, expect it, embrace it."

If you go there with that knowledge, D's won't let you down.  Simply put, people come here to get drunk.  And by people, I'm not excluding the bartenders or servers.  They're good at what they do and are up for coaxing you into a shot or two.  Julie, Jess, Michelle and Barbie have all successed in getting me loopy and I'm sure the whole lot of them could drink me under the table.

The service is much better at the bar than at the tables.  Many times the bartender is also the server so the closer to the bar you are the better your service may be.

The food here is average, but you're usually too drunk to tell.  I actually like their nachos.  It's not a pile of mess, they individually lay out and dress each chip.  

Don't come here on a first date.  Don't come here dressed to impress.  Don't come here expecting white glove service.  There are many other places in Soulard for those type of nights.  Come here to blow $40 on booze, food, and a juke box and be prepared to take a cab home.
name: D's Place

Give Tango a try for their Gourmet wonton size treats : you will not be disappointed.

text:
Wife ordered Eggs Benedict and I ordered Low Country Benedict. Hollandaise sauce on my wife's dish had a very thick consistency and was much darker yellow. Could benefited from adding a little lemon juice or water to thin it down. Flavor of sauce was ok. 

Low Country Benedict was ok, chicken was a little overcooked and dry but the biscuit was delicious.  (Pictured)

Took a little while to be helped after being sat then waitress forgot about the coffee we ordered. 

Not sure it was worth the $26.xx but we will give it another try in a few months and see if things smooth out. Always nice to see new establishments and definitely want to give money back to local business owners whenever possible.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text:
I have to be honest when i say that i have never really had much sushi, even thought i knew i would like it. With that said, myself and my faithful restaurant companion decided to take the VERY long hike (down the street literally!) to this place to try it out.

What did i think? AWESOME! I was super happy with both the service and the food and the prices! I decided to try one of their Bento Special. That had some tasty osumashi soup, salad and i tried the shrimp tempura - which then had some rice, california rolls and some shumai. Each part of the bento was delicious, and there was ALOT in it. I was suprised at how much was in the box. Excellent!


I will definitely have to come back and taste some more of their deliciousness! Yum!
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
Ate breakfast with a party of four and we were all underwhelmed. One person ordered the entree with eggs, pancakes and bacon.  The eggs and bacon were ok, nothing noteworthy. The pancakes were a short order and were very heavy to the point of rejecting half the order.  Another oder was just the pancakes.  Same complaint. Very thick and heavy.  I had the Denver omelet which I have mixed reviews. It was fully loaded with the incredients, however the veggies were cut into huge chunks that were not sautÃ©ed making them too crunchy to enjoy. Another big disappointment were the grits that had a bad under taste .  

The place also suffered from a new staff being unfamiliar with their jobs (slow server and the cashier not knowing how to operate the cash drawer).

We may be back in a few months and hopefully, by then, they will have gotten it on track.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text:
During my training here in St. Louis, I found this little gem serving up some really tasty steaks. I've had the ribeye and the T-Bone steak here and both were full of flavor. These steaks are marinated (possibly overnight) to get that deep, intense flavor. The steaks are not 2-3" thick but they aren't $20 steaks either. The ribeye sandwhich I had was $8 and the T-Bone steak dinner was $10. The steaks are juicy and tender.

I hear this place serves up some delicious wings as well. 12 piece wings for $10 is indeed a good value. Actually, everything on their menu from wings to steaks are of tremendous value. They even have gizzards here.

This is mainly a take-out place. There is a really small seating area with two tables and 4 chairs by the opposite wall of the counter. I've eaten there every time I went in and there was always space.  

You really can't beat a good seasoned steak grilled to perfection for $10 and less. You just can't.
name: Miami Grill

text:
This place isn't great. It's not bad. It's ok though. Their prices are pretty good, and they give you a lot of food for their dishes. Fried rice is dirt cheap here. But they're not even close to the best in town - especially considering Lam's neighbors.


They're cash only, and relatively quick. I only did take-out, and was fairly pleased with the responsiveness. Not the most polite folks, but I just wanted my food to go so it didn't really matter to me. 

If you're looking for a great place to eat, this is not it.
If you're looking for a quick in-and-out type of chinese takeout place, and price is your biggest factor, then Lam's might be for you.
name: Lam's Garden

text:
When looking to visit a bar in Soulard that I hadn't been to before D's place was the winner! I don't know why I never visited before, shame on me! 

We arrived on a Sunday night and it wasn't very packed at all. We managed to grab some seats at the bar and our server/bartender was quick to offer us drinks! The group I was with was ecstatic since they were able to play their hunting arcade game...but I just chose to watch and enjoy my beer. 

D's place had a nice menu, but I wasn't hungry. After seeing the food I can agree that I will go back and probably try some bar food-nothing beats some good bar food! 

Overall, this is a nice place in Soulard and I will go for another visit soon. Our server was great and the drinks were cold.
name: D's Place

text: Went to Miami Grill tonight for some late night food and it did not disappoint. The 1/2 burger and chicken tenders were spot on. The burger tastes better than ones from fancy restaurants and the fries & chicken tenders couldn't have been better. The seasoning on them is salty and flavorful. One tip: They actually make your food. So if you are in a hurry, call beforehand and place your order. We waited inside which was fine, but there were lots of people coming in and out with their take out orders. Very satisfied!
name: Miami Grill

text: If you can stand places that allow smoking, and enjoy good food and a good value, you should check D's Place out.  This is the neighborhood bar for many in Soulard.  First of all, drinks are much cheaper than anyplace else in the area (save Cat's Meow).  Just look around.  There are boards advertising early and late night happy hour.... shot specials for the night... 1/2 price deals during sporting events.  If you take some time to check out the specials before you order, you can save some cash.  Also, take time to read the food special board at the end of the bar.  It usually has some kind of item that is not on the regular menu.  Last night they offered a fish wrap.  It sounds kind of boring, but it was really good.  My wife loved her Ruben sandwich.
name: D's Place

text:
First time trying Tango and anything Argentinian. I am a fan.  Deep fried filled turnover-like pillows. Nice and fluffy dough, deep golden. Even though they were fully filled they didn't feel heavy. Tried a few different fillings as the menu had a lot of options. They can turn up the spice as requested. I prefer mild usually but the spicy beef and chicken both had a nice siracha-y kick. Mild Beef, chicken and spinach were all delicious. We gobbled those up first. Ham&cheese was good but felt more like breakfast, and the corn was like a cheese/corn fritter. Their chimichurri sauce was super garlicky delicious. A little goes a long way. Can't wait to try that on a grilled steak! Already told friends to try this place. We will be going back soon. 
Note: their shop is small and set up like a bakery with counter for ordering and pickup only. No seating.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
My ikhwan ( brothers) have talked about how good the food was at this place ever since it opened. So I finally decided to give it a shot and see what it was all about .

Well it's a straight 4 all day .So without further ado, let's get into it:

Ribeye sandwich 3.5/5-  I asked for the steak to be med-well. Chewy, tasty, flavorful. Almost had that Best Steak House # 1 on Grand Blvd taste back in the 1980's vibe and taste to. The 3 pickles looked like they was 3 mins past suspect. Lettuce and onions were fresh . I know a tomato came with it, but I can't remember much about it  because I only used the onions. Fries that came with it were hot and nicely seasoned.  

Carrot cake: 5/5 This thing right here..... is something oh so wonderful. Now when looked @ the cake I could see that the cake was the moist kind but man when I bit into that thang, I heard UGK's "I Left It Wet for You".. man it was so soft wet and juicy in the right places lol Ok let me get back to this cake.... It was that great. The raisins and perfect cut carrots flowed like the Nile River. The icing was not to sugary; it was just right to accent the "I left it wet for you Carrot cake. 

And to the makers of that cake (Warr's Gourmet Delicacies) ,please take that as the utmost complement!!!
name: Miami Grill

text:
I found out about D's Place when it was featured as the ROTD here on Yelp. When I arrived, I could tell from the outside it was a dive. Then when I entered, I smiled even more. I was a true dive bar. Or as Eric N.  said, in his ROTD, it is as close to "your neighborhood watering hole" as it can get. The proof was as I sat at the bar enjoying my lunch, all the other patrons greeted each other by name. That's a true neighborhood bar. 

My biggest dilemma was should I order wings or a burger. After getting recommendation from the bartender, I choose to go wings. Especially after I found out, I could choose two different flavors in one order. I went with my favorite, Lemon & Pepper and a bar favorite, Garlic Parmesan.

When ordering wings, I am a stickler for my order having the same amount of flats and drums. D's impressed me, they not only gave me the same amount of flats and drums in my order, they also made sure each flavor had the same amount. 

My wing pieces were good in size and fried to a crispy crunch. Being a true fan of Lemon & Pepper, it was my favorite. I love the tang of lemon and kick of pepper. I can see why their Garlic & Parmesan is a bar favorite. However, I would not recommend them on a date night. I say that with a smile, because they're garlic flavor as good as it was, it was strong. I guess if you share the order, with your date all would be good. (smile)

I was not impressed with the fries that I had as a side with my wings. I'm super picky about my fries and don't care for the type that are seasonally coated. I heard their onion rings are good, so when I come back to experience the, Hell Fire Burger that has fried jalapeÃ±os on it (another favorite of mine) I'll order onion rings as my side. 

Service was dive bar friendly. The bartender called all the other guest by their name. Not knowing mine, she just called me, "Babe" when she checked on me frequently. With only a single bartender covering the entire bar and tables, the service was attentive. 

I'll be back? - Hell Fire Burger is calling my name. 

When: September 11, 2019
Why: 9-4-19 ROTD on Yelp
name: D's Place

text:
In warmer months, I often walked my dog, Clyde, past D's Place in Soulard in the early evenings. Everytime we would pass, the aroma emanating from inside was far superior to what this neighborhood watering hole looks like on the outside.  I guess like they say, never judge a book by its cover! 

We are trying our best to support the local bars and restaurants in our new neighborhood as the lucrative summer months wane. Picking up a to go meal is such an easy way to help businesses in the area survive. Since we didn't have plans for dinner, I suggested trying D's. 

I'm giving D's a four star rating because of customer service. When I called in to place my order, the employee was very grumpy and not helpful. I simply asked how many slices were in a 10-inch pizza. (We were having a friend over for dinner as well, so I wanted to make sure we had plenty.) Because this was my first ever time trying D's food, I had no context of size or slice count. The person on the other side of the telephone threw me a little attitude saying "it's square cut. I don't know how many pieces it makes." Well then. Just the info about it being square cut slices was enough to give me an idea of how much I needed to offer. I would give D's a three because of the worker's curtness with me, but actually in these type of situations, it makes the Soulard bar feel more authentic. So hey. Great work creating a real dive bar vibe! (But maybe be a little nicer.)

The menu is pretty on par for what you'd expect for a local bar. Standard items like salads, wings, and sandwiches. I did appreciate the interesting specialty pizzas. When you have thin crust pizza, you might as well dress it up with something exotic! We took the gamble on the Spicy Special, described as Hot sauce, bacon, hamburger & cheddar jack cheese. I impulse bought the Cheesesteak pizza because it just sounded interesting with Pizza sauce topped with sautÃ©ed roast beef, onion, green pepper and pizza cheese. Both pizzas had a lot of flavor. The crust was crunchy with an every so slight doughy texture. And they were even better cold the next day. I would consider going back soon just to put a pie in the fridge overnight for breakfast!
name: D's Place

I usually tip 20+% for decent service.   The cashier asked how everything was to which I replied "terrible" and explained why it was so, to which she replied "I'm sorry you feel that way". text: How have I never heard of D's before I started looking for new bars to try during my 2021 re-enlightenment.  My first time there the waitress I believe her name was Jessica super nice to us gave some great suggestions for food and always followed up during a busy happy hour time. Everything we had was super fresh and tasted well. The buffalo chicken wontons are a must and if you're in a crowd you might want to order more than one appetizer! The white pizza actually comes with chicken on it see if you can substitute chicken for sausage. I added sausage to it but I think it would've liked it better without chicken either way it was good. Fried pickle chips are perfect and the crust stays on them pretty good unlike other places. The burger we ordered was a little dry so maybe next time order a medium to make sure they don't over cook it. However this would not stop me from returning.  I do look forward to enjoying their patio during the war months because the only downside is the dining room side is extremely loud and it's hard to talk/hear even when you're next to someone. I'm hoping to also try the bar side of the pub next time hoping it's not as loud. It definitely has a local vibe but like I said the waitress was very welcoming and everybody seem like they were just having a great time without any snobbery ... that's what makes Sue lard so great. I honestly don't want to share this because it's a great little secret.
name: D's Place

I had a harebrained idea that I wanted to eat empanadas for dinner, and was in St Charles. I had thought I couldn't find a place to get my empanadas, and once I decided I wanted empanadas, I just HAD to have them. 
Yelp came through for me!
I found Tango right in St Charles, off I70! Just my luck!
My luck just kept rolling on because the empanadas that they have, and there are four kinds, were a dream come true for a hungry girl. They were simply splendid!
A dozen or two dozen bought will get you 10% off, and three dozen scores 15% off!
They're simply wonderful here and Hector says that if you call ahead to order, he'd have it ready, piping hot, for you to pick it up. How wonderful!

I'm definitely coming back here. No doubt about that.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
It's easy to appreciate D's Place.

Not too many bars understand value around Soulard, but D's Place knows how to bring in patrons, good specials!  I love the specials at D's because it makes me want to spend more money there time and time again.

Yesterday I wanted to catch the Cards game since Chris Carpenter was making his season debut after missing most of the season.  It seemed like a good time to celebrate, despite the final outcome of the game.  D's Place offers half price pizzas, any pizza, during Cardinal games.  I ordered a large specialty pizza for $7.50.  I ate what I wanted while washing it down with two dollar domestics and took the rest home to share with my wife when she got home.

I had the D's Spicy Special: hamburger, bacon, jack cheese, and hot sauce, coupled with a side of ranch for dipping.  I'm not big on hot sauce, but with ranch, it makes for a nice pub snack.  Really I had my wife in mind; otherwise, I would have ordered a meat or chicken pizza.  Either way, I was pretty content.

D's has its few drawback.  First, it draws a lot of middle-aged men. I think the bartender appreciated me for not being an old creeper!  I was there for the game, not to be flirty and gross.  Also, it allows smoking, which, despite the new law, I think is completely okay.  Owners should not be forced to be non-smoking.  However, non-smokers should beware.

Great deals and good service, D's is an ideal place to relax after a long Friday or to catch a Cardinal game!
name: D's Place

text:
We came in on a Friday evening as it was starting to fill up. Mostly for a quick bite to eat. We had heard the pizza was good. We started with the toasted ravioli. It was pretty standard and delicious. We got three small sized bar pizzas. They were Buffalo chicken, chicken bacon ranch and pepperoni. The two chicken pizzas were delicious! Had great flavors. Good ingredients and a thinner, crispy crust. The pepperoni pizza was good, but the crust didn't get as crunchy as the other two. Would have liked to see it cooked another minute or two. 

Drinks were good. The bartenders were nice. Would definitely go back if I were in the area again. Had been drinking several hours. Forgot pictures. I'll do better next time.
name: D's Place
