text:
I have Chinese cuisine maybe 2 times a year max. It's just not my thing, but.... when I have it, there are only 2 places I will get it from and Lam's is 1 of 2.  Located in U. City, this place has been here forever. They've changed their ordering process due to Covid, there is a walk up window on the left side of the building. They will take orders on site, but recommended to call ahead. 15 min is all you need to have hot food in your hand. I walked up and ordered, was given a number and told to wait in my car as they would call the number over the loud speaker. 15 min later, heard my number, grabbed the bags and done.
1/2 order Chicken Lo Mein, Whole order Fried Rice combo Beef and Chicken, 4 egg rolls and 1 order crab Rangoon. 
No complaints from me, it's StL's finest. See y'all next year.
name: Lam's Garden

They're simply wonderful here and Hector says that if you call ahead to order, he'd have it ready, piping hot, for you to pick it up. How wonderful!

I'm definitely coming back here. No doubt about that!
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
After coming here for a Yelp Elite event, I knew I had to bring Hubby back. We came nearing the end of November because I HAD TO HAVE those pumpkin pancakes before they weren't on the menu anymore. 

When we arrived we waited more than 5 minutes for an employee to acknowledge us or the couple of people waiting to pay. This did not start the visit off well - especially since multiple employees had come by the area but none of them acknowledged us or the others waiting to pay. If I had not already been here before with amazing service, I would have left before they did acknowledge us and seat us. 

Our server was nice and let me know they did still have the pumpkin pancakes (they were not on the menu). She made some recommendations to Hubby as he was undecided. When the pancakes came out, they did not taste like the last time I had them and I was disappointed - they were very thick and heavy. I ate them and just went with it. Overall none of the food was hot - even the coffee was only warm. That was unusual. 

After getting the bill and going to pay I noticed that it said pancake full order on my receipt. I would have preferred knowing there were options when I ordered as I did not need the large size I received. 

Overall the visit was disappointing and not the same service, food or experience I had during the Elite event.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text:
Here is a brief primer on Miami Grill, for those of you who are either unaware that it exists, or afraid to eat there, both of which are understandable.

Where it's located: The Miami Grill is located down in the crotch region of St. Louis County, not too far from the city limits. You might find some of the nearby street names familiar, if like me you regularly check the crime reports in the Post-Dispatch "for your own personal amusement." The street directly adjacent to it is one way, but it's impossible to tell which way that is, because the sign is broken. If you get caught driving down it either way, you'll probably get charged out the ass by one of these corrupt North County municipalities where the mayor drives a Cadillac with personalized plates, and everyone in his family pulls down a six figure salary from the city (and yet they all still live in Pine Lawn), including his umpteen baby's mothers. Across the street is the world's sketchiest no tell motel a/k/a sleep n fuck. Next door is the world's sketchiest car dealership. Directly behind the Miami Grill is a small tenement building or duplex where a group of guys stands out front at all hours of the day and night (but maybe just to get some fresh air).

What they serve: Chicken wings. It's actually listed as both a steakhouse and a place to get chicken wings, and it's worth noting that they take their status as a steakhouse seriously (despite themselves). On the west side of the building, there's a big-ass picture of a steak dinner. It says you can get a t-bone steak dinner there for $10. The sign out front lists steak first and foremost, along with chicken wings, fish, shrimp, phillies and gyros. If you call them on the phone and ask them what they serve (srsly), they mention the t-bone dinner, the rib eye dinner, the chicken wings and then a few other things. I've been there a million times and mostly just got the chicken wings. I did try the $10 t-bone dinner once, out of morbid curiosity, and it wasn't half that bad. It falls somewhere in between that steak you would get on Steak Night in the cafeteria in college and a steak dinner it would cost you like $13 to make for yourself. It's the Kindle Fire of steak dinners: Anyone who would actually buy one shouldn't be allowed to complain. Not just about steak dinners - about anything. LOL

Which kind of wings you should get, Miami or Chicago: Chicago. This is essentially a choice between a "naked" wing (Miami) and a breaded wing (Chicago, duh), with the caveat that I'm not sure if the Miami wing is just a raw chicken wing dipped in hot oil and sprinkled with some sort of seasoning. The skin is a deep, dark brown, almost black, and I'm not sure why exactly. I would compare the taste to those Tyson Foods tequila lime chicken wings, but not disgusting. The breading on the Chicago-style wings bears an eery similarity to the shit they use to bread the fish. It's relatively light and thin for fried chicken skin a/k/a the black man's kryptonite, but it's not too mealy, and it'll run you about half as much as the wings at, say, Popeyes, two doors down. It has a nice crispness that holds up to a requisite liberal dousing with hot sauce, which is supplied in its own mini celebrity hot tub. I recommend just dumping the entire thing onto your wings. If you accidentally get some on your fries and the two pieces of white bread they give you (this being a hood joint and all), consider that an added bonus.
name: Miami Grill

text:
I understand there is some businesses with diminished staff through this crisis. However if you advertise to be open for curbside service I would expect the food to be actually cooked. It's breakfast. It shouldn't take 1/2 hour to bring to the car. Especially when you say it will be 14 minutes. Plus they forgot napkins and utensils. 
The quality of cuisine was horrible. It's like they just asked anyone who wanted to work that shift. Cooking experience or not. $30 for bad service and crappy, unhealthy, undercooked eggs and potatoes??!!!  Stay away and save your money. Just stay closed until you get your game together. I feel fleeced.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text: Nice little shop with owners that you can tell love what they do. Super sweet people. The empanadas were freshly made and we sampled a variety of them. I'm not sure if it was the parsley or the oregano, but the flavor profile was good with the first bite, but as you progressed it got harder to eat. My favorite was the meat, I wasn't a fan of the chicken. The Caprese was really well done, but the ham and pineapple overly seasoned. The onion and cheese was like an onion ring, very well done while the corn one was hardly edible. It was just kind of a mixed bag. Some good, some ok, some not so ok. Glad we tried it, not sure I'd be in a hurry to go back though. A shame as the owners were so nice, I love local restaurants, but life is to short to stick with just ok.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
I've heard some buzz about this restaurant for a while now, and had it bookmarked on Yelp to give it a try. I finally did. I am so glad I did. I am sad I waited this long. 
The dining area is very nicely decorated, super clean and orderly. I walked up to the counter and met a very nice man, I believe he is the owner. I told him this was my first visit, but have heard great things about Tango. He opened the menu in front of me and began telling me about it, and about all the authentic Argentinian ingredients. The prices are really reasonable and I chose four different empanadas to try. 
My food was brought out and each one was prepped differently as far as the shape of the fried dough. I was told they are deep fried. Amazingly, they were not at all greasy. I was also told what each of the empanadas were since you can't really tell when looking at them. 
I took my first bite and was hooked. Delicious! The golden brown dough was fried to perfection. Each of the four empanadas I tried was so different from each other, but so good and packed with flavor. 
I will be back. 
Support local!
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
So excited to visit the new location with a dining room.   

The decor is fantastic, they really did a wonderful job with the dining room and counter.   Plenty of seating, with 4 big flat screens playing soccer, and tango dance competitions.   Music playing.  

The menu is expanded from the previous location, but very similar, pretty much all empanadas, but a lot of variety of flavors and ingredients.    Some interesting choices.  

The food is all made to order and served hot and fresh.   Both spicy and mild dishes were served, along with a caprese (which was delicious!).   

The empanadas are a little on the small side, you will want 3 or more per person for a meal.   But it's a great way to try a bunch of different flavors!!

Stop in an enjoy a trip to Argentina!
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
There are only 5 empanadas to choose from. That's it. No sides, no drinks (didn't see any.) This is a very tiny, no frills very clean smelling little establishment. Best for take out. They could ease up on the chemical cleaners, a little over powering.

I had the spicy beef and corn empanadas. Both very tasty little treats. The spicy beef was very flavorful and didn't have spiced heat, just good seasonings. The corn empanada was very creamy and fabulous. $2.99 each so these little goodies can add up quickly. Two were a snack and not enough for a meal.

The owner was very friendly and takes great pride in his delicious little creations. I recommend you give it a try.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

categories: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Food, Tex-Mex, Cafes, Restaurants

text: I followed Tango on the festival scene for years and was thrilled when they finally opened a brick and mortar location a couple of years ago. They only serve empanadas at $3 each. I always get the spicy beef empanadas and they are outstanding. The dough is always crisp, yet soft, and the middle contains a flavorful mixture of ground beef, olives, and seasoning. I find 3-4 empanadas to be enough for a meal. I crave them constantly and it can be hard since they are only open for dinner starting at 4pm and are closed Sunday and Monday. I especially enjoy going on Wednesdays and Thursdays since you get 10% off your order. I always call ahead and pick up the empanadas to go. The restaurant is designed more for carry-out orders, though there are a few seats. The empanadas are made entirely by hand and the family that runs the business is extremely friendly and kind.
name: TANGO Argentina Food

text:
This is the real deal.  I almost didn't try it because I read that it had a very small dining area.  Actually, I would describe the dining area as "quaint".  The dining area is sectioned off from the main counter to create a cozy area with 5 tables.  We went for dinner and there was sit down table service.  The waitress did a great job keeping all 5 tables happy.  The food is EXCELLENT and the menu is full of choices.  The prices are very reasonable.   It was an enjoyable evening and we will be back.  
This place is in the corner of a strip mall.  From the outside, it looks like a carry out place (and I'm sure they do plenty of carry out).  But go in and give the sit down service a try.  You may be as pleasantly surprised as I was.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text: We eat chick fil a at least once a week. This is by far the worst location I've been to. I am an A-List member and I handed it to the young guy and he swiped it and threw it on the counter at me. The counter was all sticky with soda. I picked up my sticky card, getting my hand and other cards sticky, and told him next time he should hand the customer back their card and they need to clean their counters. I think he said sorry but he did not wipe the counter. The next lady sat her purse on it. What a mess. The staff is not of top of things. The chesterfield location is the standard of how chick fil a's should operate. Courteous staff, friendly, and clean. The food was hot and fresh, and for that 2 stars instead of 1.
name: Chick-fil-A

text: I've been a loyal customer of Hunan Yu for 20 years, but my past two experiences have been so disappointing I needed to share. The first was a large delivery order to celebrate Chinese New Year with friends Feb15, most recent was tonight. In both cases, the delivery did not include any steamed rice. And when I called no apologies were given, and it took almost an additional hour for someone to bring out the rice. Tonight they hung up on me and I had to call twice to resolve. Read another review here that suggested ownership may have recently changed. Would make sense to me as I had nothing but wonderful experiences until this year. Sorry to say I will not be back.

text:
I love my co-workers. We're always ordering in for each other. Usually it's pizza, but on this cold day my assistant manager declared "Chinese!" So we searched on Yelp for nearby Chinese delivery places and settled on Hunan Yu thanks to all the great reviews.

Well....I've had better. Many times. I ordered General Tso's chicken with egg drop soup and an egg roll. Now I love spicy food - LOVE - but I've never had Chinese food that was spicy enough for me. So I ordered my chicken "extra spicy"! So I open up my container and dig in...to my not even remotely spicy General Tso's chicken. I don't mean that it just wasn't extra spicy as requested, but it wasn't the least bit spicy AT ALL! As far as I'm concerned it was just chicken in a sauce whose flavor I couldn't quite put my finger on.

Now, the egg drop soup. Always been a favorite of mine. But it was extra thick and the taste wasn't quite right. Even my super nice manager, who said his sweet and sour shrimp was great, said that the soup "tastes like soap."

Considering how many Chinese delivery places there are, I'd try some other places before ordering from this one again.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
This was my first time ordering from here. My normal Chinese restaurant did not have a driver this evening and I was tied up doing things around the house so I decided to branch out and try somewhere different. The online ordering was convenient and the driver was nice and the food arrived on time and hot. If I was rating on convenience they'd get all five stars, but my review is based on the food.

I ordered shrimp egg foo yung with fried rice and crab Rangoon. The fried rice was still white, not even tan... the fried rice I am accustomed to is at least tan if not a nice brown color. It was incredibly bland and looked unappetizing. The egg foo young itself wasn't bad at all, but the gravy that comes with it had cinnamon in it, which was not a pleasing twist on the staple recipe, and the shrimp- while there was a generous amount- was overcooked and rubbery. The crab Rangoon were also disappointing, they didn't have much flavor or filling. 

I would probably give a second chance and try something different- no fried rice or crab Rangoon and no shrimp- but I would only try again in a pinch because of the convenience. Otherwise I'll stick to my standard place.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
I first experienced Chick-fil-A while attending college at SEMO (I will NOT tell you how long ago...), and it has been a favorite since then. It's on the more costly end of fast food restaurants, but the taste of the chicken far outstrips other fast food places, and even most sit-down restaurants! Their chicken is not over processed chicken product, but great cuts of real chicken breast, lightly but flavorfully breaded & juicy (Now I'm hungry). They also have some of the BEST lemonade and when I used to work nearby, I would often take home a gallon jug to keep at home (just be on the lookout for seeds, this is the real deal). Also, (a college friend turned me on to this), mix the honey mustard with a packet of mayo to dip the waffle fries in...it's life affirmingly good. They also serve breakfast, but I have yet to try it as they don't have one close to my home (almost a reason to move).

They are closed on Sunday so their workers can have the day to devote to their families and the Lord. While this can be disappointing when I'm out on a Sunday, I respect that they're not only standing by their beliefs, but also making sure their employees can have a decent family life. It just makes me like them more.

Recommended Items:
Chicken Sandwich (breaded chicken breast+toasted bun+pickles = delish)
Nuggets (also dip in Honey Mustard/Mayo mixture!)
Grilled Chicken Sandwich (I prefer grilled everywhere but here, but it's still good!)
Chicken Salad Sandwich
Grilled Chicken Cool Wrap
Hearty Breast of Chicken Soup (almost like homemade, FANTASTIC when you're ill)
Waffle Potato Fries (mmmm)
Fruit Cup (it's fresh fruit, not some junk in syrup, so yummy)
LEMONADE!!!
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
This was quite the experience, and to be honest with you based on the food I would have likely gone with a three-star review as it wasn't bad. However, the overall experience made it deserving of a two-star review.

Hsu's Hunan Yu is located in a small strip mall, parking itself is limited, and the inside is small however there is enough room for four booths for seating. I would likely encourage another option than dining in because they had a portable space heater that felt like the fire of Hades had expanded into the dining area, making the experience uncomfortable. I feel that carry out and delivery is what keeps this place in business. 

When we first arrived, we were greeted with a less than enthusiastic how can I help you, which wouldn't have been an issue on its own but it likely signaled the start of a downhill dining experience. After ordering, we grabbed a table and waited, and continued to observe the employee who seemed to become annoyed any time the phone rang. On one occasion we overheard the employee venting and swearing in the back. Apparently, a customer had called in, and they didn't have their order, he repeatedly told the customer that they had to have called the wrong restaurant, only to discover after hanging up that the order was placed online and took time to process. The highlight of my visit had to be when I overheard the employee storm into the back and yell, "Call me when's delivery comes in, I don't want to be here all fucking day". 

As far as my food goes, the hot braised pork seems to have more breading than actual pork, but the sauce was tasty as was the rice. Lunch specials offer very reasonable value for those looking for a quick, cheap lunch.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
It's fast food, yes. It's not very refined, yes. It's fried, yes. It's a company whose core values I completely disagree with, yes. I really like Chick-fil-A though. I always have. I ate the nuggets when I was a kid at Chesterfield Mall and they still taste the same. They are crispy and fresh and taste like real chicken instead of a mystery. Their sauces are great. Today I ordered nuggets for breakfast! Their employees are friendly. I'll pass on their politics but the food is always good.

*I'd hate for someone to swab the play area and test what they find in there. I avoid that area like the plague when I go in.
name: Chick-fil-A

Order online!   Really efficient!   http://www.hsushunanyu.com/products.html

Standard Chinese takeout fare, but done really well.   Selection of canned sodas is overwhelming....Cherry Coke Zero?  Fantastic!   
I got my order to go, and food was still smokin' hot by the time I got to eat at my destination 30 minutes later  -  although it did melt through the styrofoam container :-( .       
Fried wonton and crab rangoon were not the best ever, but still OK for cheap takeout.
Menu says lunch specials come with fried rice, but what I got was more like brown rice.   Not a big deal to me (preferred, actually), but just wanted to make note for any future Yelpers who enjoy a meal here!
Very friendly staff...made certain I had everything I needed before I left.

Can't overstate it enough....really, really impressed with online ordering option.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:

categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: The quality has changed.   They are under new management and are in the middle of a remodel.   We stopped by for a late lunch/early dinner around 3:30.   The guy at the counter asked if we were there for a pick up.  We said no, we wanted to sit down and order.   He sighed and rolled his eyes and said,   "most people don't eat in at this time".   Really?  guess he didn't want to wait on us.   We ordered a couple of the special dinners and when he brought our soup to the table he stood with the tray in his hands and waited for me to serve the soup to my husband and myself.      The hot and sour soup has always been my favorite.  Not anymore.  It use to have tons of tofu, pork, veggies in a tart but spicy base.  All we got this time was a bowl of thick goo with very little taste.  The crab ragoon was greasy and flavorless  (nothing crab like in my ragoon)  ..  Soon after we received our orders another guest came in.   He again asked if she was there to pick up....   I overheard her say "no we are going to sit down".    Then I heard him let go with another aggravated sigh.      I guess they don't want afternoon business.    They should just close down after lunch service if they do not want the business.    Don't think we will be going back.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
I've had delivery from here twice because I try to maximize my cleaning time by not leaving the house at all on one of my days off and it's just way too hot to go out for lunch anyway.  Today was the most recent delivery I've had and sadly, they messed up my order.  I did not call or have it fixed as I am hungry and didn't want to wait anymore.  I ordered a full order of beef fried rice and got an order chicken fried rice.  I double checked my order on my screen as I still have it and yes, it is for a full order of beef fried rice.  I also ordered a full order of general tso's chicken without the white rice.  It came the way I specified and they also added a small container of steamed broccoli on the side which was nice.  

Delivery takes anywhere from 30-45 minutes from here.  I don't remember what I ordered the first time but it was correct and I liked the flavors.  It's not the best Chinese food I've had but it's pretty acceptable in a pinch.  With that said, my general tso's today was actually pretty good, quite saucy and the chicken pieces were not over-breaded.  So that definitely got a thumbs up from me.

With that said, I will definitely order from here again on one of those gaming or cleaning days when I don't feel like leaving the house.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
Chick-fil-a is one of my favorite fast food places to hit up! This location is particularly great -- new-ish, free-standing (unlike the mall counterparts...though there are lots of free standing stores popping up), and convenient location for me.

When I make the great decision to go to CFA, I am pleased. It is very clean inside the restaurant, even the bathrooms (one of the few fast food bathrooms I visit -- I'm bathroom weird!). Staff are friendly and courteous (though the 'my pleasure' phrase can get tired). They are thoughtful with extras -- I love those ketchup containers! The food is hot, fresh, and delicious -- and man, can they make a good chicken breast! If I'm craving a good chicken sandwich, CFA is where you will find me!

My beefs (ha!): sometimes when I order no pickles, they are on there. And by then the juice has saturated the bun and my chicken. It's a whole thing.

WHY closed on Sunday? I inevitably find myself craving some CFA on a random Sunday only to find myself disappointed with the closed sign when I cruise past :'( True heartbreak.

In closing: Keep opening more CFAs! Keep up the good work! Political issues aside, you are the bomb!
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
Our absolute favorite Chinese restaurant, Hunan Royal on Tesson 
Ferry in Dierbergs plaza, is closed due to coved 19, so we went to Hunan Yu for the first time in over three years.  I remembered it being very good, but I must say we were very disappointed this time.  We got Kung Pao Shrimp, Chicken Fried Rice and crab Rangoon, our standard order at Hunan Royal.  Nothing was anywhere near as good as at Hunan 
Royal.  We have become very spoiled by their consistent high quality.  My shrimp were 1/2 the size of those at Hunan 
Royal and we're overcooked, tough and dry.  The fried rice had very little taste and the crab Rangoon were tough and chewy.  If I had to rate the meal, I would give it a four or five out of ten....meh!  We are anxiously awaiting the reopening of Hunan Royal, the only local Chinese we will go to from now on.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text:
When it comes to reviewing fast food, you have to compare it to fast food. Obviously I'd eat a whole list of other places before Chick-fil-A but sometimes there is a time and a place for these kinds of eats. 

Chick-fil-A is pretty much a top tier fast-food joint when you ask me. Clean restaurants, nice staff and a great menu. I could probably eat like 50 chicken nuggets in one sitting. And their waffle fries are bomb. While nothing beats McDonald's fries, these are pretty great. 

While I'm sure nothing here is fresh, it doesn't taste as greasy as most other fast food joints. I'll take one of their chicken sandwiches any day. Also, their breakfast ain't bad either.
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
Chesterfield is devoid of decent Chinese restaurants, it seems, unless we are missing something.  We just wanted a quick Chinese lunch today and were partway to 88 China so decided to give it a second try.  We understand these strip mall Chinese places are never great, but had been here once before and it seemed to be a little better than most.  I think we stand by that rating.  Truly the current 2-1/2 star rating is about right.  There is Valley Wok, Hunan Express on Clarkson and Panda Express.  None of these are worth returning to.

We had very large servings of Chicken and Broccoli and Szechuan Chicken and Shrimp.  There were plenty of vegetables.  We liked the vegetable egg roll.  My Szechuan chicken was in a sweet, clear reddish sauce a little too much like sweet and sour for me.  Next time I will see if I can find something with a darker, less sweet sauce and would order extra spicy.  The sauce was also very heavily applied.  I fished my food out of the sauce.  The sauce overwhelms the flavors of the food.  

As I say, we did not go in expecting great food.  It was OK, not profound.  I think we will return for lack of anything better.  That is not a strong testimonial, I fear, but there it is.  We had simply bad food at Panda Express and Hunan Express.  We felt this was better than Valley Wok.  China In Bombay is probably better, but we did not want to drive that far today.
name: 88 China
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: So this place is basically the city version of Westport Social.... And it's better. Drinks aren't horribly priced, but they're higher than a South City bar for sure (think CWE pricing). Patio is huge and has a lot of room. Inside has games like Skeeball, ping-pong, arcade games, etc. After this pandemic is over, I can see this place being insanely popular, as it should be as it's really cool. They do have loud music outside as they have a stage for DJs, performers, etc. I'll be back often.
name: Sports & Social STL

text:
This place was suggested by the Eat24 app for delivery. 

BLEH. Don't even bother with it. 

While delivery was prompt and the food arrived hot, it was just not good. 

The crab sticks were so chewy and off tasting I spit it out. I wasn't exactly expecting real crab at that price but this didn't taste fresh at all. 

The fried wontons are also incredibly chewy, and I mean the skins not the filling. The filling had no flavor at all. I also got wonton soup, which was full of the same disappointing wontons only they were boiled instead of fried, so they were even more off putting. The broth was pretty water too. 

The beef skewers were cooked to the point of jerky, and the marinade or glaze was just sickly sweet.

The beef fried rice just looked gross and I didn't bother eating it. The meat was completely gray, the veggies were pale, and it was just so, so greasy.
name: 88 China
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: Always good - and consistently!  Friendly and pleasant staff. Prompt service. Clean dining room, restrooms, and parking lot. Never a complaint here.
name: Chick-fil-A

I'd give it another shot, but am disappointed in the lack of service I had while I was there.

text: Outstanding food and amazingly efficient service!  The rewards program is good and during COVID 19 having the ability to pay within the app makes visits even safer. Best things on menu are bacon, egg and cheese bagel (warm, toasty and will fill you up till lunch), Cobb salad (huge portion, great avocado lime ranch dressing), chocolate shakes (best shake anywhere), and the original chicken sandwich (perfect temperature, moist, thick, high quality chicken).  Employees seem happy and every visit are professional, pleasant and super organized which makes you sad they are closed on Sundays.

text: We are always searching for great tacos and were thrilled when we found this place.  My boyfriend is from Mexico City and a chef and is very picky about where he eats.  This place was a huge hit.   The three salsas we tried were all great, spicy and still tasty.  The avacado salsa was my favorite.  The store is great too lots of things that brought him back to his childhood (40+ years ago) they had which He was excited about.  Will be back soon!!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
Something STL really has lacked for awhile are good street tacos. That's why I am so glad this place opened up in the Twin Oaks area. This is a Mexican grocery store and resturant combined. I only got the street tacos but I'm excited to try the rest of their menu. You walk in and order your food at the register. Service is extremely friendly as it is family owned. There's hightop seating and regular tables for you to sit down and wait for your food but you could also shop around in the grocery store section. The food is picked up fresh from the kitchen. 

Now the tacos: pollo asada used chicken thigh it seemed and it was delicious. Good choice using dark meat as it was very juicy!Al pastor was phenomenal and the lengua was sooo good. They can provide salsa with your order. 100% recommend the avacado salsa!!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
My neighborhood Chinese carryout.  We are SO LUCKY to have this fine Chinese restaurant in our backyard.  They deliver,  they do carryout,  and there are a few tables at which you can dine in.  There's a daily special which is always delicious.
 I've been a happy customer for over 25 years. DAMN I'm getting old!

text:
After circling around this crazy lot, we decided to dine in at this busy location. It was very busy on a Saturday afternoon, but we were able to find a table, and it was clean! Despite how packed it was, servers called loudly to make sure you heard your order come up. There are free refills, but the machine resides behind the counter, and I was bummed to have to wait in line-- but the second I walked up with my cup, I was noticed, and my drink order was taken, just like that! I was impressed I didn't have to wait, and grateful. The staff also made rounds checking on everyone if they needed anything. They definitely went above and beyond here to make it an enjoyable fast food experience.

I ordered the asian style salad- crispy chicken and other delicious toppings. It was pretty good, but nothing life changing. Overall, I enjoyed my experience way more than I thought possible for fast food. Keep up the great work!
name: Chick-fil-A

text: Love this place. The lady up at the front is super nice to us whenever we go. They sell various products and food items, plus there's a small eatery inside and I usually get their street tacos or soup of the day. Relatively fast service so we never wait long for food. They also serve a special drink like melon water, horchata, different flavor depending on the day. My kiddo usually gets chicken quesadilla followed by a popsicle. Casual and friendly ambience, highly recommended
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
I have been coming to this place almost weekly for about 6 months. .  And for a reason.  They serve authentic Mexican food.  Having spent my college years in San Antonio, Texas, I learned what real Mexican food was, and what it tasted like.  It's hard to find that same authentic Mexican flavor once you leave Texas.  Especially in Missouri.  But once you spend any amount of time in El Jarocho, you realize it's the real deal.  Authentic Mexican food that rivals any US border town.  

I've been in this store several times during lunch hour to find that most of the people there are Mexicans.  If the Mexicans are going there for lunch, then that says something about the authenticity of their food!

The Barbacoa street tacos are to die for.  My wife loves the Pescado (fish) tacos. And my favorite salsa is the Avocado salsa.  Just the right blend of avocados and spice.  Tons of flavor, but not so hot you can't taste it.  

And while you are waiting for your freshly cooked food, you can browse through their Mexican store, which is complete with authentic Mexican items.   It feels like you are shopping in a store in Mexico!  

If you are looking for an authentic piece of Mexico in Missouri, look no further!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: Every now and then my mom and I come here, the workers are very very friendly and the place is always clean and the food is so good!!! We always ask for sauce each visit!!

text: I can't figure out how this place has received mediocre reviews. We love it. I've gone to many West county Chinese places and no other place gets it right. categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text:
I have been looking for good, authentic, street tacos for the better part  of my life spent here in the STL (18 years).   Looked thru Yelp, read these reviews, and within 5 minutes of that, took off to search for the place.  

In a small shopping strip, hides this jewel in Valley Park - Stone Gate Strip Mall - off of Big Bend, near Fritz's Custard.  

I have finally found GREAT STREET TACOS!

Located within the store, the food counter is near the back, but you have to order at the cashier station.  I ordered 2-Carne Asada and 1-Pollo Street Tacos.  Nikki (who is very welcoming and friendly) suggested I try the Verde, Roja and Avocado salsa to go w/the tacos and I'm glad she did!  All 3 were delicious, which made my tacos even better (although the meat was very flavorful - it honestly didn't need the enhancement of the salsa.  But what are tacos without salsa??  It's like PB&J without the J.....but I digress......)

The picture and my review really don't give these tacos justice.   Just go and eat here.  Place is the bomb.......
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
Tis the seasoning!  Not a typo...but a little like Christmas in July.  
Just open for 2 1/2 months, this little gem should be on your list for street tacos.  Amazing!  
Wife works the register at the front (where you place your order or call it in for pick up or curbside service), husband works in the back making street tacos and sandwiches.  There are four tables, seat yourself, so that's an option too. Service was outstanding...friendly, helpful, order ready in record time. I can only comment here on the tacos and will probably never make a change in the future to their sandwiches because tacos are just that good.  
So back to my opening comment...without the proper seasoning, most food never makes it to that next level of flavor.  Well it sure does here.  Everything from the cebollitas (fried green onions - be sure to try) to the tacos (carne asada, al pastor and daily special when I went...champechanos) were truly delicious.  There were many more taco options, some of which I will be trying soon...maybe not the cow tongue but hey, there is something for everyone.  Onions and cilantro are options on all tacos which are all made with corn tortillas...tortillas that didn't break even by the time we got our carry out home.  
You might be thinking...where are the mouth watering pictures?  Well, that was my plan until I saw my neighbor eating here who had to return after eating here just yesterday.  It's that good!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
THE SERVICE HERE SUCKS! the managers are ridiculous. I placed a breakfast mobile order at 10:25am and got to the drive thru just minutes from the 10:30am cut off time for breakfast and my order was not made and it would not go through. They said this  independentLy owned location and thats how it works. When i was able to do this a few times before and no problems. 

 I walked in and talked to the managers myself and they are just rude and unprofessional. I am definitely not going back here anymore. Sadly this is one of my favorite locations due to close to home, PLEASE HIRE EMPLOYEES  one of them name is cierra (unsure of spelling) WITH MANNERS who can solve a situation professionally.

Considering the game was starting, we were surprised that this spot wasn't packed, it was really easy to maneuver and get around. We even got a game of Ski Ball in, which was awesome.

We didn't eat here, so I can't speak on that, but I'd you're looking for good drinks, cheaper prices than the stadium, and food service before the game, this is the spot!

text: I happened upon this new business in the Stonegate shopping center after I got my hair cut. I needed a quick lunch and saw their banner that said "street tacos" so I decided to try it. These were the BEST tacos I have had!  They were so full of flavor and their salsas were great too. I had 2 carne asada (steak) tacos and 2 El Pastor (pork and pineapple) tacos. Since my first visit less than 2 weeks ago I have been back three times!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: This place is really good. I only give it 4 because out of the 2 or 3 times I've ordered it seems like something isn't consistent. The first time the rice was tasteless and then the egg roll wasn't good another time. That said this is one of my favorite Chinese places now. Their chicken wings are absolutely delicious and tasty and the pork lo mein is the best I've had. The portions are good, the combination plate is a little more than the average place but it's not too bad. Highly recommend.
name: 88 China
categories: Restaurants, Chinese

text: I usually go to this location but I'm not happy . I work down the street and didn't have time to turn around on my lunch to talk to a manger my deluxe chicken sandwich had a fly on it and my sweet tea had a fly in too. I'm 9 months pregnant so it ruined my appetite and probably the nastiest thing that's ever happened to me when eating. A waste of $9 and my time.
name: Chick-fil-A

text: Sports & Social STL is a great place to eat before a Cardinals game. You are able to get amazing food for about the same as bad food in the ballpark. The service was nice and helpful at answering questions. I ordered the Avocado Ranch Burger and it was really good. The combination of Ranch and Avocado really played off each other and created a nice relaxing burger. It came with fries, which I wasn't very happy about, but they were surprisingly good. They were and nice texture with lots of salt so they had lots of taste. This is the second great experience my family has had at Sports and Social and they have earned themselves 5 stars.
name: Sports & Social STL

text: I  called to ask if they offered delivery and was told that they did within a 4 mile radius. Since I was at a hotel within the radius, I ordered delivery at 8:22 and was told it would be about 45 minutes. An hour later I called to get an estimated time of when it might be delivered and I was told that it's on it's way. 30 minutes after that, I called again since I still hadn't received my delivery and was told that the delivery person's car tire was flat and it would be a few minutes longer. Another 30 minutes later I called to cancel my order since it was past 10 PM at this point. The man answered and when I asked to cancel my order- he said "okay sorry." And disconnected the phone.. I don't know what the food was like but I won't waste my time at this place again.
name: Hsu's Hunan Yu

text: The street tacos are so good, I had them for lunch 3 days in a row. Melt in your mouth. Side of beans and rice are authentic and so flavorful. Can't wait to try more of their food. It is a limited menu, but that only means specialized excellent food. You won't get the heavy carb plain Americanized food here. Store items are great as well!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican
